Nose Comment:
The nose is full of aromatic power. We still have a little touch of solvent.
Leather, orange peel, star anise.
Plum, prunes, dates, figs, clementine, passion fruit peel.
Old dry wood, dust, old book.
We have aromas of old rum, Demerara, and almost a little cane sugar.
Taste Comment:
On the palate it is surprisingly fresh and "almost" light.
Fresh apricot, pineapple, passion fruit, guava, papaya.
It is very tropical.
But the dominant remains woody, with pretty spices.
Cloves, anise, pepper, bitter chocolate, cinnamon, nutmeg. They are all there.
We have fresh mint, some dry aromatic herbs.
A little barbecue charcoal, smoke.
Finish Comment: Long finish on liquorice, camphor, smoke, ash and barbecue, light peat.\nPepper, cloves, fresh mint.\nIt's long, comforting, it feels like you're at the edge of the fireplace.

Nose Comment: Fresh, rich, intensive, complex, fruity, plums, ripe bananas, mango, pineapples, passion fruit, sweet and smooth oak wood, little pipe tobacco, touch of vanilla and much more - I can't list everything
Taste Comment: Oh yes, smooth, warm, sweet oak wood, little vanilla, oily, liquorice, mellow, dried fruits, dark fruits again, prunes, milk chocolate, little toffee - just superb!
Finish Comment: Long, warm, very smooth oak lingering - neverending. Does not need water - with water the finish becomes even more honeyish.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 98.0]: Long, warm, very smooth oak lingering - neverending. Does not need water - with water the finish becomes even more honeyish.

Nose Comment: Like a chimera of Genting King and Honey Rum. There are not many wood elements, but you can imagine the old barrels, mahogany furniture, walnuts, reddish brown leather goods, a bit of dirty grease in it, Italian vinaigrette, wood lacquer, a little hummus With Texas roast beef, the direction of peat is incense, hemp rope and barbecue. It is too sweet under the influence of Sherry Cask, honey, HP-style sherry, 35% chocolate, dry black fruit jam, nine-made plum, cough syrup. When I wake up a little, delicious oil and milk aromas emerge, all kinds of spices, raw beef chestnuts, and coconut oil, which are incredibly fragrant.
Taste Comment: Oceanic fino Shirley. Rhubarb, ginkgo fruit, nettle, mint, coffee, honey, oil with cooling, honey and traditional Chinese medicine, mutual restraint, all behave very calmly. Chocolate, caramel, sea salt, black pepper, roasted seeds and nuts, Shirley's dark fruit, dried figs, tangerine peel, vanilla, complex and balanced.\nStrong, good fat, suitable sweetness, no acid, no astringency, bitterness, no pungency.
Finish Comment: Long-term, coffee, salt, fino, black pepper, cheese.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Springbank1966

향(Nose): Like a chimera of Genting King and Honey Rum. There are not many wood elements, but you can imagine the old barrels, mahogany furniture, walnuts, reddish brown leather goods, a bit of dirty grease in it, Italian vinaigrette, wood lacquer, a little hummus With Texas roast beef, the direction of peat is incense, hemp rope and barbecue. It is too sweet under the influence of Sherry Cask, honey, HP-style sherry, 35% chocolate, dry black fruit jam, nine-made plum, cough syrup. When I wake up a little, delicious oil and milk aromas emerge, all kinds of spices, raw beef chestnuts, and coconut oil, which are incredibly fragrant.

맛(Taste): Oceanic fino Shirley. Rhubarb, ginkgo fruit, nettle, mint, coffee, honey, oil with cooling, honey and traditional Chinese medicine, mutual restraint, all behave very calmly. Chocolate, caramel, sea salt, black pepper, roasted seeds and nuts, Shirley's dark fruit, dried figs, tangerine peel, vanilla, complex and balanced.\nStrong, good fat, suitable sweetness, no acid, no astringency, bitterness, no pungency.

피니쉬(Finish): Long-term, coffee, salt, fino, black pepper, cheese.

Nose Comment: Famyard smells galore, hay, cowbarns, animal sheds, faint manure (if you can believe in a good way)\nPeat, salt, damp hay, wet granite, slight orange breakfast marmalade note, a little ginger, pepper, hints of nectarine, finally a little sweet cigar smoke & oak smoked bacon,\nGreat nose.
Taste Comment: At first you get a lovely bag of fruit gums then the peat tries to rip the front of your tongue off, your mouth needs to acclimatise to this, superb balance.\nPlenty of ginger spice mixing with the peat, so fresh, not overpowering, orange, apricot, dried peels and that lovely spicy peppery peat.
Finish Comment: Good length, remaining composed, absolutely nothing out of place

Nose Comment: This Macallan 40yo is full bodied and oily. A beauty to behold in the glass. The nose is elegant but thick and full. Smels of spices, christmas, dried fruits and nutts.
Taste Comment: Palate is soft, smooth and gentle. Sherry. Some spicyness but not to oaky, you get tastes of dryed fruit, orange, prune, fig. Even some fudge and coco.
Finish Comment: Long dry aftertaste. Keeps you happy.\nElegant and surprisingly gentle whisky, yet complex with several layers. Perfectly balanced.

Nose Comment: How dark can a whisky be! Dried fruits of figs and dates. Truck loads of raisins. Prunes. Christmas cake all the way. Wild cherries. Maggi. Hints of smoke at the background. Probably one of the best noses I ever had.
Taste Comment: Thick and oily. Sweet sherry (PX?). Bitter orange, Plums. Liqueur like. But also diesel oil associations. Lots of tanninnes. Chocolate as well. Espresso coffee. Earthy notes.
Finish Comment: Long and warming. Clove and nutmeg. Cinnamon. Some mint.

Nose Comment: Opens on a big fruity, surprising for a Port Ellen, with a lot of citrus fruits (orange, lemon, grapefruit) and some exotic fruits (passion fruits). Then indented, we feel a rather fine peat, an iodized side and a medicinal side (camphor). When we add water we lose the fruity side and the whisky becomes more austere, more peaty and medicinal with tar, as if we were going from an old Bowmore to an Ardbeg.
Taste Comment: Huge power but never be burning, a drop is enough to line the entire palace. Very complex, always fruity that makes it very easy to drink mixed with a marine side with peat and still camphor.
Finish Comment: Endless final. The empty glass remains fruity but a little more candied, with a little chocolate and almonds after several hours, the peat evaporates slowly.

When we add water we lose the fruity side and the whisky becomes more austere, more peaty and medicinal with tar, as if we were going from an old Bowmore to an Ardbeg.

맛(Taste): Huge power but never be burning, a drop is enough to line the entire palace. Very complex, always fruity that makes it very easy to drink mixed with a marine side with peat and still camphor.

피니쉬(Finish): Endless final. The empty glass remains fruity but a little more candied, with a little chocolate and almonds after several hours, the peat evaporates slowly.

Nose Comment:
A powerful and dare I say it prickly nose considering it is only 80 proof.
From the off this smells old, certainly older than 15 years and the smell of sherry is one of those dark/red fruits mixed fruit jams.
As the minutes tick by a burnt fruit cake smell emerges, like an overdone scone with burnt currants?
There is also something meaty, like burnt sausages, weird, never had anything like that before nosing any whisky
It is a burnt note for sure.
The jury is out, I will come back to it
I am not a fan of this nose., burnt cake or burnt meat is the overriding impression I get, probably a burnt fruit cake.
Taste Comment: No burnt notes on the palate thankfully just a creamy, fruity, palate.\nThere is some spice, dark & red fruits but also a mixed fruit trifle note, there is a sweeter layer coming through, like brioche.\nI cannot fault this., everything about the palate reeks of quality, great balance
Finish Comment: Spicy on the finish remaining fruity and a little creamy

From the off this smells old, certainly older than 15 years and the smell of sherry is one of those dark/red fruits mixed fruit jams.
As the minutes tick by a burnt fruit cake smell emerges, like an overdone scone with burnt currants?
There is also something meaty, like burnt sausages, weird, never had anything like that before nosing any whisky
It is a burnt note for sure.
The jury is out, I will come back to it
I am not a fan of this nose., burnt cake or burnt meat is the overriding impression I get, probably a burnt fruit cake.

맛(Taste) [점수: 96.0]: No burnt notes on the palate thankfully just a creamy, fruity, palate.
There is some spice, dark & red fruits but also a mixed fruit trifle note, there is a sweeter layer coming through, like brioche.
I cannot fault this., everything about the palate reeks of quality, great balance

Nose Comment:
The nose is ultra concentrated. It's superb because it's also not overpowered, nor disgusting as it can sometimes be on really big Sherry Casks.
It's fat above all, full of leather, shoe polish, molasses, dark chocolate, liquorice.
We have a superb rancio which recalls the best Cognacs.
And also this molasses which recalls the best Demerara.
The best of three worlds?
We have an intense blackberry, redcurrant and blackcurrant jam. It's stewed, in its copper cauldron, and filled with sugar.
Really fantastic.
We continue with herbaceous peat, smoke, gentian, Kâmpôt pepper and an assortment of old precious woods and small wild berries.
With a lot of ventilation, we also have a delicate camphor that is revealed.
One of the most beautiful noses I have ever seen.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth, it is the molasses that opens the ball. We really have the impression of drinking a Demerara.
Leather, shoe polish, caramelized sugar, cocoa, 90% dark chocolate, freshly ground coffee, liquorice, herbal liqueur.
A concentrated and explosive cocktail.
The fruit is not to be outdone. We always have the jam on the nose, but also some tropical fruits. Mango, papaya, passion fruit, and a big dose of orange.
The peat is oily, with charcoal, light smoke and meaty aromas.
Finish Comment: The finish is long (not surprisingly), in the continuity of the mouth, on leather, smoke, barbecue, grilled meat, liquorice, gentian, molasses, orange zest and sugar.

Nose Comment: What a beautiful nose is this! Surprisingly starting with some gentle floral notes (had expected heavy sherry) followed with dark fruit of black current, raspberry and prunes. Leather arm chairs from a Chesterfield couch. Cigar boxes. Gentle woody notes of cedar. Whiff of smoke. Roasted almonds at the background. One of the most complex noses I've ever had
Taste Comment: Now lots of sherry and plum notes intermingled with the best dark chocolate there is. Dried fruits of figs and dates. Raisins. Mocha coffee and balsamico as well. Pipe tobacco which my grandfather used to smoke. The peat in the palate is more detectable than in the nose. Actually this is multi-layered whisky with every time new flavours coming through including cured ham, truffle, cloves and caraway.
Finish Comment: Endless with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg. A little pepper. Unbelievable complex for a 8 years old whisky. That shows that age doesn't always matter.

Leather arm chairs from a Chesterfield couch. Cigar boxes. Gentle woody notes of cedar. Whiff of smoke. Roasted almonds at the background. One of the most complex noses I've ever had

맛(Taste): Now lots of sherry and plum notes intermingled with the best dark chocolate there is. Dried fruits of figs and dates. Raisins. Mocha coffee and balsamico as well. Pipe tobacco which my grandfather used to smoke. The peat in the palate is more detectable than in the nose. Actually this is multi-layered whisky with every time new flavours coming through including cured ham, truffle, cloves and caraway.

피니쉬(Finish): Endless with hints of cinnamon and nutmeg. A little pepper. Unbelievable complex for a 8 years old whisky. That shows that age doesn't always matter.

Nose Comment: I can only describe this as a really nice nose. Rich fudge, toffee, it is almost like some old cognac is in the mix?\nRum & raisin ice cream, rich biscuit, hints of shoe polish.
Taste Comment:
Immediately there is a blast of peat and massive spice kick that almost burns your throat.
There is also a very slight woody bitterness but there is also a little orange in the mix.
It gains a lovely sweetness on the 2nd sip with hints of honeycomb with various exotic fruits coming to the fore.
This actually tastes old.
Finish Comment:
Finish, long and quite sweet.
With Water:-
Nose
Even better than neat, very refined .
Palate
Just about perfect but it has lost a little fruit.
There is some fruit gums flavours mixing with the spice
Finish.
Not as long now, but very refined and remaining fruity until the end
document_text:
위스키 이름: Highland Park1955 It

향(Nose) [점수: 93.0]: I can only describe this as a really nice nose. Rich fudge, toffee, it is almost like some old cognac is in the mix?
Rum & raisin ice cream, rich biscuit, hints of shoe polish.

맛(Taste) [점수: 91.0]: Immediately there is a blast of peat and massive spice kick that almost burns your throat.
There is also a very slight woody bitterness but there is also a little orange in the mix.
It gains a lovely sweetness on the 2nd sip with hints of honeycomb with various exotic fruits coming to the fore.
This actually tastes old.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Finish, long and quite sweet.
With Water:-
Nose
Even better than neat, very refined .
Palate
Just about perfect but it has lost a little fruit.
There is some fruit gums flavours mixing with the spice
Finish.
Not as long now, but very refined and remaining fruity until the end

Nose Comment: Pure, unadulterated, old, funky, meaty, greasy, fatty, phenolic, juicy, sweet, and fruity Ardbeg. Immense earthy, aromatic, thick, slightly herbal, and grassy peat smoke. Nothing like the smoke of modern Ardbeg, this smells like it's from a different world. Tar, charcoal, fishing nets, sea salt, smoked kippers, smoked honey, smoked beeswax, smoked lemon juice, ocean brine, organic apple cider, star anise, even some ripe cherries and slightly medicinal character to it
Taste Comment: Some dirtiness to it and extremely oily. More super high quality organic apple cider, fresh squeezed limes, ripe lemon zest, beautiful sweetgrass and toffee peat candy, cherry infused liquorice, smoked almonds, engine oil or petrol fuel, even vanilla cream and honey, orange peels...
Finish Comment: Super long, tons of herbal aromatics, pine resin, fir and pine liqueur, salted limes, salted honey, salted and smoked pork belly, more orange and lemon zest, touches of limestone, peat candy and sweetgrass or sandalwood, pine logs in a cabin in the winter waiting to be out on the fire, lemony ashes, super long
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1972

향(Nose): Pure, unadulterated, old, funky, meaty, greasy, fatty, phenolic, juicy, sweet, and fruity Ardbeg. Immense earthy, aromatic, thick, slightly herbal, and grassy peat smoke. Nothing like the smoke of modern Ardbeg, this smells like it's from a different world. Tar, charcoal, fishing nets, sea salt, smoked kippers, smoked honey, smoked beeswax, smoked lemon juice, ocean brine, organic apple cider, star anise, even some ripe cherries and slightly medicinal character to it

맛(Taste): Some dirtiness to it and extremely oily. More super high quality organic apple cider, fresh squeezed limes, ripe lemon zest, beautiful sweetgrass and toffee peat candy, cherry infused liquorice, smoked almonds, engine oil or petrol fuel, even vanilla cream and honey, orange peels...

피니쉬(Finish): Super long, tons of herbal aromatics, pine resin, fir and pine liqueur, salted limes, salted honey, salted and smoked pork belly, more orange and lemon zest, touches of limestone, peat candy and sweetgrass or sandalwood, pine logs in a cabin in the winter waiting to be out on the fire, lemony ashes, super long

Nose Comment: Tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, and most of all pure passion fruit juice, citrus fruits, orange zest, lime, some austere notes, honeydew, waxes, spices, little herbs, minerals, hints of bitter almonds, marzipan, fine peat and smoke - superb!
Taste Comment: Punchy, oily, fruity, good sweetness, tons of tropical fruits, hints of honey and tobacco, minerals, waxes, citrus fruits, hints of bitter oranges, herbs, little peat and smoke - excellent!
Finish Comment: Long, warm, fruity, austere, little herbal, smoky, little more punchy, still good sweetness, even little sirupy - great!
document_text:
위스키 이름: Laphroaig1970 RWD

향(Nose) [점수: 97.0]: Tropical fruits, pineapple, mango, and most of all pure passion fruit juice, citrus fruits, orange zest, lime, some austere notes, honeydew, waxes, spices, little herbs, minerals, hints of bitter almonds, marzipan, fine peat and smoke - superb!

맛(Taste) [점수: 97.0]: Punchy, oily, fruity, good sweetness, tons of tropical fruits, hints of honey and tobacco, minerals, waxes, citrus fruits, hints of bitter oranges, herbs, little peat and smoke - excellent!

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 96.0]: Long, warm, fruity, austere, little herbal, smoky, little more punchy, still good sweetness, even little sirupy - great!

Nose Comment: Decent nose, rich sherry that is masking the peat, stewed dark fruits, plus a touch of Christmas spice\nSmells really rich like some of the best and darkest Christmas cakes.
Taste Comment: Creamy & peaty, dark rich plums, black currants, something slightly meaty, with some ginger and a pepper note.\nA few drops of water makes it a little smoother and releases more dark fruit and more peat/pepper\nGood balance on show here
Finish Comment: Quite long and sweet
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1976
태그: Fragant

향(Nose) [점수: 92.0]: Decent nose, rich sherry that is masking the peat, stewed dark fruits, plus a touch of Christmas spice\nSmells really rich like some of the best and darkest Christmas cakes.

맛(Taste) [점수: 93.0]: Creamy & peaty, dark rich plums, black currants, something slightly meaty, with some ginger and a pepper note.\nA few drops of water makes it a little smoother and releases more dark fruit and more peat/pepper\nGood balance on show here

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Quite long and sweet

Nose Comment: Similar in the medicinal notes I found in the 1972 40 year MoS bottle but not as pronounced.\nA basket of various stewed dark fruits, rich mulled wine, Christmas spice and that medicinal note.\nVery rich and very nice.
Taste Comment:
Neat this is too bitter for me, there are plenty of black/red fruits that have been stewed for an eternity but the wood has left a an imprint.
Better with 5 minutes of breathing, the wood is not as prominent.
Hopefully water will ease things up a little?
Yes water has improved this and there is no denying the rich fruity quality on offer,.
Finish Comment: A little peat comes out on the tail, finish is warming and good length.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenrothes1966

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: Similar in the medicinal notes I found in the 1972 40 year MoS bottle but not as pronounced.\nA basket of various stewed dark fruits, rich mulled wine, Christmas spice and that medicinal note.\nVery rich and very nice.

맛(Taste) [점수: 91.0]: Neat this is too bitter for me, there are plenty of black/red fruits that have been stewed for an eternity but the wood has left a an imprint.\nBetter with 5 minutes of breathing, the wood is not as prominent.\nHopefully water will ease things up a little?\nYes water has improved this and there is no denying the rich fruity quality on offer,.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: A little peat comes out on the tail, finish is warming and good length.

Nose Comment: Intriguing old and dusty nose with notes of old furniture and pollen mixed with oranges and tangerines. Followed by gingerbread, cinnamon pastry and caramelized apples. After a while more classic sherry notes of Christmas cake, raisins, honey, and maple syrup. Very nice!
Taste Comment: The sherry sweetness continues with stewed fruits, figs and plums. Some resinous notes. Hints of walnuts and roasted chestnuts. Liquorice and ginger. Peel zest and hints of lemon later on. Dark chocolate in the background. Quite firm and thick.
Finish Comment: Long and drying with black pepper and a little nutmeg. Soft pine at the end.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Springbank1965 MI

향(Nose): Intriguing old and dusty nose with notes of old furniture and pollen mixed with oranges and tangerines. Followed by gingerbread, cinnamon pastry and caramelized apples. After a while more classic sherry notes of Christmas cake, raisins, honey, and maple syrup. Very nice!

맛(Taste): The sherry sweetness continues with stewed fruits, figs and plums. Some resinous notes. Hints of walnuts and roasted chestnuts. Liquorice and ginger. Peel zest and hints of lemon later on. Dark chocolate in the background. Quite firm and thick.

피니쉬(Finish): Long and drying with black pepper and a little nutmeg. Soft pine at the end.

Nose Comment: Rather fresh sherry, clear hints of rubber, tea, then little citrus fruits, whiffs of smoke - that rubber is gone after a minute - now also notes of oak wood, spices, tobacco - great!
Taste Comment: Punchy, very clean, black tea, rather dry, sherry wood, spices, thyme, pepper, many different tobaccos, hints of dried fruits - superb!
Finish Comment: Some subtle sweetness in the aftertaste but really reluctant - it's more like having a tea with just one sugar cube instead of two
document_text:
위스키 이름: Macallan1955
태그: Coal-gas,Dried Fruit,Rubbery,Sherried,Tobacco

향(Nose): Rather fresh sherry, clear hints of rubber, tea, then little citrus fruits, whiffs of smoke - that rubber is gone after a minute - now also notes of oak wood, spices, tobacco - great!

맛(Taste): Punchy, very clean, black tea, rather dry, sherry wood, spices, thyme, pepper, many different tobaccos, hints of dried fruits - superb!

피니쉬(Finish): Some subtle sweetness in the aftertaste but really reluctant - it's more like having a tea with just one sugar cube instead of two

Nose Comment:
What a nose! Say it's reduced to 46%!
An impressive balance. At no time is it heavy or stuffy.
We are definitely on the big sherry, with chocolate, cocoa, coffee, liquorice, almost chocolate fondant. It is greedy.
We also have a nice dose of black fruits. Plums, blackberries, dates, figs mainly.
We have precious wood, a little wax, dusty old furniture.
Everything balances out perfectly.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth we continue in the momentum of the nose. It's a little more dense and imposing. Once again the reduction is impressive.
Date, figs, caramel, toffee, noble wood, old furniture.
Always a lot of dark chocolate.
We passed each other in an old automobile warehouse, with its aromas of gasoline and macadamia.
Absolutely no astringency.
Finish Comment: Long finish on cocoa powder, dark chocolate fondant, plum, barbecue, leather, tobacco, noble wood.

Nose Comment: Sensational nose. Tropic salad!! Sherry. Earthly. Strawberry. Smoke. Liquerice. Sweet spice. Getting more peachy and apricot jam with time.
Taste Comment: Wow. All the above! Lovely and oily texture
Finish Comment: Very long. Cinnamon,. Slightly bitter. Fruity. Liqurice. Jam.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Largiemeanoch1967

향(Nose): Sensational nose. Tropic salad!! Sherry. Earthly. Strawberry. Smoke. Liquerice. Sweet spice. Getting more peachy and apricot jam with time.

맛(Taste): Wow. All the above! Lovely and oily texture

피니쉬(Finish): Very long. Cinnamon,. Slightly bitter. Fruity. Liqurice. Jam.

Nose Comment: Wow, the nose already starts spectacular with beeswax, polished furniture and candied apples. Followed by marzipan and Turkish Delight. Gingerbread as well. Touch of fresh cedar wood. Whiff of roasted chestnuts in the background.
Taste Comment: Now full mouthcoating vanilla and honey mixed with caramel and butterscotch. Toffee intermingled with cherries and strawberries later on. Also some stewed fruit of figs and dates. Spices of cinnamon, caraway and tabasco. Aniseed. Exellent!
Finish Comment: Very long, with white pepper and a little nutmeg. Coffee and dark chocolate at the end. Needless to say this whisky is complex and well balanced.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ord1962 RWD
태그: Cooked Vegetable

향(Nose): Wow, the nose already starts spectacular with beeswax, polished furniture and candied apples. Followed by marzipan and Turkish Delight. Gingerbread as well. Touch of fresh cedar wood. Whiff of roasted chestnuts in the background.

맛(Taste): Now full mouthcoating vanilla and honey mixed with caramel and butterscotch. Toffee intermingled with cherries and strawberries later on. Also some stewed fruit of figs and dates. Spices of cinnamon, caraway and tabasco. Aniseed. Exellent!

피니쉬(Finish): Very long, with white pepper and a little nutmeg. Coffee and dark chocolate at the end. Needless to say this whisky is complex and well balanced.

Nose Comment: Intense rich sherry; red fruits, black coffee, old leather, some smoke and nice spices; very round, deep and sweet. And many other nice aromas. Perfect!
Taste Comment: Thick, dense, creamy, juicy and very concentrated mouthfeel; big and intense sherry, in line with the nose; very rich and sweet, red fruits, dark chocolate. Sweet molasses. The best old cognacs. Very nice spices dance across the tongue, back and forth. The juicy delivery remains and keeps the oak under control without denying it (would be a shame for a 47 year old..). Very complex. A whisky to chew - not just to drink. Perfect!
Finish Comment: Extremely long with juicy barley and the nice spiciness. The tiniest bitter note come through, but more as an asset. Never drying. Perfectly balanced. Just superb.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenfarclas1960
태그: Chocolate,Dried Fruit,Fresh Fruit,Husky,Leathery,Mossy,Old Wood,Sherried,Tobacco

향(Nose): Intense rich sherry; red fruits, black coffee, old leather, some smoke and nice spices; very round, deep and sweet. And many other nice aromas. Perfect!

맛(Taste): Thick, dense, creamy, juicy and very concentrated mouthfeel; big and intense sherry, in line with the nose; very rich and sweet, red fruits, dark chocolate. Sweet molasses. The best old cognacs. Very nice spices dance across the tongue, back and forth. The juicy delivery remains and keeps the oak under control without denying it (would be a shame for a 47 year old..). Very complex. A whisky to chew - not just to drink. Perfect!

피니쉬(Finish): Extremely long with juicy barley and the nice spiciness. The tiniest bitter note come through, but more as an asset. Never drying. Perfectly balanced. Just superb.

Nose Comment: Intense! Soil, mineral, old furniture, oily, creamy, barbecue sauce, cigarrette, wine cellar, of course peat, dried fruits. Simply Spectacular, so much happening in here. A very complex dram only for "the truly experienced".
Taste Comment: Stunninly overwhelming... strikes you speechless for a few seconds...then strikes again. First the fruity liquor, then a delightful peated sherry! candied fruits, citric fruits, fresh but serious herbal extracts that firms down the thick malt, pepper, cardamom, cashew nuts, etc SPECTACULAR DRAM but hard to habdle because of the too many flavours amnd feeling going on in the glass.
Finish Comment: the powerful punch of the spirit last for some seconds leaving a gap for the peated and fruity (candied, dried and citrics) sherry, that enters along the tongue like a parade's orchestra. Able to differentitate the instruments in the orchestra but forcing you to forget the flavours and feel the final result of the mix. DIVINE, that's it.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Brora1972 DL

향(Nose): Intense! Soil, mineral, old furniture, oily, creamy, barbecue sauce, cigarrette, wine cellar, of course peat, dried fruits. Simply Spectacular, so much happening in here. A very complex dram only for "the truly experienced".

맛(Taste): Stunninly overwhelming... strikes you speechless for a few seconds...then strikes again. First the fruity liquor, then a delightful peated sherry! candied fruits, citric fruits, fresh but serious herbal extracts that firms down the thick malt, pepper, cardamom, cashew nuts, etc SPECTACULAR DRAM but hard to habdle because of the too many flavours amnd feeling going on in the glass.

피니쉬(Finish): the powerful punch of the spirit last for some seconds leaving a gap for the peated and fruity (candied, dried and citrics) sherry, that enters along the tongue like a parade's orchestra. Able to differentitate the instruments in the orchestra but forcing you to forget the flavours and feel the final result of the mix. DIVINE, that's it.

Nose Comment: Tons of tropical fruits, pineapple, passion fruit, mango, little papapya, dragon fruit, you name it, lots of austere and citrusy notes, grapefruit, lime zest, whiffs of peat and smoke, little tobacco, honeydew, vanilla - superb!
Taste Comment: Oily, creamy, very fruity, austere, grapefruit, subtle sweetness, more tropical fruits, fine peaty and smoke notes, little herbs, vanilla, pipe tobacco, little iodine, salty, honeydew, apple, limes, little minerals - excellent!
Finish Comment: Medium long, warm, fruity, austere, little zesty and herbal, honey - great!

Nose Comment: Very interesting nose, I am undecided whether it is Old Bottle Flavor or not, as it is perfectly married to the elegant smoke, like old, slightly damp parchment that is burned, with aromatic incense sticks, hazelnut, macadamia nut, gentle, black pepper, earl Gray, chamomile tea, tick lemon peel, salt, vanilla, camphor, candied ginger, sage
Taste Comment: Almonds, pistachio, ginger, chamomile tea, nice citrus notes, lime, lemon, but also white grapefruit, earl gray, nutmeg, soft pepper, camphor, like absolute Caol Ila (1980s) concentrate by syringe, tick banana, kiwi, old parchment, walnut , Chestnut, autumn leaves, anise, gingerbread and speculoos, ginger
Finish Comment: Cardamom, cinnamon, some great, spicy Christmas cookies, anise, almonds, a hint of iodine, leather, very long

향(Nose): Very interesting nose, I am undecided whether it is Old Bottle Flavor or not, as it is perfectly married to the elegant smoke, like old, slightly damp parchment that is burned, with aromatic incense sticks, hazelnut, macadamia nut, gentle, black pepper, earl Gray, chamomile tea, tick lemon peel, salt, vanilla, camphor, candied ginger, sage

맛(Taste): Almonds, pistachio, ginger, chamomile tea, nice citrus notes, lime, lemon, but also white grapefruit, earl gray, nutmeg, soft pepper, camphor, like absolute Caol Ila (1980s) concentrate by syringe, tick banana, kiwi, old parchment, walnut , Chestnut, autumn leaves, anise, gingerbread and speculoos, ginger

Nose Comment: Elegant is a word I often use to describe old delicate whiskies and this certainly fits the bill. You can smell the wood mixed in with furniture polish, wax and very rich fudge. There are faint notes of peat and cereal and there is some fruit in there like apricot or ripe nectarine and whiffs of orange in the background.
Taste Comment: First impression is it is very creamy and very dry with the flavours very compact, I think this will need a few drops of water.\nI cannot believe how creamy it is, the sherry is there from the start but it is a lovely almost flawless type of sherry, not like a brutal Glendronach or Glenglassaugh. The taste is on hot pastries, apricot jam but really dark apricot, almost like a rich breakfast marmalade.
Finish Comment: Not long but so fine I am struggling to define it,
document_text:

향(Nose): Elegant is a word I often use to describe old delicate whiskies and this certainly fits the bill. You can smell the wood mixed in with furniture polish, wax and very rich fudge. There are faint notes of peat and cereal and there is some fruit in there like apricot or ripe nectarine and whiffs of orange in the background.

맛(Taste): First impression is it is very creamy and very dry with the flavours very compact, I think this will need a few drops of water.\nI cannot believe how creamy it is, the sherry is there from the start but it is a lovely almost flawless type of sherry, not like a brutal Glendronach or Glenglassaugh. The taste is on hot pastries, apricot jam but really dark apricot, almost like a rich breakfast marmalade.

피니쉬(Finish): Not long but so fine I am struggling to define it,

document_text:
위스키 이름: Springbank1966

향(Nose): Fresh (sea breeze), fruity, complex.

맛(Taste): Full, strong and very tasty, smooth vanilla and exotic flavors.

피니쉬(Finish): Long and warming, with a fruity mix of vanilla and wood.

Nose Comment: Old! Aromatic smoke from a long forgotten time, furniture polish, sour coffee beans, fruit cake (old and dried up), leather and beach-washed wood, but the old notes add some citrus and a salty sea breeze. But it dominates the wood - bitter oak is very present. He has so much to offer and if you like old wood in combination with sherry and smoke (who does not) experienced here his dream nose.
Taste Comment: Oh, that's soft. Much sherry sweetness and creaminess, the smoke is there but discreet. With lemon, salt and licorice. Smoke is slowly becoming more dominant - burnt herbs and slightly phenolic. The leather note comes again. Great development but without the big surprise. Still damn good and profound.
Finish Comment: Warming smoke. Raisins and fruity - semi-dry sherry sweetness, lots of chocolate and oak (but surprisingly discreet in the bitterness), even the licorice note is only weak there. Very long. The warming smoke does not want to go away.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1975

향(Nose) [점수: 96.0]: Old! Aromatic smoke from a long forgotten time, furniture polish, sour coffee beans, fruit cake (old and dried up), leather and beach-washed wood, but the old notes add some citrus and a salty sea breeze. But it dominates the wood - bitter oak is very present. He has so much to offer and if you like old wood in combination with sherry and smoke (who does not) experienced here his dream nose.

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: Oh, that's soft. Much sherry sweetness and creaminess, the smoke is there but discreet. With lemon, salt and licorice. Smoke is slowly becoming more dominant - burnt herbs and slightly phenolic. The leather note comes again. Great development but without the big surprise. Still damn good and profound.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: Warming smoke. Raisins and fruity - semi-dry sherry sweetness, lots of chocolate and oak (but surprisingly discreet in the bitterness), even the licorice note is only weak there. Very long. The warming smoke does not want to go away.

향(Nose) [점수: 95.0]: Extremely citric, fruity, honeydew, hints of vanilla, peat and smoke, bonfire, iodine, smoked ham, bacon (and scrambled eggs) - superb!

Nose Comment: overripe fruit, plums, dark chocolate, spiciness, hints of mint. Very well balanced with fruit well felt and wood not sticking out
Taste Comment: I'm speechless. One of the best things I tried. It's thick and dense. Very fruity, but not that compote that you find in modern sherried whiskies, but properly fruity with dust and mold. Not very sweet, oakiness well felt and it's just great from any point of view
Finish Comment: Long, with spices and mint, and of course lots of overripe fruit

Nose Comment:
I used my best glass for this one and when I took the glass lid off and inhaled it nearly blew my nose off, which was really unexpected.
A an extremely jammy old Laphy all on dark fruits, fruit pastilles, dark polished wood and some definite oak in the mix.
With a little air there is some brine and I swear I get hints of rhubarb which in whisky I have only had about 3 times
There is a little peat in the mix perhaps some trademark iodine but nowhere near what you might expect but after 10 minutes in the glass the trademarks start expressing themselves much more.
Dark treacle notes emerge, salted caramel but the dark jam notes are still to the fore, a multi layered nose for sure.
This for me is very difficult to score, there is so much going on but the fumes in the glass seem exaggerated, you almost have to wade through them and the aromas are constantly changing between the sweeter jams and the earthy elements.
Taste Comment:
Jesus its like silk in a glass, what a lovely mouthfeel but it is also very dry and the oak is most definitely there but not overpowering because of the superb quality of the sherry casks.
I have to say as mouthfeels go you would struggle to better this, that is my first impression anyway.
The sherry is perfectly weighted mixing with subtle peat, dark toffees, some pepper emerges , various other spices.
I thought this was a little dry at first but as balance and everything else go it is spot on
Finish Comment: Your tongue tingles, you are left wanting more, so expressive

Nose Comment: 1.Nase without movement:  Wow  ivy  sweet bright caramel  Furniture polish & rose water  salt  lemon  a flashback to Lokum  http://dumans.mux.de/images/product/TXFRBJSPD1ZI.jpg  then:  Sea water, maritime sweet  salty, intense sea  Floor wax and sulfur notes  ___________\nTo feel life  absolutely feel something to know that you live  if you want  are you right here\n2.Nase with movement  it's like you could smell the dark damp ocean floor  oily light sherry is in your glass  red mullet with lemons on your plate  Your fingers are grinding the coarse sea salt  the warm day by the sea is heavy in the air  he burns as if he still has to unload to find peace  You smell thunderstorms and fire like a sweet promise  the honey-yellow sherry - oily, heavy and sluggish -  promises you sweet delights  You can smell the barrel in which he lay so many years  Wood and licorice  You crush the lemons over the fish  Your juice runs over your salt-glued fingers  a smile  You live and want more
Taste Comment: It slides elegantly and tastefully over your tongue and your palate  spoils you  full spicy sweet flavors  very maritime  only when he touches your throat does a fire kindle  the voltage discharges  smoking embers and pepper  Relaxation  Flavors unfold  to a long taste experience  You order an espresso
Finish Comment: long  getting sweeter  peaty  caramel  smoking softly  salt  sweet tobacco  dark chocolate  damp  spicy  malt  bittersweet the wood

Nose Comment: Great nose, not overly sherried, really elegant which is the sort of whisky i like.\nMarshmallow, nougat, red berries, plum jam, faint orange marmalade , there is also a sweet floral note, actually if i said floral gum sweets that would be about right.\nThe nose just reeks of class, probably the best Glenfarclas nose out of the ones i have tried.
Taste Comment: There is some initially fruity sweetness with a little mulled wine spice and some sweet red berry liqueur on the top layer. There is some oak that checks the sweetness but thankfully the sweetness wins the battle.\nAs you go on the wood increases but the fruit is still in control, what is really good is the balance
Finish Comment:
The finish is very composed, no burn retaining spice and sweetness.
With water:- (5 very small drops)
Little change on the nose just a little more fruit, the palate retains good balance but the water has releases more wood and this time it overpowers the fruity, jammy sweetness, not by much but you notice it.
There is more spice on the tail now pushing the sweetness in the background.
The balance is still really good.

맛(Taste) [점수: 93.0]: There is some initially fruity sweetness with a little mulled wine spice and some sweet red berry liqueur on the top layer. There is some oak that checks the sweetness but thankfully the sweetness wins the battle.\nAs you go on the wood increases but the fruit is still in control, what is really good is the balance

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: The finish is very composed, no burn retaining spice and sweetness.\nWith water:- (5 very small drops)\nLittle change on the nose just a little more fruit, the palate retains good balance but the water has releases more wood and this time it overpowers the fruity, jammy sweetness, not by much but you notice it.\nThere is more spice on the tail now pushing the sweetness in the background.\nThe balance is still really good.

Nose Comment: I left this in the glass for 10 minutes or so and the fruit notes have definitely increased.\nI think this one will be less smoky and more fruity than the 58.7% version.\nAgain a bag of wine gums, orange, lemon, a little fresh pineapple but the salt, smoke and peat are in the background but unlike the 58.7% this is not a farmyard one on the nose, the fruit is the dominant factor here with a little white pepper thrown in.
Taste Comment:
Bags of really zesty fruit, oh hang on, here it comes an avalanche of peat is approaching, or it it?
A wave of peat hits your tongue but then is disappears leaving the fruit and a pepper note.
There is a battle royal going on between the sumptuous fruit and the peat/pepper, I am almost drooling, just excellent.
Over time the fruit wins by a whisker
Finish Comment: Long, peppery, moreish with a fruit blast in the tail

Whisky Name: Campbeltown Clan ClashSingle Malt Whisky RW&W
Tags: Chocolate,Dried Fruit,Honey,Leathery,Sherried,Tobacco,Vanilla,Mossy,Old Wood,Citric,Cooked Fruit,Nutty,Oily,Smokey,Toasted,Cooked Mash,Fragant,Hay-like,Kippery,Malt Extract,New Wood,Sandy
Nose Comment: In my nose I have a complex symphony of apricots, honey, warm beeswax, rosehip jam, dried blueberries, the leather binding of old books, but also the smell of Gselchten (smoked ham from the Bavarian Forest).
Taste Comment: The work of art continues on the palate, showing some maritime notes of grilled shellfish and the warm notes already present on the nose. After a few seconds and some salivation, gooseberries, rum raisins and nut tea are added.
Finish Comment: A long finish follows with a hint of a cedar cigar box brimming with ripe fruit and a slight bitterness of cold EarlGrey remains.

Nose Comment:
standing still:
You take one of your sweet salty caramel candies in your mouth
and look at the sea
it is quiet and gloomy, as if it were dozing
In the fog over the dunes suddenly a castle appears
fascinated you will be attracted by the mystical scenery
in front of the castle, you can smell the mold of the old masonry
a blooming lilac bush stands only beside the entrance
its tart floral odor is lost in the salty sea air
the door opens
a ray of light falls on the table inside
dark, plump raisins next to French cognac
Limes are lying next to a piece of sliced ​​ham
Your fingers are stroking the cut surface
salty smoked ham with soft meat
Your saliva begins to flow
You take a sip of the old cognac
above you are old dusty wooden beams
they smoke
You want to know why
Open a door and see the iodine-green sea
the walls are burned down
charred wooden beams stand out against the dark sky
the fire is extinguished, the wood still warm
emotional:
eucalyptus
spicy salty
behind it caramel
stale flower water
Sulfur after some time
Taste Comment:
in the beginning
sweet caramel with menthol
chocolate
a lot of salt
ripe apples
the old moldy walls and wood
spicy hot on the tongue
on the palate smokes a warm spring
Salt water with iodine
mineral tingling
on the tongue sticks chocolate powder
Finish Comment:
long and pleasantly moist
sweet and salty
eucalyptus
caramel
baked apple
barrel chocolate
a touch bitter

Nose Comment: Massive sherry, peat, coffee, stewed fruits of raspberry, blackberry, plum, prune and date.\nSome orange and bubble gum notes emerge but they are faint.\nMixed in with the wood is mulled wine spice, smells really good.
Taste Comment:
The sherry is big but the peat is huge and it combines very well and it is quite syrupy. It settles down very quickly and gets quite dry on pastry and wafer notes.
Initially the fruit that the nose hinted at is hard to detect but the sherry is pretty flawless I have to say.
This is no sherry or peat monster, not like I was expecting but I mean that in a good way, the balance is near perfect.
The fruits come through now its all a stewed dark fruit salad mixed in with coffee.
The wood is singing loudly now , you feel it mixing with the sherry but it is not overpowering.
Red plums come in towards the end and damson jam.
Finish Comment: Not as long as I thought it would be but everything is well perfect.
document_text:

태그: Chocolate

향(Nose): Massive sherry, peat, coffee, stewed fruits of raspberry, blackberry, plum, prune and date.\nSome orange and bubble gum notes emerge but they are faint.\nMixed in with the wood is mulled wine spice, smells really good.

맛(Taste): The sherry is big but the peat is huge and it combines very well and it is quite syrupy. It settles down very quickly and gets quite dry on pastry and wafer notes.\nInitially the fruit that the nose hinted at is hard to detect but the sherry is pretty flawless I have to say.\nThis is no sherry or peat monster, not like I was expecting but I mean that in a good way, the balance is near perfect.\nThe fruits come through now its all a stewed dark fruit salad mixed in with coffee.\nThe wood is singing loudly now , you feel it mixing with the sherry but it is not overpowering.\nRed plums come in towards the end and damson jam.

피니쉬(Finish): Not as long as I thought it would be but everything is well perfect.

Nose Comment: Big sherry. Black cherry, plum jam, blueberry, black currant, candied orange peel and raisin. Cinnamon, ginger, clove and white pepper. Carpentary workshop. Fresh eucalyptus.
Taste Comment: Powerful. Big spices and oak. Citruses and tannins. Vibrant acids. Pepper, nutmeg, chili and sherry. Dutch cocoa. Tropical fruits and creamy peat. Mango chutney. Amazing.
Finish Comment: Long, spicy, smoky, creamy, bittersweet.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Bowmore1964
태그: Chocolate,Citric,Dried Fruit,Sherried

향(Nose) [점수: 95.0]: Big sherry. Black cherry, plum jam, blueberry, black currant, candied orange peel and raisin. Cinnamon, ginger, clove and white pepper. Carpentary workshop. Fresh eucalyptus.

맛(Taste) [점수: 95.0]: Powerful. Big spices and oak. Citruses and tannins. Vibrant acids. Pepper, nutmeg, chili and sherry. Dutch cocoa. Tropical fruits and creamy peat. Mango chutney. Amazing.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: Long, spicy, smoky, creamy, bittersweet.

Nose Comment:
I have this sitting for about 30mins now, still yet to taste it. What a beautiful old school sherry profile, they simply don't, and probably can never make them like this ever again.
Immediately, I'm hit with that old-style sweet peat, it's vegetal on the nose at first whiff. There are scents of dunnage and hessian with hints of fresh lemongrass. I've just pulled the first layer away, (like when you peel that piece of plastic off a brand new mobile phone from the box.)
Now things are starting to get dusty, antique books, old leather soafers, pipe tobacco. It's a medley of scents from an old antique store, simply exquisite.
Where are the fruits? Oh yes, they're jumping out the glass now its breathed for an hour now, beautiful ripe tropical fruits, mangos, rockmelon, ripe tomatoes, apricots & peaches, hints of ginger and balsamico oak.
Taste Comment: viscous and thick in the mouth, tropical fruit on the palate, the sweetest oak integrates throughout, that antique leather, tobacco, is vintage a tasting note? It ought to be because that's what it tastes like. Someone has transported me back to my aunties house in the 1980s, and I taste the air emanating from the sitting room, with couches covered in plastic, I can even hear the sound of the grandfather clock ticking away. Amazing is an understatement for this dram.
Finish Comment: No oak bitters here like you might find on - old school sherry drams. Just elegant. finished with hay, hessian, dunnage, sweet fruits and candied ginger and sweet spices.\nAmazing! I can't speak. I can't describe how the palate just so seamlessly integrates, I'm struggling to find any type of flaw.\nIt's entirely mouth-coating, the finish is long and I can still taste everything. The Bowmore 60s (because it needs a "The" in front of its name.) I swear this wasn't distilled on Earth.

Nose Comment: As before there is a lovely orange note, like the finest orange marmalade, Lucozade, Turkish Delight, hints of sweet peat, sweet popcorn, sawn dark wood (or sanded) when it gets hot and slightly burnt. and a little sweet chilli sauce.\nBetter than I remember
Taste Comment: Thick and fruity, with plenty of peat but also some bitterness that I did not detect last time?\nStewed fruit, apricot, pear, mango, faint bourbon hints but this is from sherry casks, right?
Finish Comment: resonable length with a little ginger spice coming in

Finish Comment: Long, nutty, leathery, lingering smoke.

Nose Comment: Notes of furniture polish, beeswax, burlap, a tinge of charred oak and teak, but also big on the rancio. There are whispers of tobacco leaves and menthol, but also blackberries. Touches of aceto di balsamico, prunes and crème de cassis, but also chocolate and raisins. You get the gist, right? It’s greatness in a glass and shares similarities with older brandies. Perfectly — and I mean flawlessly — integrated.
Taste Comment: There’s this sweet arrival with dried dates and Demerara sugar, but also eucalyptus and a whiff of star anise, supported by a tiny pinch of black pepper as well as some strong coffee and leather. Then more raisins and chocolate. Damp oak and tobacco leaves. Some drier notes, but they’re kept very much in check. And again it’s integrated and balanced.
Finish Comment: Long. Some cloves. A tad dry. Chocolate, balsamic. A hint of ash.

Nose Comment: Pretty funky nose, reminds me of some funky rare malts with their special notes, on the one hand pear drops, but also slightly ashy Bowmore notes, then unripe, young strawberries collected in the forest and woodruff added straight away, a bit of malt, after about 15 minutes in the glass more classic whisky becomes present in the nose, dried fruits with apricot and orange, also maritime notes, salt, more oak (on the beach)
Taste Comment: Intense, slightly smoky bread, then great maritime notes, orange oil, roasted apple slices, charred rosemary, some coniferous forest, wonderfully salty oak on the beach, old school malt, some herbal tea, ancient oak, some pear and apricot too
Finish Comment: In the finish almost a hint of tropics, honeydew melon, camphor, cardamom and coniferous forest, plus oak and salt, as well as nice malt, becomes increasingly dry, long

Nose Comment:
Very exotic nose.
Papaya, mango, guava, passion fruit, banana. If we search well we find all the fruits we are looking for.
It's round, creamy. Accompanied by very nice aromas of honey, cinnamon.
A little wet grass.
Taste Comment: In the mouth it is a little less exotic, more focused on dry pine, wood, liquorice, cloves. Milk chocolate and dark chocolate.\nWe have more citrus, on the orange zest, lemon.\nIt's oily, and we evolve on cold ashes.
Finish Comment: Long finish on orange zest, honey, wood, cold ash and smoke.

Nose Comment: The first thing I notice is the red berry note closely followed by raspberry and blackberry.\nThere is a prune juice and apricot note, followed by some ryvita crackers\nNext there is jam sponge and then some treacle, a nice mix of flavours that are followed by a meaty note
Taste Comment:
A fruity start mixed with chocolate and then a bitter cocoa note.
Very rich, the sherry note is strong.
There is a lovely black cherry note followed by raspberry jam and plenty of dark chocolate.
Balance is very good.
As you go on the dark chocolate note in creases, there is a little peat but it is in the background.
Finish Comment: Rich, velvetty and remaining slightly on the sweet side.

Taste Comment: Powerful. Crystal clear sherry, instantly knocked out. Big fruits next to it. Prune, raisin, date and caramelized apple. Peat, tobacco and bitter almond. Honey and citruses. Spicy oak. Pina colada and herbals.
Finish Comment: Long, spicy, fruity, peaty.

Nose Comment:
A fragile nose that is elegant and distant, you really have to concentrate to get the best out of it.
There is some old sherry notes, sweet and fruity without being overpowering.
Some nice juicy dark plum notes, blueberry & blackberry
Perhaps a little peat but it is faint.
Very nice, very subtle
Taste Comment: The plum and berry mix together with the sherry and yea there is some peat , just a little like the nose suggested.\nEver so slightly woody but it does not detract.\nGets a little creamy and also has a bit of sherbet fizz, balance is awesome and if it was just a little sweeter and a without the slight wood element it would be 95 points, as it is 92 is a fair reflection
Finish Comment: Remaining sweet and there is almost a bubble gum sweetness at the end, really good but again just a little wood and bitterness creeping in at the end

Nose Comment: Restrained, some honeycomb, pear and melon but not much of anything else.
Taste Comment: White fruit again, pear melon, a little butterscotch. After a while we get grapefruit and a touch of vanilla along with mild toffee and wafer.\nVery good.
Finish Comment: Long and very smooth, but the finish is the best part and it only feels substantial once you have swallowed it.

Nose Comment: Unusually elegant and noble even for 70s Ardbeg, sweet ginger, anise, green tea, almonds, a subtle hint of orange peel and apple chips, old, dry leather, camphor, thyme, light, delicate herbal honey, vanilla
Taste Comment: Ginger tea, thyme, orange peel, full and elegant at the same time, almonds, camphor, liquorice, delicate and yet clearly present smoke, fine salt, olives, capers, a hint of pepper, fennel, green apple, nettle tea
Finish Comment: Perfectly rounded malt and leather, lamp oil, dry tobacco, walnut, peanut, long, ingenious, cardamom

위스키 이름: Bowmore1968

향(Nose) [점수: 95.0]: Bags of tropical fruits, mango, pineapple, passion fruit, papaya, also some orchard fruits, apricot, yellow plum, honeydew, little citrusy, grapefruit, spices, pepper, whiff of oak wood, iodine, little seabreeze - superb!

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: More tropical fruits, honeydew, salty, brine, subtle sweetness, spices, white pepper, citrusy, more grapefruit, toffee, almonds, lime peel, hint of herbs,oak wood - excellent!

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: Medium long, warm, honeydew, grapefruity, oak wood, salty, iodine - great!

Nose Comment: Nicely concentrated, compact, you can give it time, initially nice iodine, maritime notes, fine salt crust, more in relation to the smoke than with other Ardbegs (including other 70s), heather honey, relatively fine and clean peat smoke, if that makes sense, not much of the dirty modern Ardbegs, oily, nutmeg, clove, citrus peel, gooseberry, salty liquorice and a little yeast dough, far behind all the Islay notes a little tropical flashes through, but too subtle to locate it more precisely
Taste Comment: Oily body, but very, very intense, the 55% seems more like 58-59%, oily-warm smoke, earthy but also woody smoke, old oak planks on the beach with a fine salt crust, nutmeg, heather meadow, dried citrus zest, fresh ginger, clove, salty liquorice, mocha notes and iodine, chestnut and a little olive oil
Finish Comment: Dry and salty, olive oil, liquorice, mocha and some gooseberries, as well as grated citrus peel, here pleasantly little oak for the age, round and maritime, long, although elegant
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1974 Provenance
태그: Chocolate,Dried Fruit,Old Wood,Vanilla

향(Nose): Nicely concentrated, compact, you can give it time, initially nice iodine, maritime notes, fine salt crust, more in relation to the smoke than with other Ardbegs (including other 70s), heather honey, relatively fine and clean peat smoke, if that makes sense, not much of the dirty modern Ardbegs, oily, nutmeg, clove, citrus peel, gooseberry, salty liquorice and a little yeast dough, far behind all the Islay notes a little tropical flashes through, but too subtle to locate it more precisely

맛(Taste): Oily body, but very, very intense, the 55% seems more like 58-59%, oily-warm smoke, earthy but also woody smoke, old oak planks on the beach with a fine salt crust, nutmeg, heather meadow, dried citrus zest, fresh ginger, clove, salty liquorice, mocha notes and iodine, chestnut and a little olive oil

피니쉬(Finish): Dry and salty, olive oil, liquorice, mocha and some gooseberries, as well as grated citrus peel, here pleasantly little oak for the age, round and maritime, long, although elegant

Nose Comment: Vegetable stew, creamy eggnog, full-bodied old sherry
Taste Comment: clear Petrol note, extremely balanced mildly round, alcohol extremely well integrated, full-bodied all-enveloping and filling sweetness, a hint of nutmeg, cloves, star anise, bar pepper, short flames medical notes on and peat fire and oak bitterness on which but soon disappear again, the sweetness occurs in its almost original intensity again with a warm and cozy feeling without burning, despite enjoyment of the most noble drop in barrel strength
Finish Comment: For ages, the spicy sweetness remains in the mouth and on the tongue with spicy aromas; It develops a long chubby log fire on the palate, which slowly migrates down the esophagus ultimately transforms the whole body into a velvety chubby stove, which warms from the inside

맛(Taste): clear Petrol note, extremely balanced mildly round, alcohol extremely well integrated, full-bodied all-enveloping and filling sweetness, a hint of nutmeg, cloves, star anise, bar pepper, short flames medical notes on and peat fire and oak bitterness on which but soon disappear again, the sweetness occurs in its almost original intensity again with a warm and cozy feeling without burning, despite enjoyment of the most noble drop in barrel strength

Nose Comment: Lots of juicy fruitiness of pears, pineapple and lime intermingled with awesome mineral notes of wet stones and chalk. Paraffin. Lemon jelly. I also got seaweed drying in the sun and dried crab shells. Spices of aniseed and camphor at the background.
Taste Comment: Full and waxy mouth coating as I have never experienced. Followed by orange-rid and kiwi fruit. Gooseberries. Also tangerines and passion fruit. Lemon-curd. Custard and some cake mix. Later on sugared almonds and fresh cedar wood. It's delicious and complex at the same time. Very good!
Finish Comment: Long and lingering with hints of clover honey and vanilla. Clove. A little ginger. Gentle mint at the end. Needless to say this whisky is perfectly balanced.

맛(Taste): Full and waxy mouth coating as I have never experienced. Followed by orange-rid and kiwi fruit. Gooseberries. Also tangerines and passion fruit. Lemon-curd. Custard and some cake mix. Later on sugared almonds and fresh cedar wood. It's delicious and complex at the same time. Very good!

피니쉬(Finish): Long and lingering with hints of clover honey and vanilla. Clove. A little ginger. Gentle mint at the end. Needless to say this whisky is perfectly balanced.

Finish Comment: Medium long, warm, woody, spicy, little tannic, not drying, hints of menthol, chocolate, toffee, cooked fruits, orange zest, hints of old books, little OBE, hints of black tea - very good!

Nose Comment: You can smell the sherry which is full of dark fruits of black cherry, blackcurrant and blackberry and raspberry, basically if you think of a Black Forest Gateaux that sums it up nicely.
Taste Comment: Very rich and powerful with some peat in the mix and the spice explodes all over your tongue with the fruits on the nose in play particularly black cherry with a little raspberry jam.\nIt seems to increase in fruitiness, oodles of different liqueur chocolates, you know like what go out at Christmas.\nThe balance is top draw, everything in sync.
Finish Comment:
Very pleasant, uber fruity and spicy, just keeps going.
With a little water which in my view is not needed in my view.
Nose
Gorgeous, similar to when neat, not much change from when neat.
Palate
Even more dark fruit has been released and the spice has gone up also, the overall effect is outstanding, wow.
Not massively sweet but impossible to fault
Finish
Not massive but so polished you notice little else.

위스키 이름: Ardbeg1967 SV
태그: Citric

향(Nose) [점수: 97.0]: Very fruity, tropical fruits, pineapple galore, vanilla, also mango, passion fruit, papaya, some peach, custard cream, ripe apricot, apple, melon, if at all only very shy peat and smoke, tobacco and spices - superb!

맛(Taste) [점수: 97.0]: Oily, creamy, little sirupy, good sweetness, again tropical fruits galore, pineapple mostly but also others, some vanilla, lots of orchard fruits, honey, peche melba comes into my mind, little peat, smoke, spices - delicious!

Nose Comment:
This does not smell like most Ardbegs, the sherry is powerful , the dark fruits hit you and there is a little sulphur I believe mixed in with glue.
I am struggling to describe this, it seems to get a bit beefy, Bovril cubes that sort of thing, but it is also a little floral and then a bit of hot chocolate.
The fruit is rich plump blackcurrants & damsons.
Wow that is a rollercoaster neat, not sure what to think?
A bit lacking , nondescript at times to be honest, but a coffee and mocha notes rescues it by some margin
Taste Comment:
Heavy sherry, dirty peat, very drying on the palate is my first thought.
The peat and sherry compliment each and the dark fruits are on the ripe side and very juicy, really nice and much better than the nose hinted at.
This is on the creamy side, again juicy blackcurrants and damson and I wrong about the sulphur on the nose, there is no sulphur and this tastes very good.
If I was being critical a little more sweetness, just a touch would have made this even better but there is no denying the balance on show here
Finish Comment: Not that long , so juicy and so tasty
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1972 DL The Ardbeggeddon
태그: Chocolate,Citric,Dried Fruit,Hay-like,Leathery,Medicinal,New Wood,Sherried,Smokey

향(Nose) [점수: 85.0]: This does not smell like most Ardbegs, the sherry is powerful , the dark fruits hit you and there is a little sulphur I believe mixed in with glue.\nI am struggling to describe this, it seems to get a bit beefy, Bovril cubes that sort of thing, but it is also a little floral and then a bit of hot chocolate.\nThe fruit is rich plump blackcurrants & damsons.\nWow that is a rollercoaster neat, not sure what to think?\nA bit lacking , nondescript at times to be honest, but a coffee and mocha notes rescues it by some margin

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: Heavy sherry, dirty peat, very drying on the palate is my first thought.\nThe peat and sherry compliment each and the dark fruits are on the ripe side and very juicy, really nice and much better than the nose hinted at.\nThis is on the creamy side, again juicy blackcurrants and damson and I wrong about the sulphur on the nose, there is no sulphur and this tastes very good.\nIf I was being critical a little more sweetness, just a touch would have made this even better but there is no denying the balance on show here

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: Not that long , so juicy and so tasty

Nose Comment: Gigantic complex and balanced full nose. Despite this age, a bewitchingly wonderful fruitiness paired with pleasant vanilla and caramel notes embedded in fragrant beeswax.
Taste Comment: Full aroma, despite only 40 percent alcohol by volume! Again wonderfully balanced, very creamy, oily mouthfeel. Super pleasantly supple and soft in texture. An absolutely full-bodied delicacy par excelance!
Finish Comment:
Towards the "Grande Finale" a wonderful oak spiciness, reminiscent of mild pepper, becoming slightly dry, you feel the age and you become more and more aware of what you actually have in the glass here!
You are only happy, happy and happy to be able to experience something like this.
This extraordinary work of art of whisky craft is honored with respect.
Thank you Glen Grant and thank you Gordon & MacPhail !!!
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glen Grant1951 GM

향(Nose): Gigantic complex and balanced full nose. Despite this age, a bewitchingly wonderful fruitiness paired with pleasant vanilla and caramel notes embedded in fragrant beeswax.

맛(Taste): Full aroma, despite only 40 percent alcohol by volume! Again wonderfully balanced, very creamy, oily mouthfeel. Super pleasantly supple and soft in texture. An absolutely full-bodied delicacy par excelance!

피니쉬(Finish): Towards the "Grande Finale" a wonderful oak spiciness, reminiscent of mild pepper, becoming slightly dry, you feel the age and you become more and more aware of what you actually have in the glass here!\nYou are only happy, happy and happy to be able to experience something like this.\nThis extraordinary work of art of whisky craft is honored with respect.\nThank you Glen Grant and thank you Gordon & MacPhail !!!

Nose Comment: First-class sherry, old, juicy, dusty like in a carpenter's workshop, all the flavors are subtle, and all superb. 1972 Ledaig/Tobermory and old Strathislas come to mind.
Taste Comment: Envelopes your palate. Definitely sherried (there seems to be a lighter version and a sherried version of this 1973 OB NAS 46%). Again, everything is subtle and elegant. The slightest hint of peat, or is that my imagination?
Finish Comment: Stays with you for a while, but how I wish they did not dilute these old official Longrows to 43 or 46%.

맛(Taste): Envelopes your palate. Definitely sherried (there seems to be a lighter version and a sherried version of this 1973 OB NAS 46%). Again, everything is subtle and elegant. The slightest hint of peat, or is that my imagination?

피니쉬(Finish): Stays with you for a while, but how I wish they did not dilute these old official Longrows to 43 or 46%.

Taste Comment: Treacle, rich brown sugar and dark sherry, very leathery and sweet, then some orange marmalade, fresh cut herbs, green banana.
Finish Comment: Long, dates and burned molasses, top quality tea, buttermilk, dark chocolates.

Nose Comment: Deep dark blueberry, cranberries, palm sugar syrup, strawberry pudding, and creme brulee. Lemon lime San Pellegrino water, aged honey matured in an XO bottle with XO, ripen mangoes, leather, and condensed beef stock.
Taste Comment: Ripen plums, pitted prunes, manuka honey, hazelnuts, camphor, cinnamon, tarragon, Chinese rice wine husks, cooked Bario rice - this is slightly sweet, nutty, vegetative, and has a deep aftertaste of jammy egg custard (only the best Bario rice money can buy, at around 40 USD per 100 grams.\nLightly smoked, poached pear, with brown sugar and olive oil reduction, slightly seafood-like where lobster roe and seaweed come together.
Finish Comment: Absolutely delicious, long-lasting, and constantly developing in flavors. Sweet orange marmalade, with dark chocolate, orange peel, candied ginger, and plenty of spice notes that I cannot fathom.

Nose Comment: Ripe, complex, extremely sensual and with a silky structure. The finest sherry, fully ripe oranges, polished leather, wonderfully fragrant, fine spices, fruit bread, caramel, spruce and lime honey, cloves, nutmeg, dried flowers, fine fruit compote, quince bacon, nuts, Christmas cookies. Just fantastic!
Taste Comment: Delicate and wonderfully put together! Starts with the finest liqueurs made from a wide variety of fruits, oranges, cocoa, coffee and then goes on in an infinitely long development to bitter herbal tones, leather, tobacco, wonderful sherry, fruit compote, dried flowers, pralines, black tea and much more. Fantastic!
Finish Comment: Long, fruity, jams made from every fruit imaginable. Seems to never end and ends in a delicate dryness with leather and fine tobacco.

Nose Comment:
what a brilliant nose
dark and heavy
a cooked compote of plums and cherries
Oranges, sliced, splashes of juice from the flesh and the essential oil of the shell hit your face
next to it nuts and almonds are dusted with cocoa
an old piece of wood, swollen by the salty seawater
gently a touch of fresh mashed mint blows around your nose
Taste Comment:
the journey starts from the beginning
gentle and elegant
the freshness and sweetness of the orange as well as the fruitiness of the cherries
Sea water, ancient wood
everything is there at the same time
it can be guessed that there must have been a campfire there a long time ago; only scanty remains, but still, there was one
your tongue vibrates with passion
you give yourself completely to her
everything around you moves into the distance
only here and now, only this moment is important
Finish Comment: the impression remains long\nonly slowly does the memory fade into the distance

Nose Comment: Pretty funky nose, reminds me of some funky rare malts with their special notes, on the one hand pear drops, but also slightly ashy Bowmore notes, then unripe, young strawberries collected in the forest and woodruff added straight away, a bit of malt, after about 15 minutes in the glass more classic whisky becomes present in the nose, dried fruits with apricot and orange, also maritime notes, salt, more oak (on the beach)
Taste Comment: Intense, slightly smoky bread, then great maritime notes, orange oil, roasted apple slices, charred rosemary, some coniferous forest, wonderfully salty oak on the beach, old school malt, some herbal tea, ancient oak, some pear and apricot too
Finish Comment: In the finish almost a hint of tropics, honeydew melon, camphor, cardamom and coniferous forest, plus oak and salt, as well as nice malt, becomes increasingly dry, long

Nose Comment:
this morning was the final casting as
before breakfast tasting
when opening the bottle directly spicy plum meat
an old plum tree in the late summer sun
its wood smells warm and musty
Insects and the cracked fruits on the ground
their ripe flesh smells of withered leaves and raisins
the late summer flowers smell heavy
the ground is dusty
You sit down at the gnarled wooden table under the plum tree
Here it smells like eucalyptus and camphor
You give yourself a whisky
a Talisker
and suddenly there is a harbor behind the plum tree
maritime smells
salty harbor water
everything is warm and soft in the late summer sun
thickened sherry
You are dreaming and you are at the harbor
the vase with the flowers tilts
stagnant flow of water draws into the old wood
You smell of your Talisker
Smoke mingles with the smell of the camphor
hot black pepper mixes with mild pink pepper
in between the flowers and their water, the old wood and the ripe plums
in the background clearly the harbor
You're smiling
that would be a Talisker with such smells, unbelievable ...
Taste Comment:
soft plummy spicy start
old damp barrel (a bit decayed)
a tiny touch of alcohol
Chilicatch's extra class: pepper, chili, sherry wow
on your tongue he is tense, yet soft and warm
Spices and eucalyptus
Maritime and salty, too, but somewhat obscured by the spicy wood & sherry notes
soft fruity spicy smoke in the throat
dark dark chocolate
Finish Comment:
medium
a bit too bitter
old barrel, spicy (already a bit musty)
Chocolate dark
sherry notes

Taste Comment: Powerful. Big sherry and matured tannic oak. Sweet fruits and sour vividly acidic berries: gooseberry, blueberry and black currant. Dark chocolate, liqueurs and mild smoke. Nutmeg.
Finish Comment: Long, oaky, spicy.

Nose Comment: This old Dronach seems uber fruit on the nose, the usual dark forest fruits you get mixed with chocolate, Turkish Delight.\nSome nice dark treacle notes emerge after a while but this is drowned in sherry make no mistake and I suspect any distillery profile character will be masked.
Taste Comment: Very, very rich and the fruit is stewed to death with some dark ripe plum, fig, date and a little prune mixing with damson and black cuurant.\nThe overall taste here reminds me of Chambord raspberry liqueur.\nWith water some spice is released and also some peat which improve the overall mouthfeel
Finish Comment: Finish is decent enough but not long, The interplay of flavours is really good.

Nose Comment: Clearly recognizable and yes: rich peat smoke, which I would not have expected at this age. Mineral and maritime, at the same time with a mild fruity note of grated apples, lime slices and mandarins sprinkled with lemon water. Cloves, chervil and tarragon, in the distance warm tar and machine oil. All of this so finely interwoven and yet so clearly recognizable that it is a pure pleasure to be able to hold your nose over the glass.
Taste Comment: Incredibly soft and creamy on the tongue, just a caress like silk on the skin. You can almost completely forget to think about the further composition of the taste while you are amazed at this velvety-soft feeling and try to hold it on your tongue. Here now mild peat smoke, which you can tell on the tongue that it had enough time to soften. Nonetheless, the peat smoke is clearly noticeable, beautiful in combination with lemon and lime, but without showing the ashiness of young Ardbeg. Here, too, minerally, maritime, salty. Atlantic coast, a mild summer evening, a small fire, sand underfoot. Hardly dry, the creaminess remains until the end.
Finish Comment: Not to be expected otherwise, that this is not a short introduction without an encore. Stays for a very long time - really, very long. Can convey an unbelievably maritime feeling, is pleasantly salty and subtly fruity with limes and rose hips. The campfire and the peat smoke wave goodbye.

All of this so finely interwoven and yet so clearly recognizable that it is a pure pleasure to be able to hold your nose over the glass.

Atlantic coast, a mild summer evening, a small fire, sand underfoot. Hardly dry, the creaminess remains until the end.

Nose Comment: Very salty and dark, rich sherry influence from a top-tier clean sherry cask, but maybe a refill cask. Fresh grapes and red fruits, I could suggest strawberry jam and ripe apple. Then you can find a heavy peat backbone, gunpowders, a touch of herb medicine.
Taste Comment: Extremely sweet and minty, sherry still plays its roles, very leathery and floral. Some pencil peel and herbs. It is very spicy due to high alcohol contents, but overall it is very clean and juicy. Then it becomes ultimately minty.\nWith water: It just becomes perfection! Tons of seaweeds and dried fruits, fermented beancurd, dynamic!
Finish Comment: Long bitter finish, fresh, leathery and minty.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Caol Ila1968 GM

향(Nose): Very salty and dark, rich sherry influence from a top-tier clean sherry cask, but maybe a refill cask. Fresh grapes and red fruits, I could suggest strawberry jam and ripe apple. Then you can find a heavy peat backbone, gunpowders, a touch of herb medicine.

맛(Taste): Extremely sweet and minty, sherry still plays its roles, very leathery and floral. Some pencil peel and herbs. It is very spicy due to high alcohol contents, but overall it is very clean and juicy. Then it becomes ultimately minty.\nWith water: It just becomes perfection! Tons of seaweeds and dried fruits, fermented beancurd, dynamic!

피니쉬(Finish): Long bitter finish, fresh, leathery and minty.

Nose Comment: Dried fruits, figs, dates, prune, candied orange acacia honey, brown sugar, hint of molasses, sweet pipe tobacco, sherry wood, whiff of finest leather, dried apricot - superb!
Taste Comment: Oily, spices, pepper, tobacco, dark honey, good sweetness, fine sherry wood, candied orange, more dried fruits, brown sugar, toffee, caramel, hint of toasted bread - excellent!
Finish Comment: Long, warm, fruity, tobacco, spices, hint of leather, sherry wood
