맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: Oily, spices, pepper, tobacco, dark honey, good sweetness, fine sherry wood, candied orange, more dried fruits, brown sugar, toffee, caramel, hint of toasted bread - excellent!

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: Long, warm, fruity, tobacco, spices, hint of leather, sherry wood

Nose Comment: Wow, the nose starts great with juicy prunes and old sherry wood mixed with balsamico and gentle smokiness. Followed by stewed figs and dates. Plum liqueur as well. Raisins, roasted nuts, and a touch of old leather. Maritime influences of anchovies and dried-crab shells in the background.
Taste Comment: Rich and round with peat, bitter dark chocolate, and X-mas cake. Smoked ham, lots of briney notes, and peppered lemons. But also blueberries and black currants. Later on more on mocha, cigar leaves, and pine resin. Espresso coffee. It's all very complex.
Finish Comment: Long and lingering with cinnamon and a little clove. Raspberry liqueur. Liquorice at the end. Superb!
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1967 SV
태그: Kippery

향(Nose): Wow, the nose starts great with juicy prunes and old sherry wood mixed with balsamico and gentle smokiness. Followed by stewed figs and dates. Plum liqueur as well. Raisins, roasted nuts, and a touch of old leather. Maritime influences of anchovies and dried-crab shells in the background.

맛(Taste): Rich and round with peat, bitter dark chocolate, and X-mas cake. Smoked ham, lots of briney notes, and peppered lemons. But also blueberries and black currants. Later on more on mocha, cigar leaves, and pine resin. Espresso coffee. It's all very complex.

피니쉬(Finish): Long and lingering with cinnamon and a little clove. Raspberry liqueur. Liquorice at the end. Superb!

Nose Comment: Unbelievablely fruity, mangoes and passion fruit, some bananas. There's lovely balance, not a touch overoaked or too old. Theres oak in there but its delicate and in line with the fruitiness.
Taste Comment: Ripe mangoes, juicy and fresh. Oak is so delicate and soothing, nothing too old here either. Soft smokiness a little like an old coal fire.
Finish Comment: Sweet oak with a touch of sea salt and the only the slightest hint of coal.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Bowmore1966 DT

향(Nose): Unbelievablely fruity, mangoes and passion fruit, some bananas. There's lovely balance, not a touch overoaked or too old. Theres oak in there but its delicate and in line with the fruitiness.

맛(Taste): Ripe mangoes, juicy and fresh. Oak is so delicate and soothing, nothing too old here either. Soft smokiness a little like an old coal fire.

피니쉬(Finish): Sweet oak with a touch of sea salt and the only the slightest hint of coal.

Nose Comment: When the sample opens, there is a smell of roasted wood and subtle smoky notes that almost disappeared in the whisky glass. What remains is the clear woody note with walnut, cinnamon-sugar, orange aroma, bitter herbs.
Taste Comment: At first he looks quite liquid in the glass, almost watery, but the first sip opens up a creamy world of pleasantly old flavors. Dried plums, spicy herbs, a great warm wood. With wonderfully integrated alcohol that is almost not to be felt and with a beautiful oak sharpness it goes on. Still hints of dried sweet old apples and a slight salivation.
Finish Comment: In the finish the bitter herbs are left behind and there is again the slight smoky note which could be smelled in the sample, paired with wood warmed by the fire. After an hour, the flavors were still in the mouth to taste.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glendronach1968
태그: Dried Fruit,Nutty,Old Wood,Smokey,Toasted

향(Nose) [점수: 95.0]: When the sample opens, there is a smell of roasted wood and subtle smoky notes that almost disappeared in the whisky glass. What remains is the clear woody note with walnut, cinnamon-sugar, orange aroma, bitter herbs.

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: At first he looks quite liquid in the glass, almost watery, but the first sip opens up a creamy world of pleasantly old flavors. Dried plums, spicy herbs, a great warm wood. With wonderfully integrated alcohol that is almost not to be felt and with a beautiful oak sharpness it goes on. Still hints of dried sweet old apples and a slight salivation.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: In the finish the bitter herbs are left behind and there is again the slight smoky note which could be smelled in the sample, paired with wood warmed by the fire. After an hour, the flavors were still in the mouth to taste.

Nose Comment: This has some presence for sure, it is a heavy smell, peat, tar, brine & sherry with some lemon zest thrown in.\nBiscuit, diesel fuel, burning wood smoke with cured ham thrown in.
Taste Comment:
Peat driven, the peat is massive exploding on your tongue if you leave it in your mouth long enough.
If you do the peat subsides and it gets very creamy, what fruit there is (white fruits) is well and truly in the background,
With a drop of water the fruit is released on sweet apple and lemon but then even more peat and it is a crisp clean type of peat with hints of pineapple cube sweets and a little biscuit,
On the palate this is a peat smasher, it is peat driven
Finish Comment: Its long and it peaty, nothing else to say.
document_text:

맛(Taste): Peat driven, the peat is massive exploding on your tongue if you leave it in your mouth long enough.\nIf you do the peat subsides and it gets very creamy, what fruit there is (white fruits) is well and truly in the background,\nWith a drop of water the fruit is released on sweet apple and lemon but then even more peat and it is a crisp clean type of peat with hints of pineapple cube sweets and a little biscuit,\nOn the palate this is a peat smasher, it is peat driven

Nose Comment: Esters, rum soaked cherries, little astringent, dried fruits, dates, figs, plums, brown sugar, molasses, dark honey, woody, spices, cloves, cinnamon, tobacco - very good
Taste Comment: Punchy, oily, menthol, eucalyptus, more rum soaked cherries, coffee, woody, subtle sweetness, dark honey, spices, cloves, more esters, little tannic, tobacco, chocolate - still good
Finish Comment: Long, burning, woody, spices, menthol, little tannic

Nose Comment:
The nose is clearly superb.
A nice explosion of fruit from the start.
Grapefruit, papaya, pineapple, passion fruit. It is expressive, tropical, acidic, and complete despite the unidirectional side.
A little wood, wax, cinnamon.
With aeration, there is a whole medicinal side that takes shape. Camphor, braid. It is delicate and complex.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is round, oily, and sublime.
The fruit is wrapped in milk chocolate.
In addition to the exotic (passion, mango, pineapple), we also have berries (blackcurrant), red fruits (strawberry, raspberry) and a little side of mom's jam.
The wood is very delicate. We have a little cold ash, a nice sea breeze, and a little anise.
Finish Comment: The finish is long, powerful for the alcohol level.\nLicorice, burnt wood, grapefruit, pomegranate. fresh mint.\nIt's more animal and adds a whole dimension to the dram, recalling its origins.
document_text:

태그: Vanilla

A nice explosion of fruit from the start.
Grapefruit, papaya, pineapple, passion fruit. It is expressive, tropical, acidic, and complete despite the unidirectional side.
A little wood, wax, cinnamon.
With aeration, there is a whole medicinal side that takes shape. Camphor, braid. It is delicate and complex.

In addition to the exotic (passion, mango, pineapple), we also have berries (blackcurrant), red fruits (strawberry, raspberry) and a little side of mom's jam.
The wood is very delicate. We have a little cold ash, a nice sea breeze, and a little anise.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 95.0]: The finish is long, powerful for the alcohol level.
Licorice, burnt wood, grapefruit, pomegranate. fresh mint.
It's more animal and adds a whole dimension to the dram, recalling its origins.

Nose Comment: Tar, charcoal, asphalt, sea salt, bbq bacon strips, iodine-soaked bandages, followed by waves of tropical citrus. Lemon juice, lime zest, fresh squeezed cinchonas. It's a wonderful combination of burning, meaty, greasy peat with sharp and fresh citrus sensations
Taste Comment: Strong notes of raw malted barley! Cereal sugars, citrus laced honeys, strong dusty and musty notes, along with potently bitter and ultra-oily peat. A massively strong arrival, this one needs a couple drops of water. That citrus notes and barley sugars meld together into a single malty citrus flavour while the other peat sensations are toned down
Finish Comment: Extremely oily and clinging with a very long finish. All kinds of herbal oils, aromatic oak oils and spices, some farmyard funk, and something that makes me think of limestone
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1974 RWD
태그: Toasted,Citric,Hay-like,Husky,Kippery,Leathery,Malt Extract,Medicinal,Mossy,New Wood,Oily,Smokey,Tobacco,Vanilla

향(Nose): Tar, charcoal, asphalt, sea salt, bbq bacon strips, iodine-soaked bandages, followed by waves of tropical citrus. Lemon juice, lime zest, fresh squeezed cinchonas. It's a wonderful combination of burning, meaty, greasy peat with sharp and fresh citrus sensations

맛(Taste): Strong notes of raw malted barley! Cereal sugars, citrus laced honeys, strong dusty and musty notes, along with potently bitter and ultra-oily peat. A massively strong arrival, this one needs a couple drops of water. That citrus notes and barley sugars meld together into a single malty citrus flavour while the other peat sensations are toned down

피니쉬(Finish): Extremely oily and clinging with a very long finish. All kinds of herbal oils, aromatic oak oils and spices, some farmyard funk, and something that makes me think of limestone

Nose Comment: Fresh and herbaceous nose, fern and eucalyptus leaf. A light but dense smoke gives it thickness, varnish and woody on oak, rancio. Lots of sweet spices: pepper, nutmeg, cloves. Caramelized almonds. Plums and apricots. Toasted rusks and speculoos.
Taste Comment: Oily and fine palate, herbaceous on cut grass. Thickens very quickly on gingerbread with lots of cinnamon. Really fruity then, coconut syrup and plum concentrate, dilution of dates.
Finish Comment: Rather discreet finish on orange caramel, slightly bitter drink, vanilla cake.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Springbank1965 MI

향(Nose): Fresh and herbaceous nose, fern and eucalyptus leaf. A light but dense smoke gives it thickness, varnish and woody on oak, rancio. Lots of sweet spices: pepper, nutmeg, cloves. Caramelized almonds. Plums and apricots. Toasted rusks and speculoos.

맛(Taste): Oily and fine palate, herbaceous on cut grass. Thickens very quickly on gingerbread with lots of cinnamon. Really fruity then, coconut syrup and plum concentrate, dilution of dates.

피니쉬(Finish): Rather discreet finish on orange caramel, slightly bitter drink, vanilla cake.

Nose Comment: Very clean and citrusy peat here, banana cream, distillate drive, a dirty old leather shop, a touch of overripe pineapple here, very balanced peater, good.
Taste Comment: Big, extremely salty and intense, seashells, oysters, some old phenolic characters, residue from a petrol tank, amazingly fresh and balanced, some rich leather, banana and mint cream, some herb medicine, turning a bit bitter at the end.
Finish Comment: Long, oily, burned popcorn, some bitter oak, very spicy.

위스키 이름: Ardbeg1974

맛(Taste) [점수: 89.0]: Big, extremely salty and intense, seashells, oysters, some old phenolic characters, residue from a petrol tank, amazingly fresh and balanced, some rich leather, banana and mint cream, some herb medicine, turning a bit bitter at the end.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 88.0]: Long, oily, burned popcorn, some bitter oak, very spicy.

Nose Comment: Oldest and clear Sherry casks, old and universal blood orange juice, cherry jam with a splash of old rum, warm plums filled with a sugar cube (dumpling), old and ripe and rich throughout, lemon milk ice cream, raisins, highly complex, scouring powder, brandy beans, dark chocolate dripping on a dirty workshop floor, needle extracts, wood barks, forest cottage, resin, leather shoe with leather sole, strong concentrated washing-up liquid with spices, liquorice drops, some brine as well, dark quince jelly with vanilla bean ...\n...
Taste Comment: resin, fiery, needle extracts mixed with the most noble Sherry, best Sherry casks, old old citrus and and and ....\nSimply put: Really everything but even with more intensity!
Finish Comment: Best old Sherry cask with marmalade, resin and caramel at the same time - interwoven with tart citrus and scouring milk, again pine needle extract.\nAll the spectrum in all directions at the same time ...
document_text:

Nose Comment: Old-style Bowmore, not too many tropical fruits, more peaty, soy sauce, slaty sherry, leather and honey, dried dates, oily, dried mango and some passion fruits.
Taste Comment: Rich, intense, raisin, old sherry, some dried mango, fresh and juicy, mouthwatering.
Finish Comment: Short-medium, apricots, light smoke, raisins.
document_text:
위스키 이름: BowmoreBicentenary
태그: Chocolate,Citric,Cooked Fruit,Fresh Fruit,Hay-like,Honey,Kippery,Leathery,Old Wood,Toasted,Tobacco

향(Nose): Old-style Bowmore, not too many tropical fruits, more peaty, soy sauce, slaty sherry, leather and honey, dried dates, oily, dried mango and some passion fruits.

맛(Taste): Rich, intense, raisin, old sherry, some dried mango, fresh and juicy, mouthwatering.

피니쉬(Finish): Short-medium, apricots, light smoke, raisins.

Nose Comment: Very unusual at first contact in terms of aroma intensity. On the one hand, the aroma does not flow from the glass, but on the other hand, it is very distinct. You immediately feel fullness, depth and great arrangement. Weight of dried dried fruits. Raisins. Milk chocolate. Milk chocolate with raisins. There are delicate traces of oak underneath, but in a positive sense. A pinch of spices. Allspice. Hazelnuts. Nougat. Candied oranges. Cherries in liqueur. Mon Cheri. A bit of menthol. Tobacco. An unlit cigar. Cinnamon. Strawberries. Raspberries. What wonderful cigar aromas. Cocoa. Herbal hard candies. Honey. Peaches bathed in sweet syrup. On the second nose comes sage. Red apples covered in caramel. Soluble cocoa powder. The nose is so good that it is difficult to move on to the next stage of tasting.
Taste Comment: Slight oiliness. Dried fruits. Raisins. Milk chocolate with raisins. Dessert chocolate. Cocoa. Hazelnuts. Nougat. Oranges. Candied oranges. A pinch of spices. Ginger. Oakwood. Tobacco. Cinnamon. The second sip brings the menthol. Herbal aromas. Still a lot of tobacco leaves. And those oranges. Tangerines.
Finish Comment: Menthol. Feeling refreshed. Oranges. Candied oranges. Tangerines. Dessert chocolate. Again, menthol and pleasant refreshment. Like Hall's candy. Dried fruits. Raisins. Dessert chocolate. Cocoa. Pickled ginger. After the second sip, there are hazelnuts. The finish is very pleasant. It assembles on the palate and throat like a symphony. And it goes on… and goes on…
document_text:

Tobacco. Cinnamon. The second sip brings the menthol. Herbal aromas. Still a lot of tobacco leaves. And those oranges. Tangerines.

Nose Comment: In the late autumn and early winter, the old-style wooden arcade in Laoguang, the interior is a statue of Mazu surrounded by fireworks, and the street is a century-old traditional Chinese medicine shop. The boss sits on the sandalwood furniture making a pot of herbal tea, holding a thread-bound Du Poetry, and a table. There are a set of hookahs, a few pieces of dried fruits, dried tangerine peels, and a plate of almond double-skin milk, surrounded by camphor, and smelling the gurgling sea water.
Taste Comment: It's too sweet. Although there is a balance of bitterness like tea, at least it is also Malay tea. After 30 years of barrel aging, it is still sonorous and oily, with a lot of fruity flowers, orange essential oil, oak and nuts less than expected. The entrance is generally in line with the smell, but with more Asian spices and honey locust.\nThe typical combination of bourbon barrel and Laphroaig medicinal flavor.\nMedium strong, oily, medium sweetness, no tannins, no astringency, no acidity, light bitterness, no pungency, no alcohol.
Finish Comment: Long-lasting, theobromine, peat, smoke, incense, herbs, licorice, sweet wood, wheat bran.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Laphroaig1966 SV

향(Nose): In the late autumn and early winter, the old-style wooden arcade in Laoguang, the interior is a statue of Mazu surrounded by fireworks, and the street is a century-old traditional Chinese medicine shop. The boss sits on the sandalwood furniture making a pot of herbal tea, holding a thread-bound Du Poetry, and a table. There are a set of hookahs, a few pieces of dried fruits, dried tangerine peels, and a plate of almond double-skin milk, surrounded by camphor, and smelling the gurgling sea water.

맛(Taste): It's too sweet. Although there is a balance of bitterness like tea, at least it is also Malay tea. After 30 years of barrel aging, it is still sonorous and oily, with a lot of fruity flowers, orange essential oil, oak and nuts less than expected. The entrance is generally in line with the smell, but with more Asian spices and honey locust.\nThe typical combination of bourbon barrel and Laphroaig medicinal flavor.\nMedium strong, oily, medium sweetness, no tannins, no astringency, no acidity, light bitterness, no pungency, no alcohol.

피니쉬(Finish): Long-lasting, theobromine, peat, smoke, incense, herbs, licorice, sweet wood, wheat bran.

Nose Comment: Hello mangos my old friend, you've been paired with limes again...guava, passion fruits, black cherries, white grapes, and a healthy dollop of metallic waxes and polishes. Even some blood oranges and crystallized lemons appear after a while. Heavy and rich toffee, cookie dough, golden sultanas, cacao powder, and bold, earthy smoke. Herbal tinctures of tiger balm, sandalwood, and eucalyptus as well. Hints of charcoal mixed with brine and fish nets as well. A dazzling mix and mingling of beautiful aromas
Taste Comment: Stops you in your tracks. Thick and rich Manuka honey, beeswax, peaches and vanilla cream, apricot jam, ripe tangerines, pineapple preserves, fresh squeezed lemons, hazelnut butter, and marzipan up front. Then smoked salmon, sea salt, brine, Vicks vapour rub, and more metal polishes towards the sides and back of the tongue. It's powerful, oily, and dominant. This will kill your session.
Finish Comment: More Vicks vapour rub, lemon candy, pineapple cough drops, pu-erh tea, rosemary, cough syrup, sandalwood, tar, charcoal, small hints of iodine and bandages, menthol, petrol, engine oil from a boat on the shore of Islay, it's all resinous and endless...
document_text:
위스키 이름: Bowmore1963 Anniversary

향(Nose): Hello mangos my old friend, you've been paired with limes again...guava, passion fruits, black cherries, white grapes, and a healthy dollop of metallic waxes and polishes. Even some blood oranges and crystallized lemons appear after a while. Heavy and rich toffee, cookie dough, golden sultanas, cacao powder, and bold, earthy smoke. Herbal tinctures of tiger balm, sandalwood, and eucalyptus as well. Hints of charcoal mixed with brine and fish nets as well. A dazzling mix and mingling of beautiful aromas

맛(Taste): Stops you in your tracks. Thick and rich Manuka honey, beeswax, peaches and vanilla cream, apricot jam, ripe tangerines, pineapple preserves, fresh squeezed lemons, hazelnut butter, and marzipan up front. Then smoked salmon, sea salt, brine, Vicks vapour rub, and more metal polishes towards the sides and back of the tongue. It's powerful, oily, and dominant. This will kill your session.

피니쉬(Finish): More Vicks vapour rub, lemon candy, pineapple cough drops, pu-erh tea, rosemary, cough syrup, sandalwood, tar, charcoal, small hints of iodine and bandages, menthol, petrol, engine oil from a boat on the shore of Islay, it's all resinous and endless...

Nose Comment:
My first impression is that the nose is a little distant, you really have to get your nose into the glass and take your time with this one.
There is a little maritime peat and I suppose what you would call the classic 60`s Bowmore fruit salad profile.
Mango, hints of pineapple, apple, nectarine and orange juice but only hints.
Nosing it for a few minutes the peat does grow a little but the fruit overpowers it.
Finally a few wisps of smoke
Taste Comment: The first thing to say there is a really deep fruit note, pineapple nectarine, fresh pineapple, stewed fruit and its really excellent but it is fighting with a dry ashy peat note and some woody bitterness.\nIt then gets creamy with a few sponge cake notes and the peat really starts to grow in the mouth , now the fruit is in the background.\nIt is a see saw battle but on a balance perspective it works well but the woody bitter notes docs this one a few points and it is a little too dry for my liking, still a nice dram with lots to go at.
Finish Comment: Decent length with fruit lessening at the end the dry note remaining but by the finish not as pronounced.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Bowmore1968

향(Nose) [점수: 91.0]: My first impression is that the nose is a little distant, you really have to get your nose into the glass and take your time with this one.\nThere is a little maritime peat and I suppose what you would call the classic 60`s Bowmore fruit salad profile.\nMango, hints of pineapple, apple, nectarine and orange juice but only hints.\nNosing it for a few minutes the peat does grow a little but the fruit overpowers it.\nFinally a few wisps of smoke

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: The first thing to say there is a really deep fruit note, pineapple nectarine, fresh pineapple, stewed fruit and its really excellent but it is fighting with a dry ashy peat note and some woody bitterness.\nIt then gets creamy with a few sponge cake notes and the peat really starts to grow in the mouth , now the fruit is in the background.\nIt is a see saw battle but on a balance perspective it works well but the woody bitter notes docs this one a few points and it is a little too dry for my liking, still a nice dram with lots to go at.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: Decent length with fruit lessening at the end the dry note remaining but by the finish not as pronounced.

Nose Comment: As with the 1st release, there is also a good portion of peat smoke with the 1974, with BBQ fruit made from grilled mango, lemon and pineapple. The whole thing is phenomenally balanced and tightly interwoven, with oil and honey marinade just about fitting.\nAfter a while, the smoke subsides in favor of a flavoring that contains old poster paint, leather grease and remains of tropical wood.\nWith 2 drops of water, the nose reveals almost no smoke at all, instead lemon, wax and clay pots fresh from the turntable.
Taste Comment: Wow, the best olive oil with lemon thyme, how delicious is that? So completely oily and spicy and yet by no means tickling, I don't think I had a malt in my glass. 55.6%\nNot noticeable. The smoky spiciness from the beginning comes through more now, interesting!\nEven with H²O, the rich oiliness is retained, the smoke is a bit more pronounced, but citrus fruits and mineral notes gain in importance, so there is more of a pure distillery character, I would say.
Finish Comment: It's a promenade and a proudly waving going away, but not just an exit! Everything about the aromas is reviewed intensively, after a few minutes (!) The oak barrel spirit creeps in with a bitter-sweet farewell note.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Brora3rd Release
태그: Dried Fruit,Fresh Fruit,New Wood

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: As with the 1st release, there is also a good portion of peat smoke with the 1974, with BBQ fruit made from grilled mango, lemon and pineapple. The whole thing is phenomenally balanced and tightly interwoven, with oil and honey marinade just about fitting.\nAfter a while, the smoke subsides in favor of a flavoring that contains old poster paint, leather grease and remains of tropical wood.\nWith 2 drops of water, the nose reveals almost no smoke at all, instead lemon, wax and clay pots fresh from the turntable.

맛(Taste) [점수: 93.0]: Wow, the best olive oil with lemon thyme, how delicious is that? So completely oily and spicy and yet by no means tickling, I don't think I had a malt in my glass. 55.6%\nNot noticeable. The smoky spiciness from the beginning comes through more now, interesting!\nEven with H²O, the rich oiliness is retained, the smoke is a bit more pronounced, but citrus fruits and mineral notes gain in importance, so there is more of a pure distillery character, I would say.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: It's a promenade and a proudly waving going away, but not just an exit! Everything about the aromas is reviewed intensively, after a few minutes (!) The oak barrel spirit creeps in with a bitter-sweet farewell note.

Nose Comment: Kind of like an old-fashioned Gorny's sherry style, with a touch of spice, cheese and cream. Very red fruit, almost preserved, plum and honey, very sweet overall, dried banana slices, dried flowers, chocolate. Very indifferent peat, finely shredded tobacco and eucalyptus leaves, incense sticks, mild spicy, leather, ginger and mahogany furniture,
Taste Comment: Winery genes are not obvious, sherry barrels are slightly dry, jujube peels, plum pits, nectar, caramel, gingerbread and crushed white pepper. A kind of peat, camphor, and licorice tablets that are not outward, but unite on the tongue, and have sweet, resin, and chocolate after clearing the bitterness.\nGood, normal oil, slightly sweet, no acid, no tannins, no astringency, very little bitterness, no pungency, no alcohol.
Finish Comment: Longer, dark chocolate, tobacco leaves, tar, vanilla.
document_text:

Very red fruit, almost preserved, plum and honey, very sweet overall, dried banana slices, dried flowers, chocolate. Very indifferent peat, finely shredded tobacco and eucalyptus leaves, incense sticks, mild spicy, leather, ginger and mahogany furniture,

맛(Taste): Winery genes are not obvious, sherry barrels are slightly dry, jujube peels, plum pits, nectar, caramel, gingerbread and crushed white pepper. A kind of peat, camphor, and licorice tablets that are not outward, but unite on the tongue, and have sweet, resin, and chocolate after clearing the bitterness.\nGood, normal oil, slightly sweet, no acid, no tannins, no astringency, very little bitterness, no pungency, no alcohol.

피니쉬(Finish): Longer, dark chocolate, tobacco leaves, tar, vanilla.

Nose Comment: Refined peaty and phenolic poem, variety of herbs, spices, teas, subtle salty vegetables, and very old treasurous smoke and peat..
Taste Comment: extremely coherent and consistent with nose.\nLacks some abv but exceptional balance on each layer is just mindblowing!
Finish Comment: Whatever You focus on, it's harmonious, elegant, classy, old style, really sophisticated. Subtle fruits with such a perfect peaty sweetness, and smoky salt-candied - long - aftertaste. Beautuful!!
document_text:
위스키 이름: Bowmore1956

향(Nose): Refined peaty and phenolic poem, variety of herbs, spices, teas, subtle salty vegetables, and very old treasurous smoke and peat..

맛(Taste): extremely coherent and consistent with nose.\nLacks some abv but exceptional balance on each layer is just mindblowing!

피니쉬(Finish): Whatever You focus on, it's harmonious, elegant, classy, old style, really sophisticated. Subtle fruits with such a perfect peaty sweetness, and smoky salt-candied - long - aftertaste. Beautuful!!

Nose Comment:
At first there is a very strong blackberry/blueberry note like a deep filled fruit pie.
In with the fruit there is something medicinal with peat fumes and hints of furniture polish.
Ribena on steroids probably describes this.
Like some of the very best old sherried whiskies but with an extra dimension.
Superb nose
Taste Comment:
Thick & syrupy with bucketful's of dark fruits, hints of peat.
very jammy indeed so the fruit is blackcurrant, blackberry but with hints of redberry/cranberry overlaying it.
Hints of mulled wine spice.
Lovely, I am struggling for superlatives here
Finish Comment: The finish is good length, remaining this, syrupy and fruity with a zesty twang on the tail and your palate and tongue are felling refreshed.\nWith water, the palate is a little thinner but a spice bomb has been released and once again that extra little ingredient ,that is medicinal that lifts this from excellent to superb

Nose Comment: Nice nose, orange liqueur, rum & raisin ice cream, Lucozade, cola cube sweets, faint Highland toffee
Taste Comment: Smooth at first but then a citrus, sherried punch with fig, plum & caramel.\nThe sherry seems to grow with some nice mango notes and perhaps a little apple,\nSeems to get very fizzy after a while and the plum notes grow.
Finish Comment: Long, keeps going but some bitterness has crept in.

Nose Comment: Open, dry, first nose - furniture lacquer, berry jam (lingonberries, mountain ash); cedar board, resin, carpentry workshop, solvent, pickled cucumbers, salted grape leaves, over time make their way through notes of dried fruit and raisins, foliage and even barely perceptible sulfur-mineral shades, old leather goods, polish, wax, buckwheat honey.
Taste Comment: Rich, soft, spicy oak, furniture lacquer, sweet pastry notes - baklava, jam cookies, burnt jam; tropical fruits, sweet candied fruits, raisins, Christmas mulled wine, old port.
Finish Comment: Soft, spicy, oak, sour coffee, some needles and eucalyptus, dried fruits, cappuccino with caramel, candied orange, gingerbread, roasted nuts.

위스키 이름: Glen Moray1959

향(Nose): Open, dry, first nose - furniture lacquer, berry jam (lingonberries, mountain ash); cedar board, resin, carpentry workshop, solvent, pickled cucumbers, salted grape leaves, over time make their way through notes of dried fruit and raisins, foliage and even barely perceptible sulfur-mineral shades, old leather goods, polish, wax, buckwheat honey.

맛(Taste): Rich, soft, spicy oak, furniture lacquer, sweet pastry notes - baklava, jam cookies, burnt jam; tropical fruits, sweet candied fruits, raisins, Christmas mulled wine, old port.

피니쉬(Finish): Soft, spicy, oak, sour coffee, some needles and eucalyptus, dried fruits, cappuccino with caramel, candied orange, gingerbread, roasted nuts.

Nose Comment: Superb nose. The peat is oily, and coils up all the other aromas of the dram. We have graphite, a bit of pencil lead. Lemon oil, and some other fruits: dried orange, sweet mango, light kiwi.\nLight caramel. Light medicinal, very round camphor, licorice. A little motor oil, from an old garage. It's very blended and intellectual.\nWith aeration we have more minerality, chalk.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is also a demonstration of melt. The aromas come where the spirit wanders.
The fruits twirl. Citrus and exotic: passion fruit, mango, lemon, pineapple.
Peat is present and the smoke takes over, oily, peppery.
Then the comforting honey, the caramel.
And finally the dried aromatic herbs. Licorice.
A little eucalyptus, nettle.
Finish Comment: Fresh, ashy finish, on cold smoke, the barbecue off. The citrus fruits are there, in zest. Fresh mint, eucalyptus, pepper. Persistent.

Nose Comment:
Superb, extremely complex nose.
A pretty fruit, with among others blackberry, blackcurrant, plum, green guava, papaya, pineapple ... the exoticism is not exuberant, but present.
The wood is precious and dry, with molasses, pepper, and a large dose of camphor which adds a controlled freshness.
Very light cold charcoal, tobacco, dry hay.
Taste Comment:
The palate opens with oak, and an exoticism much more lively than on the nose.
Mango, passion, banana, plum, orange, green pineapple, currant. Superb.
The wood is lightly varnished, accompanied by oily leather, cinnamon, dark chocolate. We have a slight rancio.
Dry aromatic herbs, camphor, and some smoke.
Very nice balance.
Finish Comment: Long finish on exoticism, mango, pineapple, wood, dark chocolate, varnish and a little tobacco.\nVery light woody bitterness.

Superb sherry nose very worn on wax and varnish.
Wood, amarena cherry, currants, plum. Almond.
Camphor, pepper, spices. Goji Berry. Eucalyptus? It’s very cool anyway.
With aeration very light smoke.

Chocolate, cocoa, cinnamon, plum, date, fig.
Toasted almonds.
A touch of kirsch.

Always a nice dose of pepper and dry wood bark.

Pineapple, plum, cherry, mango.
Wood, varnish, licorice, pepper. Very pretty.
We stay on the freshness of the eucalyptus.

Nose Comment: It is superb. Old library, encaustic, cappuccino, praline, nougat, coffee buttercream, rancio, nuts, dried apricots but also more tangy notes (blood orange, even tangerine). All admirably melted.
Taste Comment: We find all these beautiful people in the mouth, the alcohol is perfectly integrated and supports the aromas, the texture is fluid but there is enough fat to line the palate.
Finish Comment: The only weak point is the final that we would like to be endless but which is of average length.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenfarclas21-year-old

향(Nose): It is superb. Old library, encaustic, cappuccino, praline, nougat, coffee buttercream, rancio, nuts, dried apricots but also more tangy notes (blood orange, even tangerine). All admirably melted.

맛(Taste): We find all these beautiful people in the mouth, the alcohol is perfectly integrated and supports the aromas, the texture is fluid but there is enough fat to line the palate.

피니쉬(Finish): The only weak point is the final that we would like to be endless but which is of average length.

Nose Comment: Initially the attack is strong and reasonably alcoholic. There is cherry wood, old wood, in fact a complete antique shop, and some varnish. Reminds me also of quite old armagnac. It appear quite austere, without much fruits or freshness. Although, if I try very hard, I can find very faintly some cherries in the background, and dried peaches. This might need some time and water. Indeed with water it softened into a more complex variety of woods, spices and dusty dried fruits. There is a lost strawberry and some dried cherries. Water also increase the balance, and once given some time in the glass, it becomes better and better. More fruits with cherries, apricots on alcohol, the thickest and most intense of blackberry sauces, and forgotten fruity sweets that you sometimes find the pocket of an old jacket. Rum raisins, along with overbaked cakes and frostings. Then meats, like smoked ham, barbecued ribs, and baked liver (and I don’t even like liver). The smoky side pops quite surprisingly, with even suggestions of tobacco and bonfires. For the rest, a beautiful interplay between sherry and wood.
Taste Comment: Again very strong with lots of tannins, which we might have expected based on the colour. Lots and lots of extracted wood, maybe the closest I have gotten to liquified wood. Many wood-associated spices like nutmeg and cardamon, and again a smoky side that is even stronger on the palate. Tobacco, hints of cigar ashes, distant bonfires smoke inhaled on an earlier morning on the heath. Curious what water does with this. Yes, even better. This really opens up with many different spices, different peppers, paprika powder, koriander, curry powder, curcuma, dried fruits like raisins, figs, plums, peaches, maybe even pineapples.
Finish Comment: What follows is a long dry aftertaste with fresh blueberries, cake crust, caraway, fresh mint, and cardamon. Dusty. Well, it is quite old…
document_text:
위스키 이름: Longmorn1971 Sc

향(Nose) [점수: 89.0]: Initially the attack is strong and reasonably alcoholic. There is cherry wood, old wood, in fact a complete antique shop, and some varnish. Reminds me also of quite old armagnac. It appear quite austere, without much fruits or freshness. Although, if I try very hard, I can find very faintly some cherries in the background, and dried peaches. This might need some time and water. Indeed with water it softened into a more complex variety of woods, spices and dusty dried fruits. There is a lost strawberry and some dried cherries. Water also increase the balance, and once given some time in the glass, it becomes better and better. More fruits with cherries, apricots on alcohol, the thickest and most intense of blackberry sauces, and forgotten fruity sweets that you sometimes find the pocket of an old jacket. Rum raisins, along with overbaked cakes and frostings. Then meats, like smoked ham, barbecued ribs, and baked liver (and I don’t even like liver). The smoky side pops quite surprisingly, with even suggestions of tobacco and bonfires. For the rest, a beautiful interplay between sherry and wood.

맛(Taste) [점수: 90.0]: Again very strong with lots of tannins, which we might have expected based on the colour. Lots and lots of extracted wood, maybe the closest I have gotten to liquified wood. Many wood-associated spices like nutmeg and cardamon, and again a smoky side that is even stronger on the palate. Tobacco, hints of cigar ashes, distant bonfires smoke inhaled on an earlier morning on the heath. Curious what water does with this. Yes, even better. This really opens up with many different spices, different peppers, paprika powder, koriander, curry powder, curcuma, dried fruits like raisins, figs, plums, peaches, maybe even pineapples.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: What follows is a long dry aftertaste with fresh blueberries, cake crust, caraway, fresh mint, and cardamon. Dusty. Well, it is quite old…

Nose Comment: Mouth-watering, with lots of dried apricots and honeyed flavours (make it dandelions). And wait... yes... a pinch of this fresh and clean distinctive peat. And a little menthol as well.
Taste Comment: Woodier and drier now, with more tannins and spices (mostly cinnamon and white pepper). Not weak in anyway. On the contrary, this is rather big whisky given the low ABV. Remains fruity, but turns quite resinous and salty, like a high end unsugared rum close to the vesou.
Finish Comment: Getting drier, with an elegant grassy bitterness, like drinking the cold green tea that remains a bit to long in the tea pot.

Nose Comment:
Another superb nose, unsurprisingly.
We start with a huge camphor, a huge rancio, accompanied by a beautiful oil freshly waxed leather.
The wood is then noticed, with aromas of old books, dust, toffee, pepper. Light caramel.
The fruit is dry, distant, with fig and softer grapes.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth, the fruit is more present. Black cherry jam, fig, currant, blackberry.
Cocoa, dark chocolate, light gingerbread, toffee.
Light oaky, chocolatey, with oily leather.
Light barbecue, bacon.
Finish Comment: Long finish on leather, wood, chocolate with roasted cocoa nibs. Fig, smoked.\nThe empty glass smells of tobacco, liquorice and passion fruit.
document_text:

Taste Comment: Punchy, oily, liquorice, subtle sweetness, very fruity, more cooked oranges, more jam, more prunes, more brown sugar, hints of toasted bread, fine sherry wood, little toffee, little citric - excellent!
Finish Comment: Long, warm, fruity, zesty, orange peel, little grapefruit, more spicy, little more woody notes, not drying - great!

Taste Comment: Dense, oily, sweet, woody, great cask indeed.\nLacks some expected fruits though and flavours promised by the nose ecperience..
Finish Comment: Great sherry cask influence takes precedence over elegant, leathery and fruity flavours.

Nose Comment: Fresh grapes, old and dignified, robust smoke, very complex, candies and fresh butter. This is less tropical and fruity compared to the 73s, but it is extremely complex that makes you sniff for hours.

Nose Comment: Light, a little floral, some toffee notes but not heavy toffee, a little butterscotch , caramel, some white fruits coming through after a minute or so but then a few chemical notes emerge.
Taste Comment: I detected no peat on the nose but it is here in abundance, mixing nicely with the sherry and some stewed fruit, it is quite drying in the aftertaste.\nThere is a little treacle in the mix and then a blast of ginger spice, and finally a little classic old HP orange comes in, very good balance on show here.
Finish Comment: Good medium length, sweetness diminshing and as on the note a slight metallic chemical note emerges but , it does not detract or lower the score for me,

Nose Comment:
A big, heavy Sherry nose. I don't really know Caperdonich on this register.
Plum, prunes, black grape during veraison, black cherry, fig.
Brown sugar, bitter dark chocolate.
Oily leather, shoe polish, molasses. Almost a burnt tire, but in a nice sense.
Creme Brulee Caramel.
Huge depth.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth, heaviness gives way to subtlety.
The fruit is more vibrant, more brilliant. Black cherries, blackcurrants, blackberries.
Always burnt caramel, molasses, delicious and sweet.
A nice dose of licorice, spices, cloves, cinnamon, noble wood.
Light fresh mint, which adds a nice freshness to the dram, with a touch of pepper.
Finish Comment: Final on liquorice, honey, molasses, cinnamon, fruits cooked in a pot. Noble and melted wood.\nSo smooth and balanced, to finish this intense dram.
document_text:

피니쉬(Finish): Long. Fruits and spices are lingering on the palate and tongue.

Nose Comment: It starts with plenty of fruit, which goes towards all kinds of berries at first: red berries, raspberries, and blackberries. But also sweet cherries and red apples. Then loads of dark chocolate. Rich honey and hazelnuts are in the background. Later also pine needles and a hint of furniture polish.
Taste Comment: Dark chocolate and orange marmalade. Some lovely rich honey. Damped wood and tobacco, followed by Earl Grey tea and eucalyptus. Then cranberries. A touch of oak. Liquorice. A hint of cinnamon and crushed black peppercorns.
Finish Comment: Very long and somewhat dry, with dark chocolate, toffee and tobacco, but also thyme and cranberries and a hint of oak and black pepper.

향(Nose): It starts with plenty of fruit, which goes towards all kinds of berries at first: red berries, raspberries, and blackberries. But also sweet cherries and red apples. Then loads of dark chocolate. Rich honey and hazelnuts are in the background. Later also pine needles and a hint of furniture polish.

맛(Taste): Dark chocolate and orange marmalade. Some lovely rich honey. Damped wood and tobacco, followed by Earl Grey tea and eucalyptus. Then cranberries. A touch of oak. Liquorice. A hint of cinnamon and crushed black peppercorns.

피니쉬(Finish): Very long and somewhat dry, with dark chocolate, toffee and tobacco, but also thyme and cranberries and a hint of oak and black pepper.

Nose Comment: This reminds me of some of the best 70`s Brora so I will try a 72 Brora next.\nThis is an earthy whisky, dirty in a good way, the peat is mixed with other vegetal notes, burning embers, glowing coals, varnished wood, old leather.\nAfter 5 minutes hints of menthol and blackcurrant jam
Taste Comment: Yes, bingo, a huge wave of peat mixed with orchard fruits of apple & pear and then fruit salad sweet chews with a dry aspect.\nThis is an active cask, you can taste the oak but somehow the peat keeps it in check.\nHoly cow the peat is massive my tongue has just fallen out my mouth, it is so sharp and clean , the fruit is well and truly in the back ground
Finish Comment: Massive, no need to say anything else, a little one dimensional by now but who cares, it works so well
document_text:

Nose Comment: First comes smoke, more like a tobacco pipe smoke. Then dates, prunes, walnuts. Dried bananas, a bit of cherry jam and blackcurrant leaves. Powerful and upscale.
Taste Comment: Wow! Very fruity - peaches, orange zest, prunes, raisins, dried apricots. An explosion of taste. Lots of dark chocolate, toffee, cinnamon and black currant liqueur. Very fresh and bright. Some roasted pecans, smoked oak. Wood is strong but it does not clog up those fresh and fruity notes above.
Finish Comment: Very long, nice and well balanced. Quite warming, the wood is well pronounced, but not too much - neither overly tannic nor excessively woody. Pleasant and drying. Plenty of orange zest, cherry, prunes. Spicy and peppery too. Soft coffee and dark chocolate, blackberry jam and sweet toffee. And it lasts and lasts... fantastic!

Very fresh and bright. Some roasted pecans, smoked oak. Wood is strong but it does not clog up those fresh and fruity notes above.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 96.0]: Very long, nice and well balanced. Quite warming, the wood is well pronounced, but not too much - neither overly tannic nor excessively woody. Pleasant and drying. Plenty of orange zest, cherry, prunes. Spicy and peppery too. Soft coffee and dark chocolate, blackberry jam and sweet toffee. And it lasts and lasts... fantastic!

Nose Comment: Not superbly confident at first nosing, especially for such a reputable 70's Ardbeg. Vanilla, fresh mint, with the peat being more of a bench player.
Taste Comment: Hello! Wave after powerful wave of salt, herring, diesel, kerosene, and peat. Quite punishing. Very pointed and focused, but unfortunately it never opened up like a "peacock" shall we say? A bit dry, yes, and certainly not very complex, but still, this is electric and wonderful stuff all the same.
Finish Comment: Very long. Doesn't veer off path.
document_text:

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: Hello! Wave after powerful wave of salt, herring, diesel, kerosene, and peat. Quite punishing. Very pointed and focused, but unfortunately it never opened up like a "peacock" shall we say? A bit dry, yes, and certainly not very complex, but still, this is electric and wonderful stuff all the same.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: Very long. Doesn't veer off path.

Nose Comment: Varnish, glue, seaside saltiness - very clear salt (Talisker, isn't it?), old furniture, high quality leather, cooked red fruits, walnuts, brown sugar, red apples, oranges, clean smoke, soy sauce, high quality sherry cask here, high quality high percentage cacao dark chocolate (80%+), honey. After at least 30 minutes in the glass it becomes waxy, honeycomb, cake dough.\nWith water: rum raisins, tropical fruits, papaya, mango, herbs - mainly on thyme and mint, crème brulee.
Taste Comment: Oily and thick, black pepper, tobacco leaves, berries, a bit medicinal (where did this come from?), oranges, brown sugar, caramel, toffifee, smoke, oak. With more time in the glass it becomes more earthy. Herbs, thyme and mint.\nWith water: Herbs become more present and bold, espresso, a real espresso-cacao treat, rum raisins, dried plums.
Finish Comment: Long, oak, nutmeg, cloves, baked red fruits, honey, tobacco, herbs - mint.\nWith water: rum raisins, espresso and papaya.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Talisker1955 GM
태그: Husky

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: Varnish, glue, seaside saltiness - very clear salt (Talisker, isn't it?), old furniture, high quality leather, cooked red fruits, walnuts, brown sugar, red apples, oranges, clean smoke, soy sauce, high quality sherry cask here, high quality high percentage cacao dark chocolate (80%+), honey. After at least 30 minutes in the glass it becomes waxy, honeycomb, cake dough.\nWith water: rum raisins, tropical fruits, papaya, mango, herbs - mainly on thyme and mint, crème brulee.

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: Oily and thick, black pepper, tobacco leaves, berries, a bit medicinal (where did this come from?), oranges, brown sugar, caramel, toffifee, smoke, oak. With more time in the glass it becomes more earthy. Herbs, thyme and mint.\nWith water: Herbs become more present and bold, espresso, a real espresso-cacao treat, rum raisins, dried plums.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Long, oak, nutmeg, cloves, baked red fruits, honey, tobacco, herbs - mint.\nWith water: rum raisins, espresso and papaya.

Nose Comment: Oh Dear! That's entrancing! Orange flavoured caramel and dark honeys. burnt wood and red berries puree, not unlike a sherried 1976 Benriach. All kind of jams (black currant, strawberry). Dried papayas and pineapple (the ones you get diced for the aperitif).
Taste Comment: This is soooo concentrated and soooo complex!\nStarts on an "After Eight" chocolate square (sorry for mentioning the name). Outstanding sourness, fabulously balanced by some nice walnut liquor (no bitterness, though). Minty and coffeeish at the same time. And then, we get my beloved "old-fashioned" vegetables (jerusalem artichoke...), along with cauldron cooked jams. This is insanely good!
Finish Comment: Lasts forever, with all kinds of high end teas and coffees, and perhaps a dash of Fernet Branca liquor.

Nose Comment: Oh, very dense and classic old sherry, violet flowers, black currents, underneath there is noticeable oiliness, such as pine oil, or petrol, some high esters are there. All those oily olives, long-aged ham, and nuts! The integration is perfect and there are no off-notes at all. Head to head to another sherry monster Black Bowmore 2nd edition: This one is clearly richer and more fruity, with a lot of high-end leather, iodine and honey ham, countless flavors! Dark chocolates are the backbone, with prominent spices such as star anise and cinnamon. The thickness of the nose is just seductive and endless.
Taste Comment: Very powerful and salty introduction, then it becomes a heaven of sherry flavors: dark fruits, raisins. The fruity side turns very quickly to a minty chocolaty side, a little bitter but overall very refreshing. Those old sherry monster are never tiring. Finally, the dark chocolate flavors dominate.
Finish Comment: Medium-Long, dark chocolates with tons of spices. Then a lot of amazing flavors from the sea, toasted seaweeds and oysters. Violet flowers.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Karuizawa1967

향(Nose): Oh, very dense and classic old sherry, violet flowers, black currents, underneath there is noticeable oiliness, such as pine oil, or petrol, some high esters are there. All those oily olives, long-aged ham, and nuts! The integration is perfect and there are no off-notes at all. Head to head to another sherry monster Black Bowmore 2nd edition: This one is clearly richer and more fruity, with a lot of high-end leather, iodine and honey ham, countless flavors! Dark chocolates are the backbone, with prominent spices such as star anise and cinnamon. The thickness of the nose is just seductive and endless.

The fruity side turns very quickly to a minty chocolaty side, a little bitter but overall very refreshing. Those old sherry monster are never tiring. Finally, the dark chocolate flavors dominate.

피니쉬(Finish): Medium-Long, dark chocolates with tons of spices. Then a lot of amazing flavors from the sea, toasted seaweeds and oysters. Violet flowers.

Nose Comment: Great! Greasy, voluminous and yet round, only very subtle smoke from Bowmore, in the form of extinguished incense sticks, lots of camphor, saffron, cumin, freshly grated cocoa and coffee beans, dark toffee, nougat, old Armagnac, Demerara sugar, sweet old tobacco leaves , candied ginger, plum and black cherry, sweet liquorice, a little chamomile in between, blackberries, marzipan, fresh coffee beans become more intense over time and dark chocolate becomes darker
Taste Comment: Lots of high-quality, freshly poured coffee, camphor, nutmeg, licorice, plus great sweetness from freshly squeezed pomegranate, bitter and also blood orange, tobacco, cumin, ginger, beautiful anise, alcohol super gently integrated and yet very buttery and present
Finish Comment: Anise, liquorice, cherry, violet, tobacco, long, dry-sweet
document_text:
위스키 이름: Bowmore1964 Black
태그: New Wood,Yeasty

향(Nose): Great! Greasy, voluminous and yet round, only very subtle smoke from Bowmore, in the form of extinguished incense sticks, lots of camphor, saffron, cumin, freshly grated cocoa and coffee beans, dark toffee, nougat, old Armagnac, Demerara sugar, sweet old tobacco leaves , candied ginger, plum and black cherry, sweet liquorice, a little chamomile in between, blackberries, marzipan, fresh coffee beans become more intense over time and dark chocolate becomes darker

맛(Taste): Lots of high-quality, freshly poured coffee, camphor, nutmeg, licorice, plus great sweetness from freshly squeezed pomegranate, bitter and also blood orange, tobacco, cumin, ginger, beautiful anise, alcohol super gently integrated and yet very buttery and present

피니쉬(Finish): Anise, liquorice, cherry, violet, tobacco, long, dry-sweet

Nose Comment: Strong sherry aroma hits first, very fruity with strong raspberry and all kinds of red-dark berries; then coffee, polished teak panels, then wood spices (cloves, star anise and cinnamon). Later more earthy and herbal notes appear, but it remains utterly clean. With water its more mellow and sweeter, brings out some honey. Very complex. That's an aromatic blast, a powerful trademark dark sherry Glenfarclas nose.
Taste Comment: Big mouthfeel, oily, powerful attack. Sweet sherry kicks in, then very fruity (now all on oranges and other citrus ones), then earthy flavours such as liquorice and Coca-Cola. Mulled wine. Very rich, half sweet and half dry. With water it becomes thicker, oilier, sweeter but also very balanced. Diluted, there are more tannins, very mouth coating, but not drying. Wow, so tasty, so complex, so full.
Finish Comment: Very, very long, actually it stays for over half an hour. The finish is warming, raspberry again, undiluted there is a slight bitterness, think of fresh pink grapefruit. Later some mint and white fruits, baked apples and pears. Spicy (chilies / hot pepper) at the very end. Water takes the bitterness completely away, just adding a sweeter and rounder end.
document_text:

Very rich, half sweet and half dry. With water it becomes thicker, oilier, sweeter but also very balanced. Diluted, there are more tannins, very mouth coating, but not drying. Wow, so tasty, so complex, so full.

피니쉬(Finish): Very, very long, actually it stays for over half an hour. The finish is warming, raspberry again, undiluted there is a slight bitterness, think of fresh pink grapefruit. Nose Comment: Powerful. Immediately after pouring the dram into my glass a delicate peat flavor started to fill the room. There are smoked tea, humus and sea spray. Fresh lemon juice and camphor contibute to an extraordinary beautiful heavily peated nose.
Taste Comment: Powerful, heavily peated, slightly salty and sour. Lemon zest is the sour component. Reminding of raw oysters with plenty of lemon juice. Some camphor is present as well. This is so delicious ... absolutely fabulous !
Finish Comment: Very long, peaty, lemony and camphory. Fabulous finish.

Nose Comment: Like a farmyard, hay, manure ( a little like old Brora OB 1st-4th release) , peat, salty brine, a little honeycomb, warm biscuits fresh out the oven, but there it is the unmistakable Ardbeg sweaty cheese smell that spoils things and then it goes to sweaty socks.\nBeing honest the nose does improve with air and is perfectly acceptable, even to me (not an Ardbeg fan)\nShame it was going so well, never mind
Taste Comment: Neat, it is sweet at first with a load of grapefruit, honey and then a slight salty note. My first thoughts are that at 59% this is easily drinkable.\nHints of lemon follow, it then gets ashy and the peat gets very intense with a nice sherbet fizz and hints of nectarine\nWith water it gets very creamy and the fruit increases on lemon sherbet.
Finish Comment: Good length, remaining fruity and vibrant

Nose Comment:
A powerful, woody, varnished nose. We are on big sherry that does not hide.
Noble wood, varnished, old shelf, rancio.
It evolves on dried orange zest, plum, prune and currant.
Very light exoticism with a little pineapple and mango.
Molasses, pepper.
Taste Comment: In the mouth we start with sweet candy, which is followed by a whiff of exoticism. Passion fruit, mango, papaya, pineapple, blood orange. It's a real bowl of fruit.\nWe continue on runny dark chocolate, a light dry and delicate wood and a little leather.\nTo finish a little molasses, camphor, pepper, and a light barbecue smoke.
Finish Comment: Long finish on charcoal, grilled meat, grison. Wood, dust, leather, molasses, pepper, camphor. Dried mango, pineapple, orange zest.\nFantastic !

Nose Comment: Various types of old wood notes, old leather sensations, dried out earthy mulch and leaves, almost the smell of being in the malting floor itself while the barley is being turned. Lots of herbal notes as it breathes, rosemary, camphor, eucalyptus, then some sweeter baking spices like cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and cinnamon. Lots of the typical Highland Park heather-honey is woven throughout but it doesn't feel as rich or dense as it could be, but still good. Old oak and shoe polish as well
Taste Comment: Fruity in the style of softer asian fruits: durians, dragon fruit, rambutan, and something between a kumquat and a tangerine. After a few seconds it develops more of the cinnamon/nutmeg baking spices and that perfume note starts to creep in as well. Then lots more oak and some tangerines, but all slightly perfumed
Finish Comment: Long, but a bit hot and perfume-y at first. Then it develops herbal liqueur sensations, earl grey tea, more cinnamon, and heather-honey. Simple but strong

Nose Comment: This one smells much lighter than the 1974 Ledaig Sestante, this Geerie is coastal on brine and it is quite floral. This is like the best early 70's brora with the farmyard notes but more subtle. Definite grapefruit notes, a little apple and icing sugar.
Taste Comment: Very fat on the palate and almost tries to rip your tongue off but what a beauty this is, A creamy peat mixed in with brine, farmyards and some nice fruit, my tongue is on fire and I love it. Gets creamier as it goes on.
Finish Comment: As long as you can imagine, perfect weight.

Nose Comment:
A typical heavy sherried nose I suppose but it hints at being older by all leather and polish notes that go with it.
Hints of peat but certainly no talisker pepper on the nose that I can discern?
After a few miniutes in the glass some medicinal notes creep in like a faint smell of Vic Vapour Rub, menthol that sort of thing.
The nose is nice but it is nothing to get excited about either but a good solid 89-90 p at any rate.
Taste Comment:
Thick chewy and spicy at first , plenty of fizz and no sreal sign of any oak at 50 years old, neither is it tired at 45%, good mouthfeel.
Taste wise you get the obligatory dark fruits, blackcurrant, dark raisins, dark fruit cake and hints of raspberry Jam and I suppose ig you said this was a succulent Jammy whisky that sums it up nicely.
Absolutely no clue that this is Talikser, it could be Mortlach or old Longmorn tasted blind.
It gets more resinous and spicy as you go on and the mouthfeel is excellent, no off notes , very good balance.
Finish Comment: Lip smacking, lingering, a little sweet, substantial.
document_text:

향(Nose) [점수: 90.0]: A typical heavy sherried nose I suppose but it hints at being older by all leather and polish notes that go with it.\nHints of peat but certainly no talisker pepper on the nose that I can discern?\nAfter a few miniutes in the glass some medicinal notes creep in like a faint smell of Vic Vapour Rub, menthol that sort of thing.\nThe nose is nice but it is nothing to get excited about either but a good solid 89-90 p at any rate.

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: Thick chewy and spicy at first , plenty of fizz and no sreal sign of any oak at 50 years old, neither is it tired at 45%, good mouthfeel.\nTaste wise you get the obligatory dark fruits, blackcurrant, dark raisins, dark fruit cake and hints of raspberry Jam and I suppose ig you said this was a succulent Jammy whisky that sums it up nicely.\nAbsolutely no clue that this is Talikser, it could be Mortlach or old Longmorn tasted blind.\nIt gets more resinous and spicy as you go on and the mouthfeel is excellent, no off notes , very good balance.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: Lip smacking, lingering, a little sweet, substantial.

Nose Comment: OK, this is a rather austere and farmy Caol Ila. Medium strength old peat, salty seaweeds. There are some musty and milky components behind. I detected some meaty flavors, such as a beer sauce for stewed beef. It is zesty, very nutty (raw walnuts) and floral. The nose is shy to start not suggesting a 60% alcohol strength! In every way, you could mistakenly think that this is a Port Ellen, it has some golden fruits that I often found from the special releases, and some austere components from early PE James Macarthur.
Taste Comment: Extremely fresh and sweet, a long bottle aging mellows down the high ABV, you have tons of lemon juices covered by creams, really intense and dynamic stuff.... Simply amazing, never ending in your mouth. Not bitterness, no overpowered mints, very balanced, mouthwatering, simply a perfection! Then the peat becomes louder mixed with minty walnuts! Sensational!
Finish Comment: Long, becoming extremely nutty and refreshing, milky chocolates, dried apricots, more farmy notes, seems never-ending.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Caol Ila1969 GM

향(Nose): OK, this is a rather austere and farmy Caol Ila. Medium strength old peat, salty seaweeds. There are some musty and milky components behind. I detected some meaty flavors, such as a beer sauce for stewed beef. It is zesty, very nutty (raw walnuts) and floral. The nose is shy to start not suggesting a 60% alcohol strength! In every way, you could mistakenly think that this is a Port Ellen, it has some golden fruits that I often found from the special releases, and some austere components from early PE James Macarthur.

맛(Taste): Extremely fresh and sweet, a long bottle aging mellows down the high ABV, you have tons of lemon juices covered by creams, really intense and dynamic stuff.... Simply amazing, never ending in your mouth. Not bitterness, no overpowered mints, very balanced, mouthwatering, simply a perfection! Then the peat becomes louder mixed with minty walnuts! Sensational!

피니쉬(Finish): Long, becoming extremely nutty and refreshing, milky chocolates, dried apricots, more farmy notes, seems never-ending.

Nose Comment:
Superb nose.
We start with a superb camphoric freshness.
We are on noble, waxed wood. Old furniture.
Fir honey, plum, date, cocoa, vanilla, chocolate mousse.
Very light dust.
Everything is balanced to perfection.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is a little more expressive than on the nose.
The dust takes the front a little.
The oak is very present, and slightly astringent.
The spices of the wood are expressed, on cocoa, liquorice.
We have plum, black cherry, lemon.
It's simpler and less balanced.
Finish Comment:
Long and spicy finish.
Camphor, lemon, liquorice, cocoa, molasses, wood, wood, wood.
Intense but comforting.
Very nice peppery freshness.

Nose Comment: Surprisingly close to the 1972 bourbon casks at first. Enormous peat blast, medicinal tinctures, sea salt, grilled seaweed, walnut oil. Letting it sit eventually it gives off aromas of engine oil, very old humidor, blood oranges, prune, fig, pine wood resin, burnt brisket, walnut oil, and aniseed
Taste Comment: Monolithic and powerful! Less complex than the nose but still top quality. Fresh Islay peat, sugar-dusted blood oranges, mentholated, high quality European liquorice
Finish Comment: Very long and very dry. Espresso, dark chocolate that's been slightly burnt in the pan, orange marmalade, miso broths with shiitake mushrooms, all sorts of umami sensations, walnut liqueur, and old rancio funk

Nose Comment: Very complex nose with fruity sweetness of pear and melon mixed with candied apples. Gingerbread. Beeswax. Mineral notes of wet stones as well. Roasted nuts. Hints of cough syrup. Camphor. Cigar boxes with a whiff of smoke at the background.
Taste Comment: Now more on oranges and tangerines. Dried apricots. Figs. Some mushrooms and leafiness. Tannins. Fudgy notes of butterscotch and rum-toffee. Later on hints of peat but in a gentle way. It's punchy and waxy with a full mouth texture. Lots of taste developments, but perfectly balanced.
Finish Comment: Quite long. Cinnamon. A little ginger. Clove. Pine at the end.

위스키 이름: Springbank1966

향(Nose): Very complex nose with fruity sweetness of pear and melon mixed with candied apples. Gingerbread. Beeswax. Mineral notes of wet stones as well. Roasted nuts. Hints of cough syrup. Camphor. Cigar boxes with a whiff of smoke at the background.

맛(Taste): Now more on oranges and tangerines. Dried apricots. Figs. Some mushrooms and leafiness. Tannins. Fudgy notes of butterscotch and rum-toffee. Later on hints of peat but in a gentle way. It's punchy and waxy with a full mouth texture. Lots of taste developments, but perfectly balanced.

피니쉬(Finish): Quite long. Cinnamon. A little ginger. Clove. Pine at the end.

Nose Comment: After such a long period of bottle aging and opening, the wine body is still arrogant. It has a texture between agar and wax. The candle oil and alcohol are slightly stronger, showing the stems and leaves and fruit vines of early spring. The main flavor is a platter of canned temperate fruits, yellow peach, pineapple pie, lemon tart, milk fragrant raisin crisp, stone cell, nanguo pear, pudding, and dried smoked flowers. The bottom layer has a faint smell of the ocean, mineral water, salt on the watermelon, looming roasted butter, very little smoke, there should be no peat, but this kind of clean and transparent has to make people think of Cao Lina. The woody smell is not heavy, or rather it does not appear as regular oak and nuts, fat powder, dried longan, and mushroom slices.\nIt can be seen that it is a bourbon bucket that has worked very hard without the blessing of peat.
Taste Comment: The theme is still temperate fruits, but from the waxy sweet jam to the sweet and sour summer iced drink, kumquat lemon tea, star fruit, slightly sour frozen pear, pineapple pie, papaya jelly, lemon tart, Turkish salted cucumber yogurt. The wood is uplifted, with the bitterness of tea, choroid, and vine pepper branches.\nIt is a pity that the oceanic temperament in the smell is swallowed by the high vintage barrel.\nStrong, good fat, sweet, sour, no tannins, no astringency, less bitterness, no slightly spicy, slightly alcoholic smell, no taste.
Finish Comment: Normally, Hang Ju Long Well, the green fruit is colorful and flower vines.

The woody smell is not heavy, or rather it does not appear as regular oak and nuts, fat powder, dried longan, and mushroom slices.\nIt can be seen that it is a bourbon bucket that has worked very hard without the blessing of peat.

The wood is uplifted, with the bitterness of tea, choroid, and vine pepper branches.\nIt is a pity that the oceanic temperament in the smell is swallowed by the high vintage barrel.\nStrong, good fat, sweet, sour, no tannins, no astringency, less bitterness, no slightly spicy, slightly alcoholic smell, no taste.

Nose Comment: This is quite medicinal and light, to be honest the nose is closed and a distant.\nLemon drizzle cake, light peat, hint of vanilla, candle wax and ah yes the spoiler, the Ardbeg cheese note but it is not as bad as other Ardbegs I have had.
Taste Comment: Kappow, that is well peaty mixing with some cake and cream notes but there is also some cardboardy bitterness that spoils things a little.\nStarts to get creamy and the peat just numbs the tongue but there is some nice sherbet lemon fizz but it is a little one dimensional in parts but the sweet peat is very good indeed, the jury is out at the moment.
Finish Comment: Good length, very lively and getting a little sweet

Nose Comment: Dank earthy dunnage sherry with hints of woven peat. There are a plethora of tropical fruits bursting out of this glass. Dried apricots, cantaloupe melon, peaches, papaya, mangos, loads of stone fruits. There is a creamy sweet mustard note, rich cola, even hints of penicillin in the background.\nPerfection! An absolute masterpiece, something that will never be re-created in the future, truly a once-off piece of work.
Taste Comment: WOW!! Thick and so creamy on the palate! I know this is 57% but how could you even tell? The fruits come to life in the mouth, and a beautiful vinegarette throughout the mid-palate, honey, beeswax, hints of paraffin.
Finish Comment: The finish is so well-rounded, no alcohol burn that you would expect from this high abv. Beautiful oak spice on the finish, dank earth, and tropical fruit for days.

Dried apricots, cantaloupe melon, peaches, papaya, mangos, loads of stone fruits. There is a creamy sweet mustard note, rich cola, even hints of penicillin in the background.\nPerfection! An absolute masterpiece, something that will never be re-created in the future, truly a once-off piece of work.

Nose Comment:
First nose on herbaceous peat. Hay, dry grass.
Then we evolve on the spices. Clove, pepper, very light turmeric.
A little medicinal solvent, camphor, antiseptic.
Dried oranges, zest, lemons. We have a nice dose of dry citrus.
A tiny bit of green wood.
It's much more "intense" than the Longrow 1973 Samaroli at 48%.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth, there is a lot more fruit. They are oily, runny. Lemon, orange, mango, passion, papaya, pineapple. An exotic parade that I did not expect.
Light oak, pepper, almost a bit of potpourri.
Lots of minerality, with aspirin, chalk, some rainwater.
A nice salty side too, a nice dose of spray.
The peat is really set back at the start, but as it goes, it points the tip of its nose. Greasy, cold ash, a bit of barbecue.
Finish Comment: Long finish on soothing peat, cold ash, damp earth, spray, citrus zest, liquorice, camphor.
document_text:

Dried oranges, zest, lemons. We have a nice dose of dry citrus.
A tiny bit of green wood.
It's much more "intense" than the Longrow 1973 Samaroli at 48%.

맛(Taste) [점수: 95.0]: In the mouth, there is a lot more fruit. They are oily, runny. Lemon, orange, mango, passion, papaya, pineapple. An exotic parade that I did not expect.
Light oak, pepper, almost a bit of potpourri.
Lots of minerality, with aspirin, chalk, some rainwater.
A nice salty side too, a nice dose of spray.
The peat is really set back at the start, but as it goes, it points the tip of its nose. Greasy, cold ash, a bit of barbecue.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: Long finish on soothing peat, cold ash, damp earth, spray, citrus zest, liquorice, camphor.

Nose Comment:
What I call elegant, for its age I was expecting more wood on the nose.
There is a mix of yellow plum, a little dark honey, mango, orange jelly (like what is in a Jaffa cake).
After 5 minutes in the glass some cake notes emerge and there is the mere faintest hint of peat smoke but you really have to look for it with a little more time hints of grapefruit and something like a dried green herb smell, not sure what, possibly dried sage??????
No off note, nice mix of flavours.
Taste Comment:
Creamy and really lively and not woody on first taste , can you believe that after 75 years.
The fruits and everything really are in the background with the cream angle at the front, there is a faint hint of pineapple, grapefruit & plum but they take time to come through.
Seems to get more fruit as the time passes and some sherbet fizz which I really like.
There is a fresh brioche note and some dried fruit peels
Gets slightly syrupy which is really good and more spice comes in but it is actually peat that you are tasting that has been lurking in the background all this time
Finish Comment: Longer than expected, getting dry which is to be expected and more pastry notes on the tail with finally a slight bitterness from the wood but at this age I will not knock it down

Nose Comment:
This is like an ash tray with a few sherbet lemons thrown into it. Sweet cigar smoke, lemon, lime, the peat is that crisp sharp type and there appears to be a lot of seaweed in the mix.
A maritime Ardbeg of real quality.
If you leave it for 20 minutes in the glass with a lid on it takes on some farmy characteristics, basically manure cow stables that sort of thing.
will this be on the palate, if it is there could be a big score coming her, drum roll (just imagine please) :)
Taste Comment: Holy cow, this is one of the most peaty Ardbeg I have tried but it is mixed with stewed, slightly bitter fruits and sweet peat, what a combination.\nbut there is a little oak coming through here which detracts ever so slightly.
Finish Comment: Long, fizzy with the peat growing and a slight metallic note on the finish

Nose Comment: With extremely heavy soil, wet floor, dry wood chips, and dry tobacco as the central axis, the peat with strong soil texture is relatively inconspicuous, and the animal fat is strong, like butter, suet and rice. A Middle Eastern pilaf with a strong aroma, with obvious protein and sulfur . But with parsley baked and dried, dust from old wine houses, carpets that haven't been washed in ages. In conclusion, it has obvious old-fashioned feeling, and the flavor is more gloomy. 92
Taste Comment: Strong acidity, good state, citric acid, nutty, raw and firm, oloroso, a lot of caramel and maltose, and a lot of crisp tropical fruits at the end, pineapple rice, chakra fruit, funk mixed with a little gasoline. On the palate, the flavor base is balanced and finished with a heavy peppery finish, just like modern tesca. The wine is light, sweet and sour, and the flavor is condensed and simple. The tail has some bottle-aged oxidation, old newspaper, overripe tropical fruit, caramelization, etc. 92
Finish Comment: Sweet, refreshing, without bitterness, peppery, comfortable and simple, slightly spicy, but innocuous. 92

Nose Comment:
What power on the nose. We're on a very, very big Sherry.
It is above all the precious wood that stands out, with a nice dose of wax. Then we let ourselves be enchanted by the oily leather, also waxed. A beautiful pair of new shoes that are taken out of their box.
Dried fruits then take over. Figs, dates, almonds, pecans.
A little Kirsch, plum and a hint of blackcurrant. That continues on the redcurrant and cherry jam.
Then we go back to the hospital, with a nice dose of camphor and ground black pepper.
Chocolate appears as if by magic. Very black, very bitter. Then it evolves on coffee beans and gingerbread.
A very light damp earth finishes this nose. However much more discreet on other Karuizawa.
This nose is a whole story unfolding. That of 42 years in a magnificent cask.
With water: star anise and light smoke.
Taste Comment:
If the nose was powerful, the mouth returns the favor.
What a delight. The jammy fruits are there. Cherry, plum, blackcurrant, currant.
Precious wood wraps all these fruits. It is old, waxed, dusty. You can smell the resin of the wood.
We bite into a bar of dark chocolate, we breathe our bag of coffee. We bite into a stick of liquorice.
We still have this medicinal side, this camphor. Black pepper.
We also have the bitterness of Pu Ehr Shu which comes to mingle with that of wood.
A little cough syrup.
An old pipe, an old cigar, a nook in the woods.
Then to finish a little molasses, freshly laid macadam, motor oil. An old workbench left abandoned.
Breathtaking complexity.
With water: a little smoke, barbecue.
Finish Comment:
Long, delicious finish. Everything is here.
Camphor, liquorice, dried and red fruits, leather in abundance.
We do not forget the pepper, aromatic herbs, tobacco, cigars.
And obviously the wood, in all its nobility, in all its length.
It is interminable.
document_text:

It is above all the precious wood that stands out, with a nice dose of wax. Then we let ourselves be enchanted by the oily leather, also waxed. A beautiful pair of new shoes that are taken out of their box.

A little Kirsch, plum and a hint of blackcurrant. That continues on the redcurrant and cherry jam.
Then we go back to the hospital, with a nice dose of camphor and ground black pepper.

What a delight. The jammy fruits are there. Cherry, plum, blackcurrant, currant.
Precious wood wraps all these fruits. It is old, waxed, dusty. You can smell the resin of the wood.
We bite into a bar of dark chocolate, we breathe our bag of coffee. We bite into a stick of liquorice.

Nose Comment: A very complex, yet somewhat peculiar nose. Very musky initially. Lemongrass and bitter fruits like skin of grapes and plums. Chestnuts and walnuts. Raosted sweet potatoes. Herbal, lemon liqueur and olive oil. Mints and camphor, and slightly medicinal. Even though it is not specified, I think this is a refill sherry cask.
Taste Comment: Explodes in your mouth. Lots of oomph here. And yes, this most likely a sherry cask. Cherry cough syrup, orange liqueur. and a hint of honey. Mint and camphor again. A good amount of oak, yes, since this IS 36-37 years old, but definitely not egregious. In fact, it works pretty well here.
Finish Comment: Minus a point here due to dryness, and the wood is more apparently here. Remains a bit medicinal. Peppery finish (yes, this is Talisker, after all). Adding water is not necessary since it doesn't add to the development. Not a superstar due to somewhat of an uneven balance, but this is a very interesting, cerebral, complex dram that one cannot find in a modern whisky anymore. Miniature bottle.

A good amount of oak, yes, since this IS 36-37 years old, but definitely not egregious. In fact, it works pretty well here.

Not a superstar due to somewhat of an uneven balance, but this is a very interesting, cerebral, complex dram that one cannot find in a modern whisky anymore. Miniature bottle.

Nose Comment: Nothing shy about this one. Just a powerful, old-school sherry-matured whisky. Blackcurrants leading the way, but also a good amount of mirabelles, treacle, rich dark chocolate, white peaches, tinned pineapple, apricots and quinces. There’s a sliver of soy too, which not everybody seems to enjoy in their sherried whiskies, but I certainly do. Also old oak, bung cloth, burnt toast and earthen forest floors.
Taste Comment: Intensely powerful! Probably partly because of the high abv, but mostly because it’s just a flavour bomb. The mouthfeel is oily, almost syrupy. Loads of dark chocolate, a few mushrooms, a pinch of white pepper, an assortment of berries, some coffee and thyme. Also slivers of cedar, a touch of resin and ginger. Finally slivers of tobacco and menthol.
Finish Comment: Long. As in, you’ll-taste-this-the-next-day-when-you-wake-up long. Elegant red berries, oak and soft herbs.
document_text:

향(Nose): Nothing shy about this one. Just a powerful, old-school sherry-matured whisky. Blackcurrants leading the way, but also a good amount of mirabelles, treacle, rich dark chocolate, white peaches, tinned pineapple, apricots and quinces. There’s a sliver of soy too, which not everybody seems to enjoy in their sherried whiskies, but I certainly do. Also old oak, bung cloth, burnt toast and earthen forest floors.

맛(Taste): Intensely powerful! Probably partly because of the high abv, but mostly because it’s just a flavour bomb. The mouthfeel is oily, almost syrupy. Loads of dark chocolate, a few mushrooms, a pinch of white pepper, an assortment of berries, some coffee and thyme. Also slivers of cedar, a touch of resin and ginger. Finally slivers of tobacco and menthol.

피니쉬(Finish): Long. As in, you’ll-taste-this-the-next-day-when-you-wake-up long. Elegant red berries, oak and soft herbs.

Nose Comment: Yes, the classic 1960s Bowmore mix of cat piss and tropical fruit is clearly there. That means pineapple-cubes, mango and Reine Claudes. Followed by leafy notes mixed with gooseberries and apple mint. Hints of green bananas and some sandal wood. Later on also whiff of eucalyptus, rhododendrons and cut-grass.
Taste Comment: Now the pink grapefruit bitterness marches in accompanied by passion fruit and a little kiwi fruit. Plenty of aniseed and bergamot. Touch of vanilla and honey-clover as well. Faint mineral notes. Gentle peat notes in the background. It's all very fragile but complex. Very nice! .
Finish Comment: Very long with gentle spices of cinnamon, ginger and white pepper. Menthol in the end.
document_text:
