태그: Citric,Fresh Fruit,New Wood

향(Nose): Yes, the classic 1960s Bowmore mix of cat piss and tropical fruit is clearly there. That means pineapple-cubes, mango and Reine Claudes. Followed by leafy notes mixed with gooseberries and apple mint. Hints of green bananas and some sandal wood. Later on also whiff of eucalyptus, rhododendrons and cut-grass.

맛(Taste): Now the pink grapefruit bitterness marches in accompanied by passion fruit and a little kiwi fruit. Plenty of aniseed and bergamot. Touch of vanilla and honey-clover as well. Faint mineral notes. Gentle peat notes in the background. It's all very fragile but complex. Very nice! .

피니쉬(Finish): Very long with gentle spices of cinnamon, ginger and white pepper. Menthol in the end.

Nose Comment: Intense, heavy, dark fruits, dried fruits, dates, figs, prunes, burned brown sugar, old rhum, truck loads of raisins - I think most of it has already been mentioned before but it is true. I also get a sea breeze and and some heavy oaky notes. Compared to the 1966 Cask 1438 it is definitely heavier. - Great!
Taste Comment: Very oily and liquorice, thick, mellow, creamy, but still quite punchy, dark chocolate, espresso, heavy oak and molasses, good sweetness, really not to much drying, all of the dark fruits again.\nWith water more aromas such as toffee, fudge and even some citrus fruits appear - Fantastic!
Finish Comment: Long and burning, sweet and woody, zesty, not much drying - really good!
document_text:

I also get a sea breeze and and some heavy oaky notes. Compared to the 1966 Cask 1438 it is definitely heavier. - Great!

맛(Taste): Very oily and liquorice, thick, mellow, creamy, but still quite punchy, dark chocolate, espresso, heavy oak and molasses, good sweetness, really not to much drying, all of the dark fruits again.\nWith water more aromas such as toffee, fudge and even some citrus fruits appear - Fantastic!

Nose Comment: A nice nose smells spicy & fruity, oils of various descriptions, wood varnish, teak oil, and then there is a basket of stewed fruits, mango, peach and then some rich fruit cake.\nIt is very restrained for 53% personally I was expecting this to be more expressive??
Taste Comment: Peat and lots of it that I did not detect on the nose, and a nice sherry that is perfectly weighted with a nice blast of fruit and even nicer blast of spice, this is a fizzy one, there is a little woody bitterness and that is something I am really sensitive to but this is in acceptable limits even for me.\nThe spice and peat seem to grow, some ginger creeping in but the bitterness grows a little too
Finish Comment: good length, spicy to the finish.\nWith Water :-\nThere is an orange note now on the nose, and the palate has smoothed out now to a certain extent on the mouthfeel but the peat has grown along with the spice and the fruit while still there, is in the background

Nose Comment: Beautiful to be honest, stewed fruits galore, mango, peach, plum hints of orange but to go with that is brine and a little peat.\nWarm French pastry, fresh out the oven, and then something a little herbal and little floral with a returning biscuit note.\nIf you leave it for 15 minutes some sweet cigar smoke emerges.
Taste Comment: Fizzy and fruity is my first impression the fruit is is the front of the palate and coats your tongue, syrupy if you like and the fruit that the nose suggested is in the palate and then some.\nThe fruit is not sharp but like a well stewed fruit cocktail.\nThe peat is kept in check by the fruit and the is a lovely salted caramel note that adds to the overall profile.
Finish Comment: Very elegant, sweet, fruity with the peat growing but always in the background.

Nose Comment: Surprisingly tropical and lots of dried fruits! Pineapples, orange rind, grapefruit, apricots, with a little bit of the raisin/plum/fig from the sherry. A little bit of cigar smoke, dark chocolate, and old cognac scents as well. Gets super honeyed and waxy after 15 minutes or so. A really well integrated and pleasant nose.
Taste Comment: Fruits galore: oranges, raisins, orange flavoured raisins, and raisin flavoured oranges. Caramelized pineapple and cinnamon-nutmeg, Demerara sugars, thick Manuka honey, certainly paxarette-influenced and that’s a good thing. It doesn’t quite live up to the glory of the nose but it gets pretty close!
Finish Comment: Short-medium, the low ABV really hurts it in the finish but also makes it incredibly drinkable. You could have 2 pours and still not exhaust the palate or throat. Very herbal on the finish, lots of sandalwood, old oak, a bit of camphor, and rosemary sensations with hints of orange and apricot. A real palate freshener though!

Nose Comment: Not particularly expressive, closed to be honest, may need a few drops of water to open it up.\nThere is some menthol and a really nice dark fruit jam smell, mixed with bonfire smoke and peat, interesting for sure.\nAfter 5 minutes it gets even better on treacle sponge and date slice.
Taste Comment: This is more like a heavy sherried Lomgmorn or Mortlach but with more peat, as it is Jammy like some of those first fill sherried Speysiders are.\nInfused with the sherry is plenty of oak which is drying and a little bitter.\nWith a few drops of water, much better balance and sweeter on raspberry, blackcurrant and more peat has been released
Finish Comment: decent length getting sweeter, peat lingering to the end

Nose Comment: The colour is yellow gold and the nose offers an adorable old style profile with lots of unusual aromas like tree resins, gauze bandages, wax polish, motor oil and wet forest floor - beside the tradtional Speyside fruits, honeys and spices. Very, very interesting and all perfectly balanced without any off-note. Later some beeswaxy and oily notes join in that turn it even more complex and delicate. Several minutes later I feel like I am in a joiner's workshop with fresh cut and older wooden aromas and a whiff of furniture polish and solid glue. Great stuff, no doubt!
Taste Comment: The taste is excellent, too! There is a delicious fruit salad with a honey and caramel topping that is slightly burnt. Some fine peaty-ashy flavours pop up in the next layer before the forest floor returns with pine needles and resins. After that the spices kick in followed by an old herbal liqueur while some hints of chocolate lurk in the background. This is a great movie on my palate!
Finish Comment: The initial mouthfeel is warming and charming with a creamy coating and no distracting moments. The finish is of medium length and adds liquorice notes and some drying ashy-metallic moments that are not distracting at all. Water releases additional grassy and chalky-mineral aromas in the nose and turns the taste even more mellow - but I like the neat dram better...
document_text:
위스키 이름: Mortlach1962 RWD
태그: Leafy,Malt Extract,Chocolate,Citric,Fresh Fruit,Hay-like,Honey,Medicinal,Oily,Old Wood,Smokey,Tobacco,Vanilla

향(Nose) [점수: 93.0]: The colour is yellow gold and the nose offers an adorable old style profile with lots of unusual aromas like tree resins, gauze bandages, wax polish, motor oil and wet forest floor - beside the tradtional Speyside fruits, honeys and spices. Very, very interesting and all perfectly balanced without any off-note. Later some beeswaxy and oily notes join in that turn it even more complex and delicate. Several minutes later I feel like I am in a joiner's workshop with fresh cut and older wooden aromas and a whiff of furniture polish and solid glue. Great stuff, no doubt!

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: The taste is excellent, too! There is a delicious fruit salad with a honey and caramel topping that is slightly burnt. Some fine peaty-ashy flavours pop up in the next layer before the forest floor returns with pine needles and resins. After that the spices kick in followed by an old herbal liqueur while some hints of chocolate lurk in the background. This is a great movie on my palate!

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: The initial mouthfeel is warming and charming with a creamy coating and no distracting moments. The finish is of medium length and adds liquorice notes and some drying ashy-metallic moments that are not distracting at all. Water releases additional grassy and chalky-mineral aromas in the nose and turns the taste even more mellow - but I like the neat dram better...

Nose Comment:
The nose has a rather weak intensity.
We are in the delicate, the sweet, and clearly in the complexity.
A superb pear above all, which comes with its dose of harshness. Then the exotic fruits are revealed.
Passion, lemon, sweet pineapple, dragon fruit.
Oddly enough we also smell a bit of Umeshu.
Light white flower, liquorice and black pepper complete the picture.
Taste Comment:
On the palate it is expressive while remaining soft and silky.
We feel a certain fragility, but fortunately it holds.
Fruit is in the foreground there too.
Passion fruit, mango, pineapple, plum, orange, guava. A real fruit cocktail.
We have a big salty side, and a little bit of ash that come and go as the tasting takes place.
Light ginger.
We also feel a little dust, old book. A little metallic too, which indicates a nice aging in a carafe.
Finish Comment: The finish is smooth, on OBE, metallic, fruit and liquorice. A little oily peat. It's long, but a little watery.\nIn the aftertaste, we have pineapple, bark and a little clove.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Bowmore1964 Bicentenary

향(Nose) [점수: 93.0]: The nose has a rather weak intensity.
We are in the delicate, the sweet, and clearly in the complexity.
A superb pear above all, which comes with its dose of harshness. Then the exotic fruits are revealed.
Passion, lemon, sweet pineapple, dragon fruit.
Oddly enough we also smell a bit of Umeshu.
Light white flower, liquorice and black pepper complete the picture.

맛(Taste) [점수: 93.0]: On the palate it is expressive while remaining soft and silky.
We feel a certain fragility, but fortunately it holds.
Fruit is in the foreground there too.
Passion fruit, mango, pineapple, plum, orange, guava. A real fruit cocktail.
We have a big salty side, and a little bit of ash that come and go as the tasting takes place.
Light ginger.
We also feel a little dust, old book. A little metallic too, which indicates a nice aging in a carafe.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 89.0]: The finish is smooth, on OBE, metallic, fruit and liquorice. A little oily peat. It's long, but a little watery.
In the aftertaste, we have pineapple, bark and a little clove.

Nose Comment:
What a nose! A slap.
I think that with a degree of 40.6%, we are on a natural reduction, and tasting this 68 after the It 65, the sensation is really different.
It's much creamier here, with juicy orange, mango, ugli grapefruit, passion fruit, papaya.
All these fruits are integrated, mixed, and form a beautiful multivitamin juice.
There is sea spray and a slight mineral austerity.
Wood, light clove.
After the fruit, the zest, which adds a nice presence and complexity.
Taste Comment:
On the palate, we start with a nice dose of sweetness and honey.
The fruit is rolled up in sugar, with mango, passion fruit, orange, grapefruit.
It's round, creamy, generous.
We also have guava, pineapple, starfruit, granny apple... I can't name them all.
Light wood, cinnamon, toffee, pepper. Slight Barba Papa.
It's all velvet.
Finish Comment:
The finish is long, with a chiseled and precise exoticism.
Passion fruit, mango, pineapple, grapefruit. Superb.
Pepper, wood, clove, light toffee.
Rather saline, with a nice spray.
Light smoke.
document_text:

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: What a nose! A slap.
I think that with a degree of 40.6%, we are on a natural reduction, and tasting this 68 after the It 65, the sensation is really different.
It's much creamier here, with juicy orange, mango, ugli grapefruit, passion fruit, papaya.
All these fruits are integrated, mixed, and form a beautiful multivitamin juice.
There is sea spray and a slight mineral austerity.
Wood, light clove.
After the fruit, the zest, which adds a nice presence and complexity.

The fruit is rolled up in sugar, with mango, passion fruit, orange, grapefruit.
It's round, creamy, generous.
We also have guava, pineapple, starfruit, granny apple... I can't name them all.
Light wood, cinnamon, toffee, pepper. Slight Barba Papa.
It's all velvet.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: The finish is long, with a chiseled and precise exoticism.
Passion fruit, mango, pineapple, grapefruit. Superb.
Pepper, wood, clove, light toffee.
Rather saline, with a nice spray.
Light smoke.

Nose Comment: A highly attractive and appealing blend of fresh tropical fruits on the one hand and a mineral note on the other, although I was not expecting the latter aroma at all, as I have hardly ever encountered it in Springbank bottlings that have been aged for more than 18 years.\nSo here you can enjoy pineapple, lime peel, apricots and peaches on saltwater-moist pebbles, and there's plenty of it. Unlike the distillery's younger examples, this mineral note does not mean that the nose has to be described as robust or pithy, because despite all the (fruity) minerality, it remains creamy, almost waxy.\nOver time, spicy notes emerge, but these are essentially limited to grated nutmeg and a mild pepper note. This is a good thing, because it means you can enjoy the lovely fruit aromas for longer.
Taste Comment: Incredibly creamy start with a wonderful fruit salad of apricots, peaches, mango and banana. The taste also has an amazingly clear mineral note, which in combination with the fruit aromas is simply fantastic. Subtly dry oak, vanilla pudding, rapeseed honey, cafe au lait. In between, a slight tingling at the tip of the tongue, which creates a slight effervescent tablet feeling. It quickly disappears again. The creamy fruit aromas return and linger around the entire mouth for a good while.
Finish Comment: A long, not particularly dry but still very fruity finish completes the picture. Still mineral, peach predominates now, honey and vanilla, a hint of oak spice.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Springbank1998
태그: Chocolate,Vanilla

향(Nose): A highly attractive and appealing blend of fresh tropical fruits on the one hand and a mineral note on the other, although I was not expecting the latter aroma at all, as I have hardly ever encountered it in Springbank bottlings that have been aged for more than 18 years.\nSo here you can enjoy pineapple, lime peel, apricots and peaches on saltwater-moist pebbles, and there's plenty of it. Unlike the distillery's younger examples, this mineral note does not mean that the nose has to be described as robust or pithy, because despite all the (fruity) minerality, it remains creamy, almost waxy.\nOver time, spicy notes emerge, but these are essentially limited to grated nutmeg and a mild pepper note. This is a good thing, because it means you can enjoy the lovely fruit aromas for longer.

맛(Taste): Incredibly creamy start with a wonderful fruit salad of apricots, peaches, mango and banana. The taste also has an amazingly clear mineral note, which in combination with the fruit aromas is simply fantastic. Subtly dry oak, vanilla pudding, rapeseed honey, cafe au lait. In between, a slight tingling at the tip of the tongue, which creates a slight effervescent tablet feeling. It quickly disappears again. The creamy fruit aromas return and linger around the entire mouth for a good while.

피니쉬(Finish): A long, not particularly dry but still very fruity finish completes the picture. Still mineral, peach predominates now, honey and vanilla, a hint of oak spice.

Nose Comment: Shoe polish, hansaplast, dirty smoke, coal tar, soot, wood tar, sweet spices, dark wood, beeswax
Taste Comment: Sweet spices, dirty smoke, wood tar, dark sugar, dark wood, chocolate, a bit of salmiak
Finish Comment: Sweet dirty smoke, sweet spices, dark sugar, dark wood, wood tar

Nose Comment: Fresh, fruity, honey, brown sugar, some dried fruits, sea breeze, seaweed, woody notes and perhaps pineapples too - really not bad
Taste Comment: Punchy, oily, creamy, liquorice, salty, seaweed again, good balance of wood notes and subtle sweetness, fruity again with more citrus fruits but also hints of tropical fruits, sugar cane - very good
Finish Comment: Long and warm, even more punchy, very special wood notes but not drying at all
document_text:
위스키 이름: Springbank1973 CA
태그: Mossy,Vegetative,Fresh Fruit,Kippery,New Wood,Toasted

향(Nose): Fresh, fruity, honey, brown sugar, some dried fruits, sea breeze, seaweed, woody notes and perhaps pineapples too - really not bad

맛(Taste): Punchy, oily, creamy, liquorice, salty, seaweed again, good balance of wood notes and subtle sweetness, fruity again with more citrus fruits but also hints of tropical fruits, sugar cane - very good

피니쉬(Finish): Long and warm, even more punchy, very special wood notes but not drying at all

Nose Comment: A quintessential BenRiach 1976, with a luscious tropical fruitiness. Among others: mango, guava, passion fruit, lychee, tangerine... a very aromatic fruit basket. Some lokum and rosehip syrup. Nice oily notes (coconut oil, beeswax). Honey. A distinct creaminess as well, like strawberries with cream. Some spices (cinnamon, nutmeg) which make it less summery than cask #3029 (Shinanoya) for example, but add more depth and vibrance. Develops perfect mint over time.
Taste Comment: Again deeply fruity, with similar aromas. Mango, pineapple, tangerine, big notes of pink grapefruit with honey. Perfect balance of warm, vanilla fruits and greener, fresher citrusy notes. All this with a veil of polished oak and spices. Very interwoven, smooth and delicate on the outside but full of sparkles and tiny nuances further down. Some chocolate and nutty notes towards the end, hints of toffee, what a nice evolution.
Finish Comment: Very long, creamy and jammy with a light herbal edge and oily mint.
document_text:
위스키 이름: BenRiach1976

향(Nose): A quintessential BenRiach 1976, with a luscious tropical fruitiness. Among others: mango, guava, passion fruit, lychee, tangerine... a very aromatic fruit basket. Some lokum and rosehip syrup. Nice oily notes (coconut oil, beeswax). Honey. A distinct creaminess as well, like strawberries with cream. Some spices (cinnamon, nutmeg) which make it less summery than cask #3029 (Shinanoya) for example, but add more depth and vibrance. Develops perfect mint over time.

맛(Taste): Again deeply fruity, with similar aromas. Mango, pineapple, tangerine, big notes of pink grapefruit with honey. Perfect balance of warm, vanilla fruits and greener, fresher citrusy notes. All this with a veil of polished oak and spices. Very interwoven, smooth and delicate on the outside but full of sparkles and tiny nuances further down. Some chocolate and nutty notes towards the end, hints of toffee, what a nice evolution.

피니쉬(Finish): Very long, creamy and jammy with a light herbal edge and oily mint.

Nose Comment: Very warm honey and vanilla notes, nice wood notes, fruity, apple compot, apricots, blood oranges - very nice!
Taste Comment: Very oily and liquorice at first - and then punchy and powerful - woahh, unbelievable! Are they sure this is only 46% abv?\nAfter the burning is over there are nicely balanced woody notes with a good sweetness. Fruity notes following the nose and more spicy, peppery notes.
Finish Comment: Long and burning - the fruity sweetness makes it really nice.\nWith water it got much smoother and fruity - actually very good.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: Long and burning - the fruity sweetness makes it really nice.\nWith water it got much smoother and fruity - actually very good.

Nose Comment: peat and sherry tightly combined, faints hints of banana, brine, seaweed, toffee, ice cream wafer, caramels, touch of honey and dried fruits with a dose of English breakfast marmalade.
Taste Comment: Sweet peat mixing beautifully with the sherry, the peat is not overpowering in any way and stewed fruits come through, grapefruit, pineapple & mango, a little chocolate and Turkish delight notes perhaps a little rhubarb and custard?
Finish Comment: Getting sweeter with the peat coming back a little.\nWith water the nose is more distant and the palate is more restrained, a little weaker so do not add more than a few drops.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Laphroaig40-year-old
태그: Smokey,Hay-like,Honey,Leathery,Malt Extract,Citric,Dried Fruit,Old Wood,Sherried,Toasted,Tobacco,Vanilla,Medicinal,New Wood,Nutty,Solvent

향(Nose): peat and sherry tightly combined, faints hints of banana, brine, seaweed, toffee, ice cream wafer, caramels, touch of honey and dried fruits with a dose of English breakfast marmalade.

맛(Taste): Sweet peat mixing beautifully with the sherry, the peat is not overpowering in any way and stewed fruits come through, grapefruit, pineapple & mango, a little chocolate and Turkish delight notes perhaps a little rhubarb and custard?

피니쉬(Finish): Getting sweeter with the peat coming back a little.\nWith water the nose is more distant and the palate is more restrained, a little weaker so do not add more than a few drops.

Nose Comment: Intense and one of the more heavily sherried examples that I've tasted at this age. Beeswax, Demerara sugar, burlap and lots of dried red fruits. A few drops of triple sec, notes of roasted coffee beans, as well as a fair amount of praline chocolates. That balance! That complexity! My god, this is heaven...
Taste Comment: A syrupy mouthfeel is the first sign of good things to come. Rich and big bodied. Notes of menthol, but also cigar tobacco, leather, and bitter espresso. Rum-soaked raisins, as well as a hint of aceto balsamico. Some soft tannins, which is pretty remarkable at this age, and a whiff of liquorice root. A touch of smoke is in there as well.
Finish Comment: Lingering spices and charred oak. A whiff of pepper. Long and memorable.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glen Grant1956 GM

향(Nose): Intense and one of the more heavily sherried examples that I've tasted at this age. Beeswax, Demerara sugar, burlap and lots of dried red fruits. A few drops of triple sec, notes of roasted coffee beans, as well as a fair amount of praline chocolates. That balance! That complexity! My god, this is heaven...

맛(Taste): A syrupy mouthfeel is the first sign of good things to come. Rich and big bodied. Notes of menthol, but also cigar tobacco, leather, and bitter espresso. Rum-soaked raisins, as well as a hint of aceto balsamico. Some soft tannins, which is pretty remarkable at this age, and a whiff of liquorice root. A touch of smoke is in there as well.

피니쉬(Finish): Lingering spices and charred oak. A whiff of pepper. Long and memorable.

Nose Comment: Now that is a nose of quality, lots of fruit, ripe plum, peach, cinder toffee, rich chocolate, dark honey, furniture polish,
Taste Comment: Full on attack that coats the tongue, sherry, peat, woody bitterness, hints of orange, Christmas spices like you get in mulled wine, buttercream, caramel, rich plum, dark cherries that are almost ove ripe
Finish Comment: Long, still dances on the tongue, with a battle between the woody bitterness and sweet fruit right to the end.

Nose Comment: It is surprisingly fresh and bright with light sherry notes in the guise of sultanas and Reine Claude plums on the one hand, but also some fresh coconut and white fruit on the other. It has some resin, which works perfectly. Freshly polished hardwood floor, some thyme and freshly cut grass. Add some overripe banana and you have a nose that nears perfection.
Taste Comment: I would not have minded a bit more body. It’s a bit light. But taste wise, this is a solid malt. A handful of nuts, butterscotch and something that reminds me of the better Cognac. Some earthy notes and woodsmoke give it that old school touch that I have learned to appreciate in older Glen Grant.
Finish Comment: The finish is medium long with hints of white fruit, vanilla and allspice.

맛(Taste): I would not have minded a bit more body. It’s a bit light. But taste wise, this is a solid malt. A handful of nuts, butterscotch and something that reminds me of the better Cognac. Some earthy notes and woodsmoke give it that old school touch that I have learned to appreciate in older Glen Grant.

피니쉬(Finish): The finish is medium long with hints of white fruit, vanilla and allspice.

Nose Comment: A rather delicate nose for an Ardbeg, with an ashy peat scented with fir bark.\nMaple syrup and concentrated and sweet red and black fruits.\nA little molasses and leather.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it's a slap in the face.
A fruit juice with peat.
Raspberry, blackberry, currant, with ash, peppermint.
Then we have leather, gentian, resin.
Stunning.
Finish Comment: Long and fresh finish on ashy peat, red fruit, pepper, leather.

Nose Comment: 75ardbeg peat doesn't seem to be as heavy as previous years? The oak barrel is dry and dry, lacking in flesh. Shirley is manifested as red fruit, mahogany, Chinese medicinal herbs, chocolate, shredded ginger, and Xinjiang jujube. The winery style is not obvious, the peat is slightly lighter, there is no ocean wind, some citrus, purple flowers and handmade soap.
Taste Comment: An illusion of using ex-Kavalan solist casks.\nAdd water: It tastes better, with rich fruit flavor, but still hot, tannin, and sour. Shirley basically smells the same, but the sweetness is much improved, and there are more nuts, maltose and matcha powder. The peat is stronger than expected, pepper, sea salt, and the ending turns to ginger sugar and bitter bottom.
Finish Comment: Long, red dates, sweet and bitter, tobacco, wood tannins.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1975 Blo

향(Nose): 75ardbeg peat doesn't seem to be as heavy as previous years? The oak barrel is dry and dry, lacking in flesh. Shirley is manifested as red fruit, mahogany, Chinese medicinal herbs, chocolate, shredded ginger, and Xinjiang jujube. The winery style is not obvious, the peat is slightly lighter, there is no ocean wind, some citrus, purple flowers and handmade soap.

맛(Taste): An illusion of using ex-Kavalan solist casks.\nAdd water: It tastes better, with rich fruit flavor, but still hot, tannin, and sour. Shirley basically smells the same, but the sweetness is much improved, and there are more nuts, maltose and matcha powder. The peat is stronger than expected, pepper, sea salt, and the ending turns to ginger sugar and bitter bottom.

피니쉬(Finish): Long, red dates, sweet and bitter, tobacco, wood tannins.

Finish Comment: Long, warm, sherry wood, chocolate, tobacco, hint of leather, more dried fruits, more tannic but not drying - still great
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenfarclas1971

향(Nose) [점수: 92.0]: Menthol, eucalypus, liquorice, dried fruits, nuts, tobacco, sherry wood, dark honey, hint of green hazelnut, dark chocolate, cocoa - very good!

맛(Taste) [점수: 93.0]: Oily, creamy, tobacco, dried fruits, plums, figs, dates, acacia honey, molasses, spices, nutmeg, pepper, sherry wood, good sweetness, little tannic - great!

Nose Comment: Sherry, a lot of sherry, married to precious wood and tangerine. Alcohol vapors come, however, tickling your nostrils. Leave him time. As the alcohol evaporates, there is balsamic vinegar, very light rubbery notes, a touch of charcoal smoke, then exotic fruits (guava, papaya) whose aromas initially weak amplify until 'to occupy the front of the stage. It's melted, sweet and very pleasant.
Taste Comment: In the extension of the nose. She does not lack power but we could have wished a little more lively. In any case, it still has exotic notes, but more on dried fruit than fresh this time. The woody tumbles in the middle of the mouth and elbows with the fruits without managing to hide them. Fresh, spicy notes of clove finish the party. Alcohol is perfectly integrated.
Finish Comment: Of medium length, it is slightly astringent and develops on the wood, the clove leaving a pleasant freshness in mouth.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glendronach1972
태그: Cooked Vegetable

향(Nose): Sherry, a lot of sherry, married to precious wood and tangerine. Alcohol vapors come, however, tickling your nostrils. Leave him time. As the alcohol evaporates, there is balsamic vinegar, very light rubbery notes, a touch of charcoal smoke, then exotic fruits (guava, papaya) whose aromas initially weak amplify until 'to occupy the front of the stage. It's melted, sweet and very pleasant.

맛(Taste): In the extension of the nose. She does not lack power but we could have wished a little more lively. In any case, it still has exotic notes, but more on dried fruit than fresh this time. The woody tumbles in the middle of the mouth and elbows with the fruits without managing to hide them. Fresh, spicy notes of clove finish the party. Alcohol is perfectly integrated.

피니쉬(Finish): Of medium length, it is slightly astringent and develops on the wood, the clove leaving a pleasant freshness in mouth.

Nose Comment: Deep and rich sherry oak, ripe bananas, little vanilla and subtle sweetness
Taste Comment: Fantastic sherry oak, good sweetness but probably a bit drier than other old Macallans - somehow more straight but also more powerful
Finish Comment: Long and almost burning
document_text:
위스키 이름: Macallan1954
태그: Honey,Sherried,Dried Fruit,Toasted,Tobacco

향(Nose): Deep and rich sherry oak, ripe bananas, little vanilla and subtle sweetness

맛(Taste): Fantastic sherry oak, good sweetness but probably a bit drier than other old Macallans - somehow more straight but also more powerful

피니쉬(Finish): Long and almost burning

Nose Comment:
Very nice velvety sherry.
Big fruit, big wood, big camphor. The Trinity is here.
Plum, currant, green pineapple, papaya, passion fruit. Kiwi.
Camphor, mint. Fresh.
Black pepper.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is softer and controlled.
Wood is more present with spices. Pepper, nutmeg.
The fruit stands out on the exoticism. Passion fruit and pineapple first and foremost.
The whole is wrapped in a superb oily camphor.
Finish Comment: Long finish on fruit, rum, camphor, spices. Sublime.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Longmorn1972 TWA
태그: Chocolate,Cooked Fruit,Fresh Fruit,Honey,New Wood,Oily,Sherried,Citric,Dried Fruit,Leafy,Leathery,Nutty,Solvent,Toasted,Tobacco

향(Nose): Very nice velvety sherry.\nBig fruit, big wood, big camphor. The Trinity is here.\nPlum, currant, green pineapple, papaya, passion fruit. Kiwi.\nCamphor, mint. Fresh.\nBlack pepper.

맛(Taste): In the mouth it is softer and controlled.\nWood is more present with spices. Pepper, nutmeg.\nThe fruit stands out on the exoticism. Passion fruit and pineapple first and foremost.\nThe whole is wrapped in a superb oily camphor.

피니쉬(Finish): Long finish on fruit, rum, camphor, spices. Sublime.

Nose Comment: Reluctant oak wood, hints of leather, dark fruits, toffee, espresso, dark chocolate - it's really interesting that the nose doesn't come strong despite the high abv - probably it needs more air
Taste Comment: Wow, phew, what a punch! Also very oily, thick, creamy - and now the fruits come like figs, dates, prunes, dried fruits, espresso again, toasted bread, more oak wood, but also some subtle sweetness\nWater is recommended: much smoother, more toffee and dried fruits
Finish Comment: Long and burning, more toffee and toasted bread in the end
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glengoyne1969

향(Nose): Reluctant oak wood, hints of leather, dark fruits, toffee, espresso, dark chocolate - it's really interesting that the nose doesn't come strong despite the high abv - probably it needs more air

맛(Taste): Wow, phew, what a punch! Also very oily, thick, creamy - and now the fruits come like figs, dates, prunes, dried fruits, espresso again, toasted bread, more oak wood, but also some subtle sweetness\nWater is recommended: much smoother, more toffee and dried fruits

피니쉬(Finish): Long and burning, more toffee and toasted bread in the end

Nose Comment: Very rich mixed with cinnamon, a little mulled wine spice, rum & raisin fudge, candied orange, damp wood, cranberry and finally a few bubble gum notes.
Taste Comment:
Very spicy and rich attack with peat evident from the start mixing with blackcurrant and some bitterness from the wood (to be expected at this age).
A very faint hint of liquorice but the peat is really taking off mixing with the spice.
Because of the complexity on show here and balance the wood is kept at bay but it is there and knocks it down a few points.
With a little water the spice and mainly the peat have really taken off.
Finish Comment: Spice, rich sherry and some really juicy dark fruit coming in on the tail.\nThis finish is the best part
document_text:
위스키 이름: Longmorn1964 GM

향(Nose) [점수: 91.0]: Very rich mixed with cinnamon, a little mulled wine spice, rum & raisin fudge, candied orange, damp wood, cranberry and finally a few bubble gum notes.

맛(Taste) [점수: 91.0]: Very spicy and rich attack with peat evident from the start mixing with blackcurrant and some bitterness from the wood (to be expected at this age).\nA very faint hint of liquorice but the peat is really taking off mixing with the spice.\nBecause of the complexity on show here and balance the wood is kept at bay but it is there and knocks it down a few points.\nWith a little water the spice and mainly the peat have really taken off.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Spice, rich sherry and some really juicy dark fruit coming in on the tail.\nThis finish is the best part

Nose Comment: Pure 1950s Christmas stollen on the nose, as you would wish from a Grant from the time if you are a sherry cask fan. Wonderfully lively and fresh, lots of orange and lemon zests gradually develop into pure, juicy sherry malt, some papaya and fresh honey, but then becomes heartier again with lots of brown sugar and some mocha, long development
Taste Comment: Mocha, papaya, lots of dark honey, Rancio, ancient cognac, orange zest and oil, oak ingeniously integrated, is expressed more in the fresh coffee notes, mango chips, raisins, fresh figs, ginger, fennel, roiboo tea, malt, plums, saffron, touch of eucalyptus
Finish Comment: Roiboo tea, ginger, rancio, raisins and figs, lemongrass, wonderfully complex and aromatic, long, balanced, dry-fruity-tea
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glen Grant1961 GM

향(Nose): Pure 1950s Christmas stollen on the nose, as you would wish from a Grant from the time if you are a sherry cask fan. Wonderfully lively and fresh, lots of orange and lemon zests gradually develop into pure, juicy sherry malt, some papaya and fresh honey, but then becomes heartier again with lots of brown sugar and some mocha, long development

맛(Taste): Mocha, papaya, lots of dark honey, Rancio, ancient cognac, orange zest and oil, oak ingeniously integrated, is expressed more in the fresh coffee notes, mango chips, raisins, fresh figs, ginger, fennel, roiboo tea, malt, plums, saffron, touch of eucalyptus

피니쉬(Finish): Roiboo tea, ginger, rancio, raisins and figs, lemongrass, wonderfully complex and aromatic, long, balanced, dry-fruity-tea

Nose Comment: Good nose., fig, plum, date, some spice and then a shoe polish note, but it is sweet, anyway I like it.\nExcellent nose
Taste Comment: No denying the quality of spirit here, the wood is knocking at the door but the sweet fruity sherry is holding it at bay, just.\nRaspberry & blackberry with a very faint bitter liquorice note.
Finish Comment: The finish is long, slightly fruity and warming

위스키 이름: Strathisla1963 GM
태그: Citric,Cooked Fruit,Cooked Mash,Fresh Fruit,New Wood,Oily,Solvent,Toasted,Tobacco

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: Good nose., fig, plum, date, some spice and then a shoe polish note, but it is sweet, anyway I like it.\nExcellent nose

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: No denying the quality of spirit here, the wood is knocking at the door but the sweet fruity sherry is holding it at bay, just.\nRaspberry & blackberry with a very faint bitter liquorice note.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: The finish is long, slightly fruity and warming

Nose Comment: Warming, fresh and fruity (oranges). Sea spray, orange zest and smoked fish.
Taste Comment: Powerful and peaty. Austere, clean and rather dry. There are notes of smoked tea, wood and hints of sherry, but the sherry is not obvious - still a typical old Ardbeg. Very tasty.
Finish Comment: Very long, peaty and pleasant.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1975

향(Nose): Warming, fresh and fruity (oranges). Sea spray, orange zest and smoked fish.

맛(Taste): Powerful and peaty. Austere, clean and rather dry. There are notes of smoked tea, wood and hints of sherry, but the sherry is not obvious - still a typical old Ardbeg. Very tasty.

피니쉬(Finish): Very long, peaty and pleasant.

Nose Comment: Awesome I hold the small sample bottle in my hands and free it from the thickly applied Parafilm. After pouring wonderfully silky and reddish amber sloshing in Premium Snifter, on the glass wall has formed a thick and oily streak. Long "legs" majestically pull their oily tracks back into the glass, but visually this old Macallan pleases me for the first time today. Ripe hazelnuts rise up creamy, creamy roasted flavors mingle with sweet caramelized sugar and creamy peach. Dark berries and grapes end in dried dates and raisins, hints of sour cherries and a delicate tobacco aroma beguile the senses. Mandarins, plums, hints of leather, tobacco and minimal smoky notes alternate sweet and fruity, the nose is incredibly balanced and creamy. The sweet and fruity base flavor will not let me go, for the first time I think I know what makes Paxarette. The sweet grape concentrate is dominant in the foreground, creamy nuts and bittersweet chocolate now and then make their way through the incredibly fruity sweetness, shadow morels and abrasion of orange peel massively stimulate the salivation. I could smell forever on this dreamy nose, the aroma is just beguiling!
Taste Comment: Sour cherries, with their spicy oak tones and dark berries, give off their unruly aroma at the first sip. Roasted hazelnuts and caramelized sugar are creamy, plums and dates stick to the tongue, hints of leather and dried tobacco leaves end up minimally tart on the tongue. Dried grapes and berries stick sweet and creamy on the palate, walnuts and cedar wood are dominated by raisins and hints of grapefruit. The mouthfeel is incredibly creamy and oily, from time to time nuts and slightly dry wood elements flash on. Minimal milk chocolate comes to light while the second sip of creamy and mildly flowing through the palate. Leather and tobacco then show up in full splendor and challenge the dark and dried fruits to dance. Chocolate, hazelnuts, roasted aromas, sour cherries, sweet caramel, sun-ripened raisins, toffee, plums, leather, tobacco, minimal smoke and old walnuts dance Viennese waltzes on the tongue and make me dream of the old good whisky times.
Finish Comment: Slowly the music stops and the dance couples dissolve. Nutty blurs the aromas, the sweet fruit sounds, creamy leather, tobacco and dark sherry aroma a felt eternity in memory. Cedar wood rests creamy with the faded leather and tobacco aromas on the palate, I gladly look to the side and take the last, final sip of this dreamy and special drop! The creamy nuts invite with leather, tobacco and the dark sherry aromas to another dance round. Again, the complete range of dreamy sherry flavors, including Paxarette and the dreamlike leather-tobacco combination is revealed.

Nose Comment: On first nosing, a bit of an alcoholic sting, but there is definitely some complexity hiding underneath... maybe I'll wait a bit. Yup. Subtle fruits of every kind... ripe mandarin oranges and fuji apples, stewed pears, green grapes, honeydew, rambutans. After a few drops of water, even lychees (my favorite fruit in a whisky, besides mangos)!! Very tropical!
Taste Comment: Wow, this is perfect. Reveals everything with first sip. Mouthfeel, complexity, balance, fruitiness, coats your mouth yumminess without being tired or old. There are also old leather books, and definitely a bit of old metallic tin boxes
Finish Comment: I would like this to be closer to 50% but you can't have everything in life, can you? The finish is nice and definitely not short, but with something of this potential, you sort of want this to last forever. Alas, it's still a great finish, without anything too oaky at all.

위스키 이름: Glenfarclas1954

향(Nose): On first nosing, a bit of an alcoholic sting, but there is definitely some complexity hiding underneath... maybe I'll wait a bit. Yup. Subtle fruits of every kind... ripe mandarin oranges and fuji apples, stewed pears, green grapes, honeydew, rambutans. After a few drops of water, even lychees (my favorite fruit in a whisky, besides mangos)!! Very tropical!

맛(Taste): Wow, this is perfect. Reveals everything with first sip. Mouthfeel, complexity, balance, fruitiness, coats your mouth yumminess without being tired or old. There are also old leather books, and definitely a bit of old metallic tin boxes

피니쉬(Finish): I would like this to be closer to 50% but you can't have everything in life, can you? The finish is nice and definitely not short, but with something of this potential, you sort of want this to last forever. Alas, it's still a great finish, without anything too oaky at all.

Nose Comment:
Austere nose at the same time, bursting with personality.
The aromas are melted, changing.
Peat is present on the hay. The smoke is light and stringy, as if swirling in the glass to balance the aromas.
We have a nice dose of citrus, mainly juicy orange and lemon.
A certain minerality, with chalk, aspirin.
A little pine honey, eucalyptus. Almost a drop of aromatic oil.
With aeration, a little bit of dragon fruit.
Taste Comment:
On the palate, it is oily, and overwhelming.
The aromas are quickly distributed in the mouth.
Above all the peat, soft and sweet, oily. The delicate and cold smoke. The mouth is lined.
Then citrus fruits, lemon, bergamot. Some aromatic herbs, such as dry thyme.
Pepper, a light woody flavor. Light caramel.
Finish Comment: Long finish on citrus fruits, cold smoke, barbecue, oily peat, honey. Very comforting.

Nose Comment: Intense, fresh fruits, oranges, apples, strawberries, bananas, honeydew, spices, cloves, cinnamon, hints of vanilla, fine notes of oak wood, little hints of nuts - superb!
Taste Comment: Little punchy, waxy, sirupy, very fruity, citrus fruits, blood oranges, mashed apples, jam, subtle sweetness balanced with finest oak wood, more spices, pepper, nutmeg - fantastic!
Finish Comment: Medium long, warm, more fruity, more fine woody notes, not drying - all great

Nose Comment: Fresh fruits of all kinds. Mangos, pineapples, papayas, guavas, blood oranges, tangerines, kiwis, lemons and limes. Loads of honey, beeswax, pollen, and honey-resins. All sorts of camphor, tiger balm, vapour ointments, sandalwood
Taste Comment: Herbal oils and more wild honeys and beeswax. Creme brûlée. Earthy and chewy peat. Sweetgrass and sandalwood. Sponge cake and salted caramel. Gets a bit citric with more blood oranges and some honeyed grapefruit type flavours
Finish Comment: Old cognac, menthol, rosemary, eucalyptus, camphor, and mint. It's enormously cooling in the mouth and warming down the throat. Sour lemons and limes, stewed orange peels, and a bit of limestone mineral aftertaste
document_text:
위스키 이름: Springbank1966

향(Nose): Fresh fruits of all kinds. Mangos, pineapples, papayas, guavas, blood oranges, tangerines, kiwis, lemons and limes. Loads of honey, beeswax, pollen, and honey-resins. All sorts of camphor, tiger balm, vapour ointments, sandalwood

맛(Taste): Herbal oils and more wild honeys and beeswax. Creme brûlée. Earthy and chewy peat. Sweetgrass and sandalwood. Sponge cake and salted caramel. Gets a bit citric with more blood oranges and some honeyed grapefruit type flavours

피니쉬(Finish): Old cognac, menthol, rosemary, eucalyptus, camphor, and mint. It's enormously cooling in the mouth and warming down the throat. Sour lemons and limes, stewed orange peels, and a bit of limestone mineral aftertaste

Nose Comment: Rumraisin-icecream, really good old cognac, a bit of glue in the beginning that starts little by little to open up a choir of tropical fruit: ripe mango, kiwi, passion fruit, different kinds of citrus-fruits as if mixed with Indian sugar, such is the width and depth of the unbelievably fresh sweetness. A little bit of Molkosan and sour apple-candy that (for some odd reason) is very close to some of my favorite Bunna sherry-classics, JM 20 1979 & DL 37 1974.
Taste Comment: The freshness! Almost perfect old oak that is fruity, sweet and sour in just the right combination. Waxiness, cognac-flambeed fruits, maple-syrup (a taste in whisky that I just love), mocha, different kinds of nuts, sacher-cake and an endless variety of delicious fruits.
Finish Comment: Long and strong on candlewax, fruits and sweet malt.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenglassaugh44-year-old

향(Nose): Rumraisin-icecream, really good old cognac, a bit of glue in the beginning that starts little by little to open up a choir of tropical fruit: ripe mango, kiwi, passion fruit, different kinds of citrus-fruits as if mixed with Indian sugar, such is the width and depth of the unbelievably fresh sweetness. A little bit of Molkosan and sour apple-candy that (for some odd reason) is very close to some of my favorite Bunna sherry-classics, JM 20 1979 & DL 37 1974.

맛(Taste): The freshness! Almost perfect old oak that is fruity, sweet and sour in just the right combination. Waxiness, cognac-flambeed fruits, maple-syrup (a taste in whisky that I just love), mocha, different kinds of nuts, sacher-cake and an endless variety of delicious fruits.

피니쉬(Finish): Long and strong on candlewax, fruits and sweet malt.

Nose Comment: Aromatic and perfumy, not necessarily peaty at all! lemon custards, old books and antiques, bonfire smoke, soots, intermediate soap between FWP and fruits, haha.
Taste Comment: Unique and dynamic, hazelnut and peat juice, chocolate spices, bonfire, sooty, hot and austere. Peat syrup.
Finish Comment: Hot, nutty, peaty, classic geery.

Nose Comment: This smells very, very nice. Quite intense aromas of passion fruits, mandarin oranges, and peach rose. So bright, so juicy.
Taste Comment: Can totally be an extremely fruity 1960's Bowmore, but the Macallan is not as "thick" or viscous. Still, this is absolutely delicious.
Finish Comment: Well, I wish this is bottled at a higher ABV but the finish is still great nonetheless. Lingering juiciness that make you want to pour another one.

맛(Taste) [점수: 95.0]: Can totally be an extremely fruity 1960's Bowmore, but the Macallan is not as "thick" or viscous. Still, this is absolutely delicious.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Well, I wish this is bottled at a higher ABV but the finish is still great nonetheless. Lingering juiciness that make you want to pour another one.

Nose Comment: Dried fruits galore, prune, plums, figs, apricot, jam, brown sugar, molasses, cooked oranges, tangerine zest, fine sherry wood, spices, little nutmeg, cloves, little mango and pineapple too, little citric - wow, so fruity - delicious!
Taste Comment: Little punchy, oily, little liquorice, good sweetness, more cooked and dried fruits, jam, truck loads of oranges, apricot, spices, cloves, pepper, xmas spice, hints of ginger, sherry wood - excellent!
Finish Comment: Long, warm wood, fruity, spicy, still good sweetness

Nose Comment: A complexity that commands true respect, the aroma palate is just like a masterpiece of classical music. At first, it introduces dark fruits of plum, prune, date, cherry and exotic fruits of very ripe mango, passion fruit. The second, it reveals notes of leather, oily, earthy, floral notes of violet and honeysuckle. The third play unfold lots of dried fruits of walnut, almond, fig and noble spices of cinnamon, cardamon, nutmeg and clove. Lastly, the fourth act introduces to a very subtle peat covered in sea spray and salt. Allowed it to breath for 30 minutes and with drops of water added, more exotic fruits appears alongside with dark fruits, and by now it becomes resinous (liquorice, pine) together with the scent of dried roses. Next, pepper, old furniture, sherry wood, dark chocolate, toasted bread and a gentle note of peat fill a setting full of spirituality.
Taste Comment: Rich, dense and silky on arrival. Bursting with fruits (orange, nectarine, fig, date, prune), spices (clove, nutmeg) and increasingly vanilla notes at the very first sip is so harmonious. A little while after, mango and dark chocolate appear, further enhance the profoundly fruity character. Gradually, a very fine note of peat then embellish the mid palate. This creates a very pleasant, lovely sensation of earthy silkiness. At the end of palate, red and black fruits arrive in a grand finale. With water: succulent notes of rose petal, Turkish delight and more spices emerged, and then it brings out a lot of tone and it has become considerably sleeker.
Finish Comment: Long. Warm and silky. Chocolate, mango, cherry liquor, beeswax and toffee fill a luxury, bright and impressive finish. It escape to collect more lingering notes of dark fruits, woody but not drying and honeycomb. The retro nasal now returns to a red and dark fruit territory with notes of cocoa bean. The empty glass is a variety of exotic fruits, spiced, aniseed and whiff of smoke taking turns to sparkle each other.
document_text:

This creates a very pleasant, lovely sensation of earthy silkiness. At the end of palate, red and black fruits arrive in a grand finale. With water: succulent notes of rose petal, Turkish delight and more spices emerged, and then it brings out a lot of tone and it has become considerably sleeker.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: Long. Warm and silky. Chocolate, mango, cherry liquor, beeswax and toffee fill a luxury, bright and impressive finish. It escape to collect more lingering notes of dark fruits, woody but not drying and honeycomb. The retro nasal now returns to a red and dark fruit territory with notes of cocoa bean. The empty glass is a variety of exotic fruits, spiced, aniseed and whiff of smoke taking turns to sparkle each other.

Nose Comment:
This smells like wet mud to me at first? there are certainly some clay, plasticine and putty notes on show.
After 5 minutes some fruit emerges and like the 72 DL I have just tried, some maritime notes.
I am really not sure about this one there is a hint of rotten eggs, perhaps not rotten but more like egg mayonnaise sandwich spread.
Sorry to say but there is a definite off note here that brings the points down, or so I thought but it is constantly changing in the glass so the jury is out.
I will leave it for 10 minutes
No change :(
Taste Comment: Massive peat, and not much else, this is not a multi layered Ardbeg palate, it is good , nice balance but if you take the peat/lemon note away there is a bitter note.
Finish Comment: Disappointing, fades far too quickly
document_text:

향(Nose) [점수: 85.0]: This smells like wet mud to me at first? there are certainly some clay, plasticine and putty notes on show.\nAfter 5 minutes some fruit emerges and like the 72 DL I have just tried, some maritime notes.\nI am really not sure about this one there is a hint of rotten eggs, perhaps not rotten but more like egg mayonnaise sandwich spread.\nSorry to say but there is a definite off note here that brings the points down, or so I thought but it is constantly changing in the glass so the jury is out.\nI will leave it for 10 minutes\nNo change :(

맛(Taste) [점수: 88.0]: Massive peat, and not much else, this is not a multi layered Ardbeg palate, it is good , nice balance but if you take the peat/lemon note away there is a bitter note.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 82.0]: Disappointing, fades far too quickly

Nose Comment: The hearty Shirley bomb has a perfect balance between sugar (nectar, ginger brown sugar, mocha, licorice), fruit (fig, red dates, persimmon, lemon) and smoke (bonfire, earth, leather). The oak barrels in the cooked wine for a long time bring the wine with salt butter, almonds and walnuts in coconut milk, wooden spice composed of turpentine and sweet ginger, which firmly covers the grain direction of yeast, pastries and sherry Herbs floating above, floral fragrance.\nAfter a little awakening, the flavor becomes young and lively, showing enhanced liqueur, yellow apricot and tropical fruits.
Taste Comment: Powerful and tempered wooden spices, pepper, white oak, shredded ginger, fried walnuts. Then comes the darker and darker dried sherry, citrus fruits, a small amount of grape skin, and the fruit flavor is lighter than expected, probably a refill. Finally, the caramel, turpentine, sea salt and other flavors of the winery will end.\nIt is fuller and stronger, with a good fat feel, medium sweetness, no tannins, a little sourness, and almost no bitter bottom.
Finish Comment: Longer, nuts, sea salt cocoa, citrus peel oil.

맛(Taste): Powerful and tempered wooden spices, pepper, white oak, shredded ginger, fried walnuts. Nose Comment: Clean crisp sherry with a slight orange marmalade note at first then mild ginger cake mixed with faint mocha.\nThe sherry seems to grow in intensity, all on dark fruits, blackberry, blackcurrant, damson plum.
Taste Comment: Jesus, that is really powerful and very peaty the sherry is of the thick heavy kind. There is some blackberry and blueberry coming out and then the peat grows in intensity mixing with the rich sherry.\nLets see what a little water does to it?\nStill peaty but the sherry is even sweeter and the balance is verging on outstanding,
Finish Comment: As long as the MI motorway in the UK but much sweeter to ne on ????

Nose Comment: Peat is not as strong as expected, western medicine tablets and a touch of kerosene. The herbal flavor is very strong, slightly moist, but not marine flavor, more terrestrial, very deep dried flowers/plants/spices. The sweetness is low, mostly bourbon barrels that have been used many times, toffee and a hint of nuts. There's a bit of soap, lavender, but no lemon to be found.
Taste Comment: Not sweet, slightly bitter peat, low-quality tobacco, residual tea, dried flowers with the same smell, lotus seeds, black pepper, compound grass coral lozenges.
Finish Comment: Long lasting, peat, pepper, dried flowers, sweet aftertaste.

Taste Comment: Syrupy and very oily. Fruity sweetness of oranges and tangerines. Marmelade-like. Fresh pencil shavings. Beeswax. Sweet apples, Bubblegum. But also hints of delicate peat at the background.
Finish Comment: Long and warm. Spices of pepper and nutmeg. Pine. Becomes slightly bitter at the end. Well balanced though.

Nose Comment: Lots of lemons initially, and then it becomes sweeter, in the form of Fuji apples, vanilla, bananas, and pineapples. Very subtle peat.
Taste Comment: Superb. Absolutely first rate. Oily, rather viscous, mouth-coating yumminess. It's like I am in a car mechanic shop -- oil, gasoline, metals, and there's someone juicing fruits next to the cars. Honeyed lemon tea, lime, pineapple cubes, vanilla, dried herbs, all in a background of soft peat from the bygone era. This is as great as the best of Ardbegs and Caol Ilas (for example, look up Caol Ila 1974 casks #5-9)
Finish Comment: Like a beautiful dream. If this is at cask strength, I may not want to wake up.\nThis is my favorite Longrow of all time.

Nose Comment: A rich, fresh, elegant, balanced and complex whisky with aromas of subtle sweet sherry, appel, pear, passionfruit, tangerine, orange, malt, vanilla, honey, grains, marmalade, berries (elderberries, raspberries, strawberries, blackberries, cranberries), dried fruit (sultanas, figs, plums, cherries) cedar wood, balsamic, old books, leather, green tea, sweet tobacco, mocha, chocolate, beeswax, varnish, antique polish, liquorice root, butter damp cellar, walnuts, stale tones and oak.
Taste Comment: A rich, full, balanced and complex whisky with aromas of fino sherry, sweet sherry, tannins, oak spices, berries (blackberries, blueberries, raspberries, gooseberries) dried fruits (sultanas, figs, dates, plums, cherries), apple, backed pear, vanilla, grapefruit, marzipan, cedar wood, liquorice root, savory tones (maybe some old fashioned beef stock), leather, mocha, bitter orange marmalade, pepper, ginger, nutmeg, cloves, cinnamon, old damp rope, old books, damp cellar, subtle coffee, Virginia tobacco, beeswax, tea, green walnuts, almonds and rich oak.
Finish Comment: A long, rich and slightly drying finish with aromas of tannins, cocoa powder, backing spices, pepper, chili pepper, dried fruits, grapefruit peel and a lot of spicy oak.

Nose Comment:
By far the darkest Laphroaig I've had - both in color and in aroma. Slow, oily legs roll along the glass wall.
Immediately after pouring, a heavy and aromatic cloud of smoke spreads in the glass. It is not about the young, impetuous smoke that pulls the tears from your eyes, but about a smoke that has already been clearly broken down.
This smoke is initially complemented by bitter and slightly rotten wood notes, which gives the aroma a very dignified character. Especially in the initial phase, these rustic notes tend to dominate. Leather and tobacco also come to mind.
Over time, the Oloroso barrel becomes more and more noticeable in the form of plum jam, forest honey and very ripe, dark fruits and a little petroleum. In addition, the smoke moves into the background and more filigree and maritime notes are revealed. The combination of dark fruits, rotten wood and maritime character reminds me in parts of the Clynelish 1995 (barrel no. 11230) from Signatory.
The 56.6% vol., Which is quite high for this age, is excellently integrated and at most has a slightly cooling effect on the nose.
Taste Comment: The start is strong and spicy, the smoke is more noticeable from the start. With a very oily mouthfeel, jam, peaches and ripe citrus fruits spread on the tongue again.\nAfter a short time, an interesting interplay of the old, spicy-tart wood notes and the still very dark, juicy fruits begins. In addition, hints of lovage and dry charcoal are noticeable, which together with the fruit keep the smoke well under control.\nThe tart wood notes in combination with the slightly sweet fruits are clearly reminiscent of dark chocolate.
Finish Comment: In the finish, the aforementioned fruits fade comparatively quickly and give more rustic notes such as espresso and oak a lot of leeway. The smoke flashes one last time and the wood is slightly astringent. Spices and some oak remain on the tongue with a slightly dry feeling.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Laphroaig1981

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: By far the darkest Laphroaig I've had - both in color and in aroma. Slow, oily legs roll along the glass wall.\nImmediately after pouring, a heavy and aromatic cloud of smoke spreads in the glass. It is not about the young, impetuous smoke that pulls the tears from your eyes, but about a smoke that has already been clearly broken down.\nThis smoke is initially complemented by bitter and slightly rotten wood notes, which gives the aroma a very dignified character. Especially in the initial phase, these rustic notes tend to dominate. Leather and tobacco also come to mind.\nOver time, the Oloroso barrel becomes more and more noticeable in the form of plum jam, forest honey and very ripe, dark fruits and a little petroleum. In addition, the smoke moves into the background and more filigree and maritime notes are revealed. The combination of dark fruits, rotten wood and maritime character reminds me in parts of the Clynelish 1995 (barrel no. 11230) from Signatory.\nThe 56.6% vol., Which is quite high for this age, is excellently integrated and at most has a slightly cooling effect on the nose.

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: The start is strong and spicy, the smoke is more noticeable from the start. With a very oily mouthfeel, jam, peaches and ripe citrus fruits spread on the tongue again.\nAfter a short time, an interesting interplay of the old, spicy-tart wood notes and the still very dark, juicy fruits begins. In addition, hints of lovage and dry charcoal are noticeable, which together with the fruit keep the smoke well under control.\nThe tart wood notes in combination with the slightly sweet fruits are clearly reminiscent of dark chocolate.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: In the finish, the aforementioned fruits fade comparatively quickly and give more rustic notes such as espresso and oak a lot of leeway. The smoke flashes one last time and the wood is slightly astringent. Spices and some oak remain on the tongue with a slightly dry feeling.

Nose Comment: Exoticism to fall. The kind that buries you a Benriach 76 or an old Clynelish. Tons of passion fruit, guava, mango, papaya and even more pink grapefruit, all bathed in a delicately salty marine atmosphere. Aeration sees it gaining complexity, with fresh vegetal notes (dill?), Icing sugar, vanilla cream and especially a medicinal aspect very different from antiseptics and usual hospital corridors. We're more on flavored aspirin, the same aroma that I had difficulty defining in the Bowmore Bicentenary 43%, btl. 10836, 75cl. In any case it's excellent.
Taste Comment: Not tired at all the venerable. The attack is pungent, spicy, before an explosion of pink grapefruit juice. Simply peppered grapefruit juice. Add to that a hint of salt and smoke, and you are there. Not monstrously complex, but very well melted.
Finish Comment: Long, on the fruity bitterness of grapefruit, salt and a hint of smoke with retro-olfaction.
document_text:

Aeration sees it gaining complexity, with fresh vegetal notes (dill?), Icing sugar, vanilla cream and especially a medicinal aspect very different from antiseptics and usual hospital corridors. We're more on flavored aspirin, the same aroma that I had difficulty defining in the Bowmore Bicentenary 43%, btl. 10836, 75cl. In any case it's excellent.

맛(Taste): Not tired at all the venerable. The attack is pungent, spicy, before an explosion of pink grapefruit juice. Simply peppered grapefruit juice. Add to that a hint of salt and smoke, and you are there. Not monstrously complex, but very well melted.

피니쉬(Finish): Long, on the fruity bitterness of grapefruit, salt and a hint of smoke with retro-olfaction.

Nose Comment:
No god, what a nose.
A good hot brioche straight out of the oven, some butter. A little breadcrumbs, also hot.
Mandarin, yuzu, lime. A certain type of exoticism. Hot pineapple in syrup, passion fruit.
All-flowered honey, creamy and white, almonds.
Embrun, a nice sea breeze. Light bandage, camphor, licorice. Salted butter caramel which is accentuated with aeration.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is an explosion of fruit.
Passion fruit, orange, clementine, pineapple, dried apricot, yuzu, pomegranate, currant. Yum. Creamy honey
We add a creamy and light peat, a little cold ash, tobacco, smoke.
And a big dose of medicinal, on camphor, tiger balm.
Finish Comment: Long and sweet finish on exotic fruits, citrus fruits, cold and creamy ash, smoke, tobacco, camphor.

Nose Comment: Warm pastries with raisins and plums and a hint of cinnamon fill the air. Immediately after that comes milk chocolate and oak. The oak is characterized by an aromatic spiciness that does not stand alone and fights other aromas, but fits wonderfully into the overall picture. After a while, the plum turns into a plum. It gets sweeter but stays more on the dry (but not tart) side. Warmth and time bring forth leather smothered in cherry juice. It's getting sweeter, the dark fruits are already overripe and touched. Fig comes along. The alcohol doesn't bother, but gives the fruit a sting. The oak is so well integrated that you can almost smell it. Rum, grape and nut chocolate with nutmeg crumble.
Taste Comment: Juicy, full of overripe cherries. Sweet herbs follow immediately. rosemary and chocolate. The herbs take over the palate. The sweetness with it reminds sn herbal sweets. Surprisingly, the palate stays beyond tart. The herbs are pleasing and difficult to tell apart. Rather less nutmeg, rather milder herbs. Dill, coriander and some cinnamon. It is a fresh, mild herbal mix. This herbal mix also dominates in the aftertaste, together with leather. The second sip is actually bitter. Oak finally comes to it. Immediately after swallowing, however, the palate becomes sweet, fruity and leathery again.
Finish Comment: Long, sweet, fruity with subtle dark chocolate and leather.

Nose Comment: Unbelievable smooth and fruity for 65 year in a cask. No trace of heavy wood or tannins at all. Orange peel, tangerines and pink grapefruit. Reminds me of Benrich 1976. Notes of aceton. Schweppes. N.B. was this cask stored in a freezer? Amazing how the strength after so long still can be 59,3%
Taste Comment: Wow, punchy at first sip. Quite acrid to be honest. Lemon and lime. Kiwi fruit. Papaya. Cinnamon. Some fresh (!) cedar oak as well. Subtle Even pencil shavings at the end. It's all very zesty but in a very subtle way.
Finish Comment: Medium long. Lots of ginger. A little mint. Lysol at the end (no idea where that is coming from...).

Nose Comment:
The nose is magnificent.
It changes every 3 minutes in the glass. The ventilation suits him perfectly.
It is at the same time dirty, salty, mineral, fruity and spicy.
Definitely salty. We also have dust, old workbenches, diesel fuel.
Light and very medicinal peat. Lots of camphor, eucalyptus. Licorice, star anise.
Lemon, orange, yuzu zest.
Acacia honey, heather. A little dried hay.
A little solvent and pepper.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is very salty.
Lemon, candy, soft caramel, fudge.
Lemon, grapefruit, pineapple peel.
Then more floral with rose, heather.
From the stable. Hay, old car. A light and delicate peat with a veil of smoke.
Always honey, a little wax.
Finish Comment: Long finish on honey, wax, citrus fruits (orange and lemon), a hint of pineapple and milk chocolate.\nCold ash, light peat.

Nose Comment: My expectation was to have a lot of wood on the nose, but that is not the case. This is succulent and fruity with ripe gooseberry, pear, lime peel. Also acacia honey, pecan nuts, marzipan, mango, passion fruit and a bit of mint. Some tobacco leaves and buttered toast in the background. Yes, this is wonderfully complex and surprisingly fresh for such an auldie.
Taste Comment: The wood speaks more loudly on the palate, emphasizing the age. A lot of drying tannins and resin precede a great fruity and sweet explosion of mandarin, pink grapefruit and ditto zest, drenched in light caramel and sprinkled with brown sugar. Green tea. Feisty with cloves and eucalyptus.
Finish Comment: The finish is short to medium in length, silky soft with the oak in perfect balance with the resin and mint. Outstanding.

Nose Comment: Very complex and straightforward, sea flavors with a salty background with a smoky-fruity sweetness. Peaty malt and lots of vanilla.
Taste Comment: Wow, what a gigantic, harmonious mouthfeel is that!\nA combination of creamy malty grain, smoky campfire and a great saltiness with delicious fruity fresh fruit notes. Absolutely no disturbing taste peaks and that at 61% !!! The long time in the bottle rounded off the whisky perfectly (if it wasn't back in 1991). An appetizer that you would never say 61.1% alcohol.
Finish Comment: Infinitely long - straightforward fruit-peat-smoke mix that ends up pleasantly dry at some point.

Nose Comment:
The nose is absolutely magical.
Creamy, suave, camphor smoke that wraps the aromas on top of each other. Almost a smell of warm barley.
Sponge cake, light candied pineapple, white grape, banana, green apple. Very distinctly from the dragon fruit!
Camphor, eucalyptus. A little shoe polish cream. A little fresh coconut.
The nose evolves more and more towards exoticism. Superb story. Peat is also becoming more and more distinct.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth the fruity explodes.
Banana, passion fruit, mango, papaya. Always the fruit of the dragon. Candied orange.
White pepper, toasted seeds.
Milk chocolate, very light leather and polish cream.
Licorice. Camphor.
A little less exuberant hair than on the nose, but still a cold smoke / ash.
Finish Comment: Long finish on exotic fruits, passion fruit, papaya, and granny apple. A little Haribo bear?\nLight peat. White pepper, camphor and cold ash.

Nose Comment: Evolves with time.. firstly: old sweet smoke, peaty salt, wax then.. suddenly character changes into fruit salad explosion!\nAt anytime it lacks balance and distillery character! Stunning!
Taste Comment: oldschool waxes, creamy minerals, fruits in smoke, different with each sip! Paraffined papaya, mango and barbecue pearls.\nPerfectly integrated alcohol, so happy it is not reduced. It really does make a difference..
Finish Comment: Smoke from burnt fruity salad... sweet and malty, long, balanced, unforgettable.

Nose Comment: Yup it is a farmy one excellent, peat, mud, farmyard smells (animal pens), black pepper, sweet peat, hints of orange and lemon.\nThe fruit & peat really complement each other here.
Taste Comment: Quite a lot of white fruit at the start but it is then swamped by the peat, or so I thought at first but the fruit returns, good balance.\nThe fruit increases, apple, mango, a little pineapple, unripe pear, then the peat caresses your tongue\nReally fresh, just excellent
Finish Comment: Not massive but very pleasant, remaining slightly sweet with peat in the background becoming slightly drying.\nThe fruit towards the end is like a bag of white & yellow wine gums

Nose Comment: Very rich, full and complex with sweet earthiness, sweet vegetation, with old barely sugars, very thick nosing with hints of framy notes, lemon grass, damp-hay and much more that I can't describe. I've added a single drop of water to my last sip, and can't stop nosing this baby!
Taste Comment: Unbelievable good! Thick very thick and delicious, peat, old honey, some barn flavouring, lemon, underling-saltiness and a bit of intermingled spiciness. Added a drop of water and it accentuates the farminess without adding much else. I prefer it without any water.
Finish Comment: Long and very pleasing. Sweet peat with some smokiness on the backend and old-honey-fruit.

Nose Comment:
A peat so dirty that it is enjoyable.
Dark chocolate, camphor, hay peat.
A little stable air.
Leather, shoe polish, molasses. Engine oil.
A little lemon, lime. Melon, rhubarb.
Burnt wood, light match, well cooked caramel. Wood wax.
Vanilla custard, crème brûlée.
Licorice, pepper, cloves. Camphor and light medicinal. Bandage. Tiger balm. Dust.
It is superbly complex. The fruit is clearly set back at the beginning but emerges with aeration, just like the camphor.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is superbly sweet for 56.9%.
We still have that dirty side, but more on the old workbench, the old books. Oil, engine, dust, metal tools.
Always lime, and quince, orange, zest.
Camphor, leather, undergrowth.
Dark chocolate, cinnamon.
The peat is there, oily, in the background.
Finish Comment: Superb finish on cocoa, citrus, oily peat, old age. Always these old books, this oil.\nClove, licorice, toasted almond.\nOld workbench, dust, smoke, burnt caramel.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Clynelish12-year-old
태그: Mossy

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: A peat so dirty that it is enjoyable.
Dark chocolate, camphor, hay peat.
A little stable air.
Leather, shoe polish, molasses. Engine oil.
A little lemon, lime. Melon, rhubarb.
Burnt wood, light match, well cooked caramel. Wood wax.
Vanilla custard, crème brûlée.
Licorice, pepper, cloves. Camphor and light medicinal. Bandage. Tiger balm. Dust.
It is superbly complex. The fruit is clearly set back at the beginning but emerges with aeration, just like the camphor.

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: In the mouth it is superbly sweet for 56.9%.
We still have that dirty side, but more on the old workbench, the old books. Oil, engine, dust, metal tools.
Always lime, and quince, orange, zest.
Camphor, leather, undergrowth.
Dark chocolate, cinnamon.
The peat is there, oily, in the background.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 95.0]: Superb finish on cocoa, citrus, oily peat, old age. Always these old books, this oil.
Clove, licorice, toasted almond.
Old workbench, dust, smoke, burnt caramel.

document_text:

Nose Comment: Pretty standard ardbeg, peat, lemon, herbs. Peat has a slight impact, but the flavor is deep and deep, which makes people associate with swamps, algae, mud, diesel oil and stinky fish. Floral aroma is more important than fruity aroma, lavender, foam, moth balls, dried flower fragrance, golden leaf elm, yellow fruits such as pineapple and apricot are separated from the sweetness, but it is not ostentatious.
Taste Comment: Strong, tense, belonging to the kind of single barrel that is not fully stretched (ahhh, I still want to drink a mixed barrel like provenance. Fruity and peaty are dominant, with a lot of syrup, apples, citrus, pears, but heavy peaty The bitterness and sugar balance is very good. The ocean style is much weaker than Wenxiang. Only a little salt is kept, and the rest is basically the same. It is very simple and has a very powerful bourbon peat, like a set of Taizu long punch It's like a tiger and a tiger.
Finish Comment: Long, regular bourbon barrel, foam, peat, sparkler, lemon.
document_text:

Fruity and peaty are dominant, with a lot of syrup, apples, citrus, pears, but heavy peaty The bitterness and sugar balance is very good. The ocean style is much weaker than Wenxiang. 피니쉬(Finish): Long, regular bourbon barrel, foam, peat, sparkler, lemon.

Nose Comment:
A very woody first nose, and not the most balanced of the Glendronach 1972. I expected more blend, especially with the reduction and the now 22 years in the bottle.
Let's not exaggerate either, the wood is very nice, noble, with a mix of graphite, pencil, firecracker powder, and a very light burnt wood. Lightly roasted almonds and hazelnuts.
On the fruit side, we are a little on the plum skin, the orange zest. Slightly astringent.
Aeration is really essential here to balance things out. Half an hour later, everything has changed.
We then have a little more plum juice, with a light mango and milk chocolate. The wood is more lively and waxed.
Taste Comment:
On the palate, the wood is forward again, with a frank bitterness. Pepper, rancio, bitter dark chocolate, kirsch.
Tobacco, cigar, very light undergrowth, liquorice, molasses.
Light gingerbread.
The fruit is more discreet and cooked, with blackberry, plum, and always a little hot mango.
It's less fresh than the nose, deeper, heavy and powerful.
Finish Comment: Very long finish on pineapple peel, cooked mango, plum, and always a big dose of wood. Pepper, liquorice, blackberry leaf.

Nose Comment: Surprisingly fresh with touches of sandalwood, but also nectarines, apricots and peaches. There's a gentle waxiness accompanied by sultanas, pineapple, and a touch of crushed mint leaves. Also some limonene. Just a hint of resin, as well as pine, buried somewhere in the background.
Taste Comment: Love the oily mouthfeel. It gives this single malt just such a powerful, rich personality. Lots of beeswax, mango, and papaya. There are similarities with the some of the undisclosed Speyside malts from the 1970s, except there's just a sliver of peat and cigar boxes hiding in here. Also just a pinch of pepper.
Finish Comment: Long. Touches of resin, mint and beeswax, but also a soft herbacious element.

맛(Taste): Love the oily mouthfeel. It gives this single malt just such a powerful, rich personality. Lots of beeswax, mango, and papaya. There are similarities with the some of the undisclosed Speyside malts from the 1970s, except there's just a sliver of peat and cigar boxes hiding in here. Also just a pinch of pepper.

피니쉬(Finish): Long. Touches of resin, mint and beeswax, but also a soft herbacious element.

Nose Comment: Iodine and medicinal tinctures that have been soaked in sea salt, salted butter, crystallized lemons, blood oranges, a peach-pear sensation, old metal polishes and lacquers, herbal wood ointments, camphor, and all wrapped in moderate bonfire smoke

Finish Comment: Extremely long. This is definitely a session-killer and will end your ability to taste anything else in the best possible way. There's bittersweet grapefruit, salty lemonade, buttery croissants, and pine sap

Nose Comment: Lemon, brine, pepper, peat, farmyard smells, hints of honeycomb, ice cream wafer, then a little grapefruit & crab apples (bitter).\nThere are hints of sherry and also hints of age, a nice nose.
Taste Comment: This is more fruit than peat, the peat is really subtle and it is a basket of stewed white fruits mixed with a little salt neat.\nA few drops of water alter things massively as the peat has been released along with some biscuit notes but not overpowering in any way.\nWell balanced
Finish Comment: Long finish remaining peaty but with a nice fruit edge, the finish is the best part.
