맛(Taste) [점수: 91.0]: This is more fruit than peat, the peat is really subtle and it is a basket of stewed white fruits mixed with a little salt neat.\nA few drops of water alter things massively as the peat has been released along with some biscuit notes but not overpowering in any way.\nWell balanced

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Long finish remaining peaty but with a nice fruit edge, the finish is the best part.

Nose Comment: Rich sherry, old walnut liquor, huge smoked polished oak, greasy tools, smoked ham, dried aprictos, a wonderful example of a rich 70s dram, not as complex/elegant as a 60s whisky, I was wondering if it is the results of shorter fermentation or more active oak.
Taste Comment: Almost salted caramel juice, very salty, rich and sticky, sticky BBQ pork, concentrated apricot jam, long fermented orange peel. Very syrupy and balanced.
Finish Comment: Long and minty, more polished oak, dark chocolates and slightly rubbery/meaty aftertastes.
document_text:
위스키 이름: St. Magdalene1978

향(Nose) [점수: 92.0]: Rich sherry, old walnut liquor, huge smoked polished oak, greasy tools, smoked ham, dried aprictos, a wonderful example of a rich 70s dram, not as complex/elegant as a 60s whisky, I was wondering if it is the results of shorter fermentation or more active oak.

맛(Taste) [점수: 95.0]: Almost salted caramel juice, very salty, rich and sticky, sticky BBQ pork, concentrated apricot jam, long fermented orange peel. Very syrupy and balanced.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: Long and minty, more polished oak, dark chocolates and slightly rubbery/meaty aftertastes.

Nose Comment:
unmoved:
You smell Ardbeg
gentle and mild
seductively sweetish
dusty  later and moving:
You look at your old leather boots smiling
They take you with ....
a journey through damp moors
Autumn herbs in the moor
The moist salty air at the sea
Lemongrass and ginger
roasted coffee and dark caramel
malty & dark mingles with fresh & salty
sweetish with sourish
the memories dissolve
to a seductive fantasy experience
You swallow
Taste Comment:
like a warm liquid kiss
he touches your tongue
You are immediately in his spell
he is sweet
like golden brown liquid caramel
which pours in dark espresso
Malty it lies on your tongue
sweet fruits on your palate
Salt & lemon
old leather is floating in the sea
bitter oak eats the sweet fruits
Finish Comment:
long
all the flavors that you tasted in the mouth
dissolve in varying intensity on your throat
the bitter oak initially remains slightly dominant
becomes sweeter with beautiful old barrel flavors
it's getting wet for a moment
but then stays rather dry and malty
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1815
태그: Coal-gas,Chocolate,Citric,Cooked Mash,Fragant,Hay-like,Honey,New Wood

향(Nose): unmoved:
You smell Ardbeg
gentle and mild
seductively sweetish
dusty  later and moving:
You look at your old leather boots smiling
They take you with ....
a journey through damp moors
Autumn herbs in the moor
The moist salty air at the sea
Lemongrass and ginger
roasted coffee and dark caramel
malty & dark mingles with fresh & salty
sweetish with sourish
the memories dissolve
to a seductive fantasy experience
You swallow

맛(Taste): like a warm liquid kiss
he touches your tongue
You are immediately in his spell
he is sweet
like golden brown liquid caramel
which pours in dark espresso
Malty it lies on your tongue
sweet fruits on your palate
Salt & lemon
old leather is floating in the sea
bitter oak eats the sweet fruits

피니쉬(Finish): long
all the flavors that you tasted in the mouth
dissolve in varying intensity on your throat
the bitter oak initially remains slightly dominant
becomes sweeter with beautiful old barrel flavors
it's getting wet for a moment
but then stays rather dry and malty

Nose Comment:
Absolutely sublime nose. Exotic bomb. Passion, pineapple, peach with syrup, white grapes. Bays.
White flowers. Elderflower. White pepper.
Very light wood wrapped with cocoa powder.
Light vanilla.
Light dried herb Pine.
With aeration a little green apple.
Taste Comment: On the palate it's a fruity sweetness to fall.\nWhite flowers, elderberry, peach, apricot, plum, quince.\nLight wood and light camphor.
Finish Comment: Final shower on the exotic fruit wrapped with fresh mint. Fresh pepper. Aromatic herbs.

Nose Comment: Exquisitely rich and expressive, but given the hefty age statement, you’ll not be surprised when I suggest that some substantial resting time (over 30 minutes) is required here. Once fully opened, there’s nothing shy about this nose – wonderful maturity and remarkable aroma development – it’s hauntingly sexy and an experience you’re unlikely to want to end….ever. Pronounced leather, mahogany polish and musty bone dry paper conjure up images of a wood-panelled Victoria library packed to the rafters with ancient leather-bound tomes. The traditional Highland Park profile is still extraordinarily strong here – dried highland grasses, heathery honey and sweet wispy smoke – but everything is richer, deeper and altogether more refined. Orange peels, Peruvian dark chocolate and liquorice merge with luxuriant dark berry fruits, prune juice and dusty aged spices – cinnamon and nutmeg. The level of smoke here is surprising, it’s still a wafting background aroma, packed full of burnt hays, stubbed out cigars and tinder boxes – but it’s much more pronounced that one might expect from 40 years of maturation – this results in a peat that seeming both ancient and refined and yet lively and spry at the same time. Woodiness levels are unsurprisingly high – and yet still somehow restrained – highly polished dark old wood – not a trace of young sappy vanilla and with plenty of beeswax and lacquered furniture. Beautiful, captivating and lingering. I could nose this forever.
Taste Comment: Unctuous, slightly oily and with a perfectly judged arrival that delivers a surge of refined flavour with almost no perceptible alcohol despite the 48.3% ABV. Yes, friends, if you’re judging whisky on its ‘smoothness’ this is as smooth as they come. The front palate offers up a stunning balance of mouth-coating burnt sweet heather and cinder toffee, sitting alongside raisins, orange and dried citrus peels. This develops (slowly) into perfectly judged bitterness – from both spices and wood. Cinnamon, nutmeg, a sprinkle of white pepper and then a wave of tanned leather, ancient saddle hides, dusty books, teak oil, mahogany and ebony woods. The development continues into the back palate where sweetness returns to balance the deeper, spicier wood-led flavours – a harvest of juicy, reduced red and black fruit jams and preserves alongside chocolate and burnt honeycomb. Smoke runs throughout, but is most discernible in the back palate – it’s an intriguing and subtle combination of sun-scorched hays, burnt sugars and coastalness. Glorious.
Finish Comment: Almost never ending – ever decreasing little lapping waves of chocolate, berries, ancient wood and aromatic spices. It dries superbly without any perceptible tannic influence.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Highland Park40-year-old
태그: Chocolate,Citric,Cooked Fruit,Dried Fruit,Honey,Leathery,Old Wood,Smokey,Tobacco,Vanilla

Once fully opened, there’s nothing shy about this nose – wonderful maturity and remarkable aroma development – it’s hauntingly sexy and an experience you’re unlikely to want to end….ever. Pronounced leather, mahogany polish and musty bone dry paper conjure up images of a wood-panelled Victoria library packed to the rafters with ancient leather-bound tomes. The traditional Highland Park profile is still extraordinarily strong here – dried highland grasses, heathery honey and sweet wispy smoke – but everything is richer, deeper and altogether more refined. Orange peels, Peruvian dark chocolate and liquorice merge with luxuriant dark berry fruits, prune juice and dusty aged spices – cinnamon and nutmeg. The level of smoke here is surprising, it’s still a wafting background aroma, packed full of burnt hays, stubbed out cigars and tinder boxes – but it’s much more pronounced that one might expect from 40 years of maturation – this results in a peat that seeming both ancient and refined and yet lively and spry at the same time. Woodiness levels are unsurprisingly high – and yet still somehow restrained – highly polished dark old wood – not a trace of young sappy vanilla and with plenty of beeswax and lacquered furniture. Beautiful, captivating and lingering. I could nose this forever.

맛(Taste): Unctuous, slightly oily and with a perfectly judged arrival that delivers a surge of refined flavour with almost no perceptible alcohol despite the 48.3% ABV. Yes, friends, if you’re judging whisky on its ‘smoothness’ this is as smooth as they come. The front palate offers up a stunning balance of mouth-coating burnt sweet heather and cinder toffee, sitting alongside raisins, orange and dried citrus peels. This develops (slowly) into perfectly judged bitterness – from both spices and wood. Cinnamon, nutmeg, a sprinkle of white pepper and then a wave of tanned leather, ancient saddle hides, dusty books, teak oil, mahogany and ebony woods. The development continues into the back palate where sweetness returns to balance the deeper, spicier wood-led flavours – a harvest of juicy, reduced red and black fruit jams and preserves alongside chocolate and burnt honeycomb. Smoke runs throughout, but is most discernible in the back palate – it’s an intriguing and subtle combination of sun-scorched hays, burnt sugars and coastalness. Glorious.

피니쉬(Finish): Almost never ending – ever decreasing little lapping waves of chocolate, berries, ancient wood and aromatic spices. It dries superbly without any perceptible tannic influence.

Nose Comment:
Superb nose on sherry, melted and peaty.
Ash, flint, pebble, oily peat, black tea, tobacco, cigar. Oily leather, seaweed, light iodine side.
Then we move on to a defined red fruit, currant, berries, brambles.
We finish on medicinal, with a nice dose of camphor, which mixes with a super grapefruit skin.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is also very complex.
The peat is melted and defined, with a little embers.
Light barbecue, with ash.
Black tea, liquorice, camphor, dried aromatic herbs.
Lemon, orange, grapefruit peel.
Light dry wood, precious.
Greasy leather.
Finish Comment: Long finish on the barbecue, ash, blackcurrant and redcurrant, citrus zest, camphor.\nFresh.

Whisky Name: The Whisky that Cannot be Named1953 AD
Nose Comment: Herbal nose, but not just any herbal, its strongly THC Cannabis, marijuana, tetrahydrocannabinol nose. Never smelt anything like it. With sherry of course.
Taste Comment: Almost indescribable, so beautifully integrated and unique. A herbal sherry like no other.
Finish Comment:
Others have done a good job on their descriptions, I'll just add a Ginger nut note on the finish.
Absolutely perfect, unique.
The whisky that cannot be forgotten.
One of the best I've ever had, thanks to Matt Mueller.

Nose Comment: Fabulous, entry, it has all that one is entitled to expect from an old Speyside aged in sherry cask: balance, elegance, complexity. The tangy scent of mandarin mixes with notes of precious wood (cedar, sandalwood) before the exotic fruits join the dance, gently, delicately. This is not the crazy exuberance of a Benriach 76, but by keys, inspiration after inspiration, they occupy the front of the stage. Papayas, guavas, but especially passion fruit cover tasty notes of toffee, candied figs, dates, with a hint of white pepper and nutmeg, the whole being admirably melted. Great art.
Taste Comment: Powerful and lively, especially considering the age of the bouzin. A touch of woody bitterness reminds you, but we stay in the right line of the nose, despite a less complexity, on exotic fruits and mandarin, with a touch of walnuts. Although fluid in texture, this malt tapes your palate nicely, leaving no astringency behind.
Finish Comment: Long, it finally betrays the age of this venerable Glenlivet by a woody more present, slightly spicy (nutmeg, white pepper), always mixed with fruit.

Nose Comment: Peaty, earthy, salty, peach and some apricot, lime blossom, pickaxe, a bit dusty. Kelp, camphor, mint.\nLater also toffee, lemon and mineral notes. Changes constantly. Deep
Taste Comment: Starts sweet, fruity and oily, peach and apricots. Then pepper and salty notes are added. Clearly peaty, dry campfire smoke. Toffee, leather. Powerful, powerful, intense, masculine. Fiery.
Finish Comment: Dry smoke, apricots and ripe, crumbly apples, powerful and intense, enormously long. Salty-maritime undertones, but also buttery. Dry and harmonious.

Nose Comment: Perfect sherry goodness from Ye Olden Days. In order of appearance: mint, Ginjinha, warm sand, cedar oak, chocolate ganache, lovage, cigar box, Amontillado sherry, old furniture, maple syrup, caramel flan, liquorice, Pan de Higo and an overall nuttiness. Huge sherry, but such a deep fruitiness and such elegance! The exotic oak and deep sherry push it in the direction of Karuizawa, while the mint and liquorice add some vermouth character.
Taste Comment: Thick, dry, concentrated, herbal sherry. Blackcurrant, lovage again, caramel toffee, herbal honey, walnuts, black cherries, coffee powder, dark chocolate, spearmint. All kinds of old oak. So intense that it comes close to tarry, medicinal notes. Touches of Fernet-Branca in that respect.
Finish Comment: Heavy and looong, dry but not over the top. Plenty of spices.

Nose Comment:
A little nervous at first. Then as you slowly feel it's clear and powerful.
Fruits: banana, pineapple and orange. Honey, vanilla and nutella.
Salted minerals, antique skin, horseradish and peat. Very mild smoke.
Fresh eucalyptus and mint. Camphor. Most of the farmy notes are mainly hay.
Taste Comment: Powerful but soft. Creamy and oily. Vibrantly acidic sour citrus. Honey sweeted fruits.\nPeat and smoke are more definite. Ash. Salted minerals. The oak also shows a marvelous maturiton. Spicy, hot notes: cayenne pepper and wasabi. The whole together in perfect harmony.
Finish Comment: Long, oaky, peaty, with a Talisker like peppery.

향(Nose): Intense smoke, maritime, salt, iodine, Hansaplast, a bit of wood tar, much more clean and crisp than expected based on some other -73's

맛(Taste): Smoky, salty, maritime freshness, a bit of peat, a whiff of honey

피니쉬(Finish): A bit of oak spices, peat, salt, honey sweetness, good balance

Nose Comment: Complex, elegant, cedar wood, figs, dates, nutty, leather, herbs, butterscotch, olive oil
Taste Comment: Oaky, fruity (oranges, apricots, prunes), tobacco, gingerbread, butterscotch, liquorice, some peat, aniseed, cognac
Finish Comment: Long, warming, drying, oaky, spicy, chocolate, mint

Nose Comment: Very complex. Sweet riesling, funky, vanilla-laden dram, with white fruits, sweet, and sour. It's a bit all over the place, but works so beautifully.
Taste Comment: Oily, creamy, dense mouthfeel. Full of buttercream and vanilla. Oh, I love that funky peat with all these sweeter notes.
Finish Comment: Perfect stuff right here.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Springbank1972
태그: Cooked Vegetable

향(Nose): Very complex. Sweet riesling, funky, vanilla-laden dram, with white fruits, sweet, and sour. It's a bit all over the place, but works so beautifully.

맛(Taste): Oily, creamy, dense mouthfeel. Full of buttercream and vanilla. Oh, I love that funky peat with all these sweeter notes.

피니쉬(Finish): Perfect stuff right here.

Nose Comment: Aromatic and fragrant, a full bag of quality raisins, old plum, milk caramel, but not excessively, and a smell of old paperback. It is more fruity with aeration, almost sweet (sweet orange jam, candied figs), with a subtle hint of acidity (balsamic vinegar).
Taste Comment: The attack is a little soft, but it gets better later. A nice hint of exoticism makes a fleeting appearance, but we find quite quickly the markers of a classic sherry, with the usual raisins en masse, but also zests of candied orange. Alcohol would benefit from being better integrated.
Finish Comment: Medium length, on raisins and with a slight woody bitterness.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Dalmore1978

향(Nose): Aromatic and fragrant, a full bag of quality raisins, old plum, milk caramel, but not excessively, and a smell of old paperback. It is more fruity with aeration, almost sweet (sweet orange jam, candied figs), with a subtle hint of acidity (balsamic vinegar).

맛(Taste): The attack is a little soft, but it gets better later. A nice hint of exoticism makes a fleeting appearance, but we find quite quickly the markers of a classic sherry, with the usual raisins en masse, but also zests of candied orange. Alcohol would benefit from being better integrated.

피니쉬(Finish): Medium length, on raisins and with a slight woody bitterness.

Nose Comment: Brown sugar, truck loads of wet pipe tobacco, toffee, acacia honey, hints of toasted bread, whiffs of menthol, spices, dried plums, dates, little earthy, porcino – excellent!
Taste Comment: Very punchy, oily, little sweetness, espresso, dark chocolate, cigar tobacco, spices, little herbal, menthol, old wood, black tea – great!
Finish Comment: Long, warm, spicy, more herbal, more woody

위스키 이름: Glenlossie1974 GM

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: Brown sugar, truck loads of wet pipe tobacco, toffee, acacia honey, hints of toasted bread, whiffs of menthol, spices, dried plums, dates, little earthy, porcino – excellent!

Nose Comment: Thick tones of plum confiture, dried figs, raisins, red apple. Leather gloves, wax, oak, old furniture covered with old leather, over which restoration work was carried out. Very thick, like a train, like fog, like steam over a pot in which wild berries are boiled with spices.
Taste Comment: Thick, concentrated sweetness of dark berries, slowly spreading in the mouth, turning first into cooling, and then sharply, into the bitter tones of old oak, varnish and paint, into the astringent bitterness of thick tea leaves.
Finish Comment: The enveloping bitterness, which has completely connected all the receptors, is gradually replaced by sweetness, however, it also disappears pretty soon.

Nose Comment: Rich sherry, dark fruits like red plum and blackcurrant to be honest a textbook sherried Farclas heavy sherry.
Taste Comment:
Just as the nose hinted at with dark fruits of all varieties, there is a little wood, but that is fine as there is a nice treacle toffee note that checks it
Balance is good.
It gains sweetness as you go on and then some peat arrives and dances over your tongue but it dims the sweetness.
Very jammy this one.
Finish Comment: Medium length, warming, no rough edges and maintains fruity to the end then the sweetness gets a second wind.\nWith a little water\nThe nose is less expressive and the palate is less sweet but has more fizz, I preferred it neat.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenfarclas1973

향(Nose) [점수: 91.0]: Rich sherry, dark fruits like red plum and blackcurrant to be honest a textbook sherried Farclas heavy sherry.

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: Just as the nose hinted at with dark fruits of all varieties, there is a little wood, but that is fine as there is a nice treacle toffee note that checks it\nBalance is good.\nIt gains sweetness as you go on and then some peat arrives and dances over your tongue but it dims the sweetness.\nVery jammy this one.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Medium length, warming, no rough edges and maintains fruity to the end then the sweetness gets a second wind.\nWith a little water\nThe nose is less expressive and the palate is less sweet but has more fizz, I preferred it neat.

위스키 이름: Mortlach1949 GM

향(Nose): Sherry, Raisins, Plums and Oak

맛(Taste): Wine comes back in the taste wit Sherry, raisins, figs and a very strong taste of oak

피니쉬(Finish): Medium long without surprises, just fading away

Nose Comment: Acidic and tart. With lovage and a meaty note. Preserved cherry cola. Herbal liqueur and leather. This is exactly the balance between Mortlach and sherry maturation. Or maybe the sum of it all.
Taste Comment: Meat marinated in soy sauce. Hot spices give it punch while still feeling relatively thin. That's interesting. Low abv bottlings are often not particularly expressive. This is the opposite.
Finish Comment: Beautifully dry, like a really good red wine. Dark fruits, sugar beet juice, plum jam and leather. Feels like it stays forever.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Mortlach1954 GM

향(Nose) [점수: 91.0]: Acidic and tart. With lovage and a meaty note. Preserved cherry cola. Herbal liqueur and leather. This is exactly the balance between Mortlach and sherry maturation. Or maybe the sum of it all.

맛(Taste) [점수: 89.0]: Meat marinated in soy sauce. Hot spices give it punch while still feeling relatively thin. That's interesting. Low abv bottlings are often not particularly expressive. This is the opposite.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: Beautifully dry, like a really good red wine. Dark fruits, sugar beet juice, plum jam and leather. Feels like it stays forever.

Nose Comment: More like some Talisker or Bowmore. Intense aroma of burnt branches, balsamic sauce, spices and dried fruits.\nIntensity: 9/10
Taste Comment:
Surprisingly watery and really indistinguishable from the old Bowmore with its burnt wires and tar. Before the tasting I ate very sweet dried apricots, but this whisky is even sweeter, it’s just cloying!
Tropical fruits, unusual 4D profile of texture, depth, aroma, sweet and sour wine notes.
Dried fruits at the peak of their sweetness, sweet balsamic dressing
Sweetness: 11/10
Saturation: 10/10
Finish Comment: Sweet, tart, powerful, endless.\nPropolis and other bee stories.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ledaig1972 AC
태그: Dried Fruit,Plastic

향(Nose): More like some Talisker or Bowmore. Intense aroma of burnt branches, balsamic sauce, spices and dried fruits.\nIntensity: 9/10

맛(Taste): Surprisingly watery and really indistinguishable from the old Bowmore with its burnt wires and tar. Before the tasting I ate very sweet dried apricots, but this whisky is even sweeter, it’s just cloying!\nTropical fruits, unusual 4D profile of texture, depth, aroma, sweet and sour wine notes.\nDried fruits at the peak of their sweetness, sweet balsamic dressing\nSweetness: 11/10\nSaturation: 10/10

피니쉬(Finish): Sweet, tart, powerful, endless.\nPropolis and other bee stories.

Nose Comment: Ecstasy! delicate peat coating notes of sherry and exotic fruits, the fantastic triptych! Very complex. Perfectly balanced, vanilla, papaya, almonds, the peat is medicinal, a touch of iodine/pen ink, honey.
Taste Comment: fine spices (cinnamon, nutmeg), salt, not so peaty, citrus fruits (lemons).
Finish Comment: long, persistent, wet pebbles, mineral, varies over an infinity of strata

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: Ecstasy! delicate peat coating notes of sherry and exotic fruits, the fantastic triptych! Very complex. Perfectly balanced, vanilla, papaya, almonds, the peat is medicinal, a touch of iodine/pen ink, honey.

맛(Taste) [점수: 91.0]: fine spices (cinnamon, nutmeg), salt, not so peaty, citrus fruits (lemons).

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: long, persistent, wet pebbles, mineral, varies over an infinity of strata

Nose Comment: Great nose, on aromatic fruits (kumquats, Seville oranges, peach pits, guava, yellow plums, grapes - not the usual oloroso sherry fruits) and beautiful waxy / mineral notes (paraffin, scented balm). Buttercups. Quite some spices (nutmeg, mint) as well as nicely integrated, polished oak. Light tobacco.
Taste Comment: Half sweet, half spicy. The fruits are more pronounced now, more jammy with slightly more tropical hints. Soft pepper and ginger, hints of eucalyptus. Distant traces of nuts. Growing savoury, more oaky and slightly bitter towards the end.
Finish Comment: Long, with lingering fruit, chamomile tea (or is that the power of suggestion?) and drying spices. Indeed, there's also a faint salty edge.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenfarclas1968

향(Nose): Great nose, on aromatic fruits (kumquats, Seville oranges, peach pits, guava, yellow plums, grapes - not the usual oloroso sherry fruits) and beautiful waxy / mineral notes (paraffin, scented balm). Buttercups. Quite some spices (nutmeg, mint) as well as nicely integrated, polished oak. Light tobacco.

맛(Taste): Half sweet, half spicy. The fruits are more pronounced now, more jammy with slightly more tropical hints. Soft pepper and ginger, hints of eucalyptus. Distant traces of nuts. Growing savoury, more oaky and slightly bitter towards the end.

피니쉬(Finish): Long, with lingering fruit, chamomile tea (or is that the power of suggestion?) and drying spices. Indeed, there's also a faint salty edge.

Nose Comment: Salty, moist and strong peat, the closest wine is probably Langlo, which was distilled in the 1990s. The ocean has a strong temperament, fish oil, salt, animal skins soaked in seawater, and crystal meat. It is somewhere between the refreshing late spring beach and the funky farm stables. The oils and minerals complement each other. Peat is stronger than today's regular Bowmore, ink, pencil lead, twine from fishing boats, honeycomb briquettes, seaweed ash. The sugar content is normal, no influence from sherry barrels, some cream, rice flavor, salted cucumber yogurt, chalk, sea salt soda, yellow lemon peel oil, glucose, pineapple and other yellow fruits.
Taste Comment: The cold version of Genting 10 100proof, the peat is transparent and continuous, charcoal, salt-roasted ginkgo, licorice, pepper. The flavor other than peat is not strong, and the bourbon barrel is hammered. But it has sharp sea salt mixed with fruit acid, yellow apple, lemon peel, MSG, a certain amount of lipids to support the body of the wine but not greasy, barley sugar, vanilla, and grain ears. This simple malt wine style is almost that of that era. Good wine comes standard.\nStrong, good fat, appropriate sweetness, slightly sour, no tannins, no astringency, no bitterness, no spiciness, no alcohol.
Finish Comment: Longer, peat, toasted grains, slightly sour citrus.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Caol Ila15-year-old

향(Nose): Salty, moist and strong peat, the closest wine is probably Langlo, which was distilled in the 1990s. The ocean has a strong temperament, fish oil, salt, animal skins soaked in seawater, and crystal meat. It is somewhere between the refreshing late spring beach and the funky farm stables. The oils and minerals complement each other. Peat is stronger than today's regular Bowmore, ink, pencil lead, twine from fishing boats, honeycomb briquettes, seaweed ash. The sugar content is normal, no influence from sherry barrels, some cream, rice flavor, salted cucumber yogurt, chalk, sea salt soda, yellow lemon peel oil, glucose, pineapple and other yellow fruits.

맛(Taste): The cold version of Genting 10 100proof, the peat is transparent and continuous, charcoal, salt-roasted ginkgo, licorice, pepper. The flavor other than peat is not strong, and the bourbon barrel is hammered. But it has sharp sea salt mixed with fruit acid, yellow apple, lemon peel, MSG, a certain amount of lipids to support the body of the wine but not greasy, barley sugar, vanilla, and grain ears. This simple malt wine style is almost that of that era. Good wine comes standard.\nStrong, good fat, appropriate sweetness, slightly sour, no tannins, no astringency, no bitterness, no spiciness, no alcohol.

피니쉬(Finish): Longer, peat, toasted grains, slightly sour citrus.

Nose Comment:
Have you ever swam alone in the rain in the North Sea?
The salty water is gray-brown and calm and it seems warm to you
Back on the beach your whole body smells of salt and silt
from the harbor blows a smoker
at the quay you can smell the damp old ship planks of the fishing boat
the rain has stopped
gray puddles are half seawater, half rain everywhere
a wet strand of hair falls in your face
You feel the salt on your lips
the fish still hangs over the barrel in the smoke
you have to wait
a fisherman hands you a bottle
you put them to your salty lips and feel old nutty sherry
Lemons and cloves come to the fish
in the smoke they exude your intense smell
You swallow ...
Taste Comment:
smooth and cool,
salt
nut
Smoke fire, warm ashes
Fish, lemons, dark chocolate
a touch of bitter almond
Salt & peat
Malt, which is getting sweeter
chocolate
long malt sweet with sea
Finish Comment:
long
Salt and malt sweetness
Bitter chocolate with almonds
sweet tobacco

Nose Comment: A little bit shy at the beginning, shows great value after some time in glass. Creamy, spicy, fruity, vanilla, salt, great sweet peat.
Taste Comment: Powerful, complex, perfectly balanced. A little bit Brora-like mineral and salty. Also some fruirs and wood. Really Delicious!!
Finish Comment: Stunning. Endless, elegant, complex, evolving, balanced, wow!!
document_text:
위스키 이름: Caol Ila1980 MoS
태그: Smokey,Citric,Dried Fruit,Honey,Medicinal,Nutty,Old Wood,Vanilla,Hay-like,Kippery,New Wood,Oily,Plastic,Toasted

향(Nose) [점수: 93.0]: A little bit shy at the beginning, shows great value after some time in glass. Creamy, spicy, fruity, vanilla, salt, great sweet peat.

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: Powerful, complex, perfectly balanced. A little bit Brora-like mineral and salty. Also some fruirs and wood. Really Delicious!!

Nose Comment: Immediately after pouring a very buttery and nutty nose, it almost reminds me of some dark bourbons I had, still has nice volume in the nose despite the bottling year and 43%, hazelnuts, macadamia, burnt butter, dark, viscous honey, beeswax, Pork bacon, oiled leather, chestnut, old, slightly damp oak, maple syrup, fennel, nutmeg and cinnamon, brown sugar, salted caramel, a few very dry raisins and old milk chocolate, a bit of cream cheese in the background after a while (I had with others Old Longmorn and Mortlach, if they are allowed 1-2 hours), Chesterfield armchairs, a touch of black tea, after a while more coagulated orange zest will be added, the chocolate will be more bitter, more tannins, a little more anise and pine nuts
Taste Comment: Still has much power for the 43%, strong start! Trail mixes par excellence, hazelnuts, peanuts, macadamia, walnuts, black tea, rosemary, oregano, burnt orange and grapefruit stains, old leather now rather dried than oiled, burnt butter, more and more tannins are coming, overall dry and slightly bitter in the mouth as in the greasy nose, raisins and dried dates, autumn leaves, aniseed, pine nuts, dark chocolate, cocoa beans, old, dry tobacco, old chest of drawers, roasted almonds, pretzels, nutmeg, a hint of black pepper, cinnamon, saffron, fennel
Finish Comment: Dark malt, many tannins, autumn leaves, anise, pine nuts, grapefruit, coffee, black tea, long

맛(Taste): Still has much power for the 43%, strong start! Trail mixes par excellence, hazelnuts, peanuts, macadamia, walnuts, black tea, rosemary, oregano, burnt orange and grapefruit stains, old leather now rather dried than oiled, burnt butter, more and more tannins are coming, overall dry and slightly bitter in the mouth as in the greasy nose, raisins and dried dates, autumn leaves, aniseed, pine nuts, dark chocolate, cocoa beans, old, dry tobacco, old chest of drawers, roasted almonds, pretzels, nutmeg, a hint of black pepper, cinnamon, saffron, fennel

Nose Comment:
Very nice nose, tropical and woody.
Papaya, passion fruit, guava, plum, mirabelle plum, peach.
Leather, shoe polish, wood, liquorice, black pepper.
Light dry wood and dead leaves. Old newspaper.
Cold ash, fireplace.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth we continue on the camphorated fruit and precious wood.
Papaya, kiwi, pineapple, banana, peach, apricot. Fairly light.
Cold ash, tobacco, white pepper, fresh mint, cinnamon, vanilla, toffee.
Greasy leather, wax.
Finish Comment: Long finish on exotic fruit, smoke, cold ash, pepper, precious wood. Slight dust, taste of "old malt".

Nose Comment: Plenty of toffee, xmas spice, ginger bread cake, also some brown sugar, acacia honey, little molasses, pipe tobacco, spices, little nutmeg, dried fruits, plums, prunes, figs, deep sherry wood, hints of orange peel and cinnamon - superb!
Taste Comment: Little punchy, oily, creamy, liquorice, good sweetness, dried fruits, plums, figs, acacia honey, toffee, little tobacco, more xmas spice and ginger bread cake, little nutmeg and cinnamon, hints of menthol and eucalyptus, sherry wood, spices, little pepper, some cooked oranges - excellent!
Finish Comment: Medium long, warm, more dried fruits, toffee, acacia honey, cooked fruits, little more menthol, spices and woody notes but not drying, little tannins, little herbs - great!

Nose Comment:
Superb intensity. We're on an old, thoroughbred Glendronach.
We start with old furniture, dust, varnish, parquet. It's woody but not overwhelming.
Figs, dates, dried fruits, with the lightness of strawberry juice.
A pretty noble leather, accompanied by some roasted cocoa nibs. A little burnt caramel, and toffee.
Light camphor, medicinal.
Balance at the limit of perfection.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth, there is also a very good intensity.
We start with rancio, kirsch, dust and a slight bloody taste.
The wood is not far away, varnished. An old liquid library.
Figs, dates, liquorice, blackcurrant, the fruit is deeper than the nose, sweeter, and mixed with molasses.
Dried orange peel.
Pepper, dried herbs. Light hot macadamia.
Finish Comment: Long, woody, spicy finish, pepper, liquorice, and with a nice dose of camphor which adds a nice freshness.\nHot and endless.

Nose Comment: First, a lot of dark honey, a shelf with leather-bound books, chocolate and thick jam. Further, propolis appears in the aroma, the chill of which I really like, and hazelnuts.
Taste Comment: The body is thick and this drum wants to be chewed. Chocolate, tobacco, the same dark honey, plum marmalade and a refreshing cold in the entire mouth from propolis.
Finish Comment: Average on peppery chocolate.

Nose Comment:
This smells like sherry but CTU says bourbon, not sure to be honest but t is dark for a bourbon cask and noses like there is sherry in there so need to check that.
Unfortunately my nose is not the greatest these days.
This Ardbeg is more mineral and earthy than a straight peater, there are hints of dark orange breakfast marmalade but more the rind than the conserve, there is obviously peat in there but there is a fair amount of stewed fruit which adds to the balance. I also detect charcoal.
This is a really good nose, the slight orange note really elevates this one.
Taste Comment: The peat is massive and in your face with , like the nose suggested, a mineral note.\nIf you add a few drops of water, the edge it taken off the peat initially but don`t be fooled because it returns with a vengeance, mixing with brine, a little lemon and lots of white pepper, the problem is here that the fruit is subdued, this is a straight peater, a one trick pony if you will but there is no denying the quality of the maturation on show here
Finish Comment: As long as you would expect from something this old.
document_text:

I also detect charcoal.\nThis is a really good nose, the slight orange note really elevates this one.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: As long as you would expect from something this old.

Nose Comment: 93 base points on average, a Macallan from 1965, that's a damn long time ago, so I'm more than excited! Oily amber streaks adorn the gas walls. Dark fruits stand out of the glass. Raisins, dates, berries. Something orange. Very meaty-brühig, umami, saliva-stimulating. Tomatoes. Super-nice woody spice, leather, tobacco, roasted nuts. Toasted toasted bread, roasted aromas.
Taste Comment: Dry, astringent old sherry. Slightly musty, but not too moldy. Leather notes, bitter oak. The mouth is now much drier after the saliva has flowed through the fantastic smell in streams. Nevertheless, there is still a lot of sweetness in the taste again. Prima spice, clear cloves, some pepper.
Finish Comment: Dry, bitter espresso with lots of sugar. a little musty, a bit leathery
document_text:

Nose Comment: Yes, the funkiness is indeed present. Wet, charcoal, old school peat. Meat broth. Moist. Malty. Blueberries. Tutti-frutti. Pastries. Balsamic oil. Barbeque sauce. Brioche. Root beer
Taste Comment: Oily texture. Juicy. Fruity sweetness. Blue berries. Funkiness continues. Balsamic. Sour beer. Tonic water. Lovely peat. Touch of smoke and grilled lemons.
Finish Comment: Long and delightful. Citrus zest. Meaty and mild smoke. Ginger. Soft spices. Still, that playful funkiness lingers.

Nose Comment: Maritime minerals, notes of citron and green sea salt vegetables.
Taste Comment: Initially, crisp heather honey and slight sherried note, followed by herbal phenols, green maritime vegetables and a developing grapefruit and citrus pith bitterness, all in harmony with a bright lemon peatiness and surprisingly elegant for its age.
Finish Comment: Mouth-puckering green citrus zest and white pepper spice, but all in beautiful harmony.

Nose Comment: Graceful, sweet, round sherry, dates, oriental spices, beautifully noble sweet like an old ice wine, the alcohol is flatteringly integrated, musk, like the fine perfume by editions de parfums frédéric malle\nportrait of a lady; Green pickled walnuts, dark nougat
Taste Comment: Bitter oak, acidity, acidity at the same time closely interwoven with a sweet dark caramel, dried currant berries; Cardamom; strong black tea with oriental spices; Botanicals of gin and wort dark moist fertile earth
Finish Comment: Bitterness and sweetness linger for a long time, cigar smoke; The finish itself is eternally long

Nose Comment: Initially brutally damp cellar OB flavor, rarely had it so intense and hearty with a little ham behind it, with a lot of time and warmth it "only" becomes a leg note, next to it hot chocolate from the Christmas market, fresh espresso, Black Forest ham with herb crust, thyme, oregano, Cocoa, walnut, chestnut, liquorice, dark, dense and old
Taste Comment: Very potent, looks as if it were steadily gaining 4-5% in the mouth for the first 5-10 seconds, but without getting burned / alcoholic, liquorice, Black Forest ham, rum raisins, espresso, fine cocoa, pumpernickel, thyme, rosemary, earl gray , Marzipan, a hint of chalk, oiled mahogany dresser, raisins, dates, saffron, caraway, nutmeg, mulled wine made from the best shiraz, and later pomegranate
Finish Comment: What is that, getting a real peak again when swallowing like I almost never had it, as if he wanted to knock one out again, beef fillet, juicy and meaty, baked apple, crisp oak, grapefruit, dates, nutmeg, rum raisins, forever, very nice

Nose Comment: Heavily sherried first nosing. Dark fruits, dried fruits (prunes, raisins), leather, coffee, roasted nuts, dark chocolate ... and peat obviously. With time, hints of balsamic vinegar, tobacco, whiffs of a bonfire on the beach and maybe even SV's wet dogs.
Taste Comment: Punchy and thick. Coffee, dark chocolate, leather, earthy peat, prunes and lots of pepper.\nWith water : The nose is more coastal with seaweeds and seashells plus hints of lemons. Definitely more distillate now. The palate is slightly more refined with traces of lemons too behind the sherry notes and hints of resinous notes.
Finish Comment: Long, lingering sherry notes, oak and smoke.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Port Ellen1982 MC

향(Nose) [점수: 91.0]: Heavily sherried first nosing. Dark fruits, dried fruits (prunes, raisins), leather, coffee, roasted nuts, dark chocolate ... and peat obviously. With time, hints of balsamic vinegar, tobacco, whiffs of a bonfire on the beach and maybe even SV's wet dogs.

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: Punchy and thick. Coffee, dark chocolate, leather, earthy peat, prunes and lots of pepper.\nWith water : The nose is more coastal with seaweeds and seashells plus hints of lemons. Definitely more distillate now. The palate is slightly more refined with traces of lemons too behind the sherry notes and hints of resinous notes.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Long, lingering sherry notes, oak and smoke.

Nose Comment: Tropical, dried apricots, and mango, very sweet, dried raisins, jammy, marmalade. A wonderfully sherried nose that lures you. Very clean and concentrated.
Taste Comment: Slightly disappointed here, very sweet and raisin-driven, treacle, and jam, but the oak is playing at the same time, a tad drying and bitter. A lot of fresh-cut herbs, mints, spring onions, still a damn good whisky for sure. The body would be better only if it could be a little more oily.
Finish Comment: Long, concentrated marmalade, honey, sweet orange.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Longmorn1969 GM

향(Nose) [점수: 93.0]: Tropical, dried apricots, and mango, very sweet, dried raisins, jammy, marmalade. A wonderfully sherried nose that lures you. Very clean and concentrated.

맛(Taste) [점수: 90.0]: Slightly disappointed here, very sweet and raisin-driven, treacle, and jam, but the oak is playing at the same time, a tad drying and bitter. A lot of fresh-cut herbs, mints, spring onions, still a damn good whisky for sure. The body would be better only if it could be a little more oily.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: Long, concentrated marmalade, honey, sweet orange.

Nose Comment:
sweet dark chocolate, dust, raisins
that brings you straight into the past
and awakens passion
Salt, sea, iodine, silt
salty smoke
makes your mouth wet
warm dark sherry with bursting raisins
excites your desire
a fine medicine note in the background
arouses your curiosity
spicy malt sweets and dark oak oak notes
like a bittersweet foreboding
a fantastic nose
with everything you wish
Taste Comment:
cool and noble start
then salt & iodine
Herbal medicine from ancient times
a nice hot cloud of smoke in the throat
with dark chocolate oak notes
Bitter wood and dust remind you of an old canapé in the attic
Finish Comment:
very long
malty soft sweetness
You taste the notes one at a time
as if to sweep the sweetness through the malt
Salty iodine mixes with dark dry sherry
in the background the old bitter oak wood
dark and heavy
spicy malt sweets
the sweetness of caramelized apples runs from your cheeks
and blends pleasantly on your tongue with the oak

Taste Comment: Little punchy, oily, liquorice, subtle sweetness, more menthol and eucalyptus, old sherry wood, toffee, little spices and herbs, hints of peat and smoke – excellent!
Finish Comment: Medium long, warm, more spicy and herbal, little tannic, coffee

Nose Comment: Nice nose, very pleasant.\nRich Christmas cake, black cherry, rum & raisin ice cream, Belgium waffles, treacle sponge, ginger sponge, in truth there is a lot going on, this evolves with time in the glass.
Taste Comment:
Syrupy, tongue coating and really good at first but a hint of oaky bitterness keeps things grounded.
It is all on dark jams, with tuck loads of spice and then a wave of peat infused sherry lashes across your tongue.
It seems to increase in sweetness and intensity and after a while the slight bitterness goes.
This is a high quality Macallan
Finish Comment:
Long, remaining vibrant and spicy until the end.
No fade on this one
With 5 drops of water:-
Nose
Water releases notes of coffee been and a little fudge but everything else remains the same.
Palate
Lovely, still very spicy and the peat is strong mixing with the sherry and spices
Finish
Spicy and fresh, remaining jammy

Nose Comment: What surprised me most was that the arrival was all about tropical fruits, with ripe mango, papaya, passion fruit, and coconut showing up. Isn't it should be overwhelmed by sherry cask influence and peatiness, just like these modern whiskies do? Then came the grape elements, with fresh muscat, blackcurrant, and dried sultana, not to forget the blood orange. Green pepper and menthol are not frequently found in nosing. The fruitiness was accompanied by farmy, sulfuric funkiness with animal fur. Regarding the smoky part, it started with a whiff of burnt wood and iodine but gradually developed to be evident enough in every nosing moment. Smoky peach in an emptied glass, which was a good sign of old-school peated-well aged whisky AFAIC. Cracking complexity, multi-layerness and harmony.
Taste Comment: Ahh, it arrived soft and a bit weak, just blame it on the reduction. Caramel sweetness soon developed into grape juice. The texture was medium-bodied with fine tannin. Later the tangy oranges arrived, while a trace of chocolate bitterness added more complexity. The smoky part developed with time, with mild smoke of burnt paper, and charred wood gradually developing at the back and becoming rather impressive later.
Finish Comment: Long and dried. Dunnage warehouse, with caramel, ink, TCM herbal jelly (龟苓膏), and orange (pulp and pith) activated with a bit of lemony acidity. Puh-er, smoked jujube, and wood-smoked prunes/plums. Very pleasant in general! What's to add is that the palate became sweetened after quite a while, reminding me of some Coke diet.
document_text:

Then came the grape elements, with fresh muscat, blackcurrant, and dried sultana, not to forget the blood orange. Green pepper and menthol are not frequently found in nosing. The fruitiness was accompanied by farmy, sulfuric funkiness with animal fur. Regarding the smoky part, it started with a whiff of burnt wood and iodine but gradually developed to be evident enough in every nosing moment. Smoky peach in an emptied glass, which was a good sign of old-school peated-well aged whisky AFAIC. Cracking complexity, multi-layerness and harmony.

맛(Taste) [점수: 93.0]: Ahh, it arrived soft and a bit weak, just blame it on the reduction. Caramel sweetness soon developed into grape juice. The texture was medium-bodied with fine tannin. Later the tangy oranges arrived, while a trace of chocolate bitterness added more complexity. The smoky part developed with time, with mild smoke of burnt paper, and charred wood gradually developing at the back and becoming rather impressive later.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Long and dried. Dunnage warehouse, with caramel, ink, TCM herbal jelly (龟苓膏), and orange (pulp and pith) activated with a bit of lemony acidity. Puh-er, smoked jujube, and wood-smoked prunes/plums. Very pleasant in general! What's to add is that the palate became sweetened after quite a while, reminding me of some Coke diet.

Nose Comment: Lots of beehive, pollen, paraffin and honey for a start. Followed with all kinds of juicy tropical sweetness; mango, papaya, lychees, pineapple you name it. Gentle notes of orange peels, bananas and apricots. Some meadow flowers and vanilla cake with icing. Polished oak at the background. A nose to die for.
Taste Comment: Again much fruity sweetness with a menthol edge. Plenty of fresh oranges and tangerines in combination with pears and overripe bananas. Delicate notes of lemon grass and old herbal liqueurs. Spices of aniseed and a little cinnamon. Butter biscuits. Hints of milk chocolate at the background. Needless to say it's all very waxy and delightful.
Finish Comment: Long and endless! Drying oak and a little ginger. Quite perfect if you ask me.
document_text:

향(Nose): Lots of beehive, pollen, paraffin and honey for a start. Followed with all kinds of juicy tropical sweetness; mango, papaya, lychees, pineapple you name it. Gentle notes of orange peels, bananas and apricots. Some meadow flowers and vanilla cake with icing. Polished oak at the background. A nose to die for.

맛(Taste): Again much fruity sweetness with a menthol edge. Plenty of fresh oranges and tangerines in combination with pears and overripe bananas. Delicate notes of lemon grass and old herbal liqueurs. Spices of aniseed and a little cinnamon. Butter biscuits. Hints of milk chocolate at the background. Needless to say it's all very waxy and delightful.

피니쉬(Finish): Long and endless! Drying oak and a little ginger. Quite perfect if you ask me.

Nose Comment: Banana, banana skin, light honey, beeswax, pear, papaya, lychee, star fruit, canned pineapple, mango, almonds, marzipan, linseed oil, olive oil, Toblerone, fresh Hefezopf, light white wine, mild rosehip flowers, jasmine, slightly fennel, some dill , a hint of limescale, freshly ground daisy flowers, a bit of nutmeg, minuscule chalky, then more and more freshly pressed apple juice, also the banana becomes more intense - very lively for the age, super beautiful beguiling sniffing nose, great!
Taste Comment: incredibly sparkling, fruity, spicy, very intense and lively, the tropical fruits dance on the tongue, the linseed oil is added, the malt sets in motion immense salivation, dark chocolate, nice pepper, nutmeg, fine espresso with mild acidity, the banana, Beeswax, pear come to the front, dill and fennel are very light, delicate bitterness clothes the mouth, more bitter, more salivation, more coffee, more nutmeg
Finish Comment: long, very intense, very fruity, very banana-like, very spicy, again with a strong bitter kick (balanced though) - now also a lot of dill and menthol and the linseed oil and a hint of rose petals - all impressions still lively and surprisingly fresh for the age - a great composition - slowly the flavors disappear and it lingers after the bitterness - the banana!

Nose Comment: Fruits rendered in butter and sugar. All of them. Orchard, forest, tropcial. Fantastic. In addition, barrel seasoning and herbs. Then comes the full force of the sherry. Leather, tobacco, cedar, dried fruit.
Taste Comment: Sugar beet syrup spilled over the forest floor. Then comes tobacco, some sour fruits, ground coffee. High intensity, high deliciousness.
Finish Comment: Very dry and still wonderfully sweet. Peach slices that slowly sink into a cake and burn in the oven. A pack of pipe tobacco is lying around openly. The bitter substances stick to the tongue like glue.

Taste Comment: Soft on the palate, but the condition seems to be worse than last time, and the wine is more aged. Sweet, soft, oily, maltose, nutty, condensed apple juice soaked in peat, sour, but less bitter and astringent, smooth and low friction, oily and high-strength wine body conveys, moderate and Low key. 90
Finish Comment: With peat, ash, mint, and sourness, some licorice is just right. 91

Nose Comment: Notes of hessian, damp leaves, dunnage floor and hemp rope alongside clear sherry influences. There’s whispers of tobacco, but some gentle red fruits like plums, raspberries and blood oranges too. Then a sliver of mint, wet pebbles, and light tropical touches – pineapple, mango, and pink grapefruit even. A good balance between fruity elements and more earthy, dunnage type aromas.
Taste Comment: Gentle mineral touches with a fair amount of beeswax, honey, strong breakfast tea, some resins and a good amount of tannins. Also some white pepper, jammy apricots, orange zest and peaches. A soft salinity, and finally a touch of chocolate too
Finish Comment: Long. Somewhat dry at times with a good amount of spices (cinnamon, ginger, pepper), but also sweeter, jammy fruits. Just a sliver of smoke and a pinch of salt.

Nose Comment: Golden fruits, toasted barley, very complex and waxy. Immediately reminds me of some great PE SRs (such as 14th and 16th releases), grape skins, I would guess this is a classic Diageo style of blending, an ultra-high-end nose from the company. Felt a little bit engineered, but I like this very much.
Taste Comment: Very minty, crispy, Nutella, camphor, extremely herbal. Still quite balanced and graceful, slightly tannic. Elegance you can find from some Samarolis.
Finish Comment: Banana cream, minty, chewing gum.

Nose Comment: A symphony of sherry and associated spices, prunes/raisins, all kinds of baked fruits, fruity treacle, Christmas cake, some deep and dark berries, beautiful musty old oak infused with tropical fruits, sweet tobacco, coffee (dark and mysterious), furniture polish made with sherry as a major ingredient, dusty candied grapefruit (pleasant), always changing - super complex indeed, leather, some honey, old fashioned fruity candy, dark chocolate, zesty fruit juices come out from time to time, sawdust with vanilla and toffee.
Taste Comment: Woody and powerful sherry with a nutty component, herbs, tobacco, vanilla galore, heavy toffee, chewy majestic oak, coffee, furniture polish with sherry (very pleasant), leather, chocolate, zesty and freshly squeezed fruits, dustiness and nuts.
Finish Comment: Long - heavy sherry, dark treacle, some tropical dark and sticky resin, lingering concentrated mixture of wood, sherry and dark fruits at the very end, dark roaring malt, the "darkness" stays forever, hazelnut and honey.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenfarclas1958

향(Nose): A symphony of sherry and associated spices, prunes/raisins, all kinds of baked fruits, fruity treacle, Christmas cake, some deep and dark berries, beautiful musty old oak infused with tropical fruits, sweet tobacco, coffee (dark and mysterious), furniture polish made with sherry as a major ingredient, dusty candied grapefruit (pleasant), always changing - super complex indeed, leather, some honey, old fashioned fruity candy, dark chocolate, zesty fruit juices come out from time to time, sawdust with vanilla and toffee.

맛(Taste): Woody and powerful sherry with a nutty component, herbs, tobacco, vanilla galore, heavy toffee, chewy majestic oak, coffee, furniture polish with sherry (very pleasant), leather, chocolate, zesty and freshly squeezed fruits, dustiness and nuts.

피니쉬(Finish): Long - heavy sherry, dark treacle, some tropical dark and sticky resin, lingering concentrated mixture of wood, sherry and dark fruits at the very end, dark roaring malt, the "darkness" stays forever, hazelnut and honey.

Nose Comment: lacquered, but it is not that dominant, plum jam, leather sofa, freshly baked cinnamon, dark chocolate, this sherry butt arranged it beautifully, it is delicious to smell.
Taste Comment: you can feel that we are dealing with a whisky with a strength exceeding 65% (yes, after 38 years it can boast quite an extraordinary percentage).\nWhen we let it run wild on the tongue, a thick sherry emerges from behind the sparkling percentages (the whisky itself is also beautifully thick structurally), then huge layers of thick caramel, toffee, blackberry jam, cherries in dark chocolate and dried dates
Finish Comment: it stays with us for a long time, it does not let us forget about it, evoking the taste of cherries bathed in dark chocolate

Nose Comment:
Smells industrial, like a factory workshop but in a good way.
Hints of cooked bacon, dark soy sauce but it is mixed with putty, perhaps that is from the stone flagon this whisky was originally in?
Yes it smells like stir fry veg fried in dark soy sauce, weird but ok.
There is also a definite meat note like air dried beef and there is also a little flint and burnt match note, bot overpowering but it is there, reminds me of the smell when someone is arc welding a little (don`t take that as read as it has been a long time since I smelled that).
With time some dark fruit emerges, mixed with date and prune.
It is really difficult to score this one, I have not smelled anything quite like this before.
Another nosing and I get gravy granules.
Every time I nose this I get something new, an experience for sure but this is defiantly on the meaty side like some of the best heavily sherried Morlachs of old.
Finally French onion soup.
So, it is a little fruity, meaty, industrial
Taste Comment:
Bang, powerful and very rich on the sherry front but ever so slight sulphur but it adds to the meatiness of the mouthfeel.
The peat has arrived and it has swamped my tongue but the sherry is fighting it all the way and that is a sign of great balance as the dark fruit is allowed to come out, dark rope plum skins, damson jam that sort of thing.
It seems to get a little sweeter as you go on but the peat is like a sea, waves of it lash your tongue and now there is a slight dark breakfast marmalade note, the really dark marmalade with thick cut rind in it, but not really orange more like something savoury, very difficult to pin down.
Very good
Finish Comment: The balance shows on the finish, peat, fruit, sherry in complete harmony
document_text:

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: Bang, powerful and very rich on the sherry front but ever so slight sulphur but it adds to the meatiness of the mouthfeel.

Nose Comment: The colour is old gold and the texture about a few thick legs and very few late tears. And ...WOW... what a nose! This is complexity and harmony at its best, simply grab an aromas wheel and check all the pleasant boxes - peaty, earthy, floral, fruity and sweet aromas in a subtle (not very expressive) and elegant mix. I could sniff this for hours... and I have to push myself to proceed to the taste.
Taste Comment: The taste is rich and very complex too. It is remarkably dry (warm ashes) but of a really enjoyable dryness (never thought I would ever state such a thing). And it is layered - so you have the chance to identify the flavours and aromas one after the other. With water it offers even more aromas both in the nose and on the palate but it looses some power, of course. Nevertheless I like it with some drops of water better than neat.
Finish Comment: The arrival on the palate is creamy and instantly mouth-coating. Close to perfection, nothing to complain about (except it could be a little bolder). The finish is long and keeps this interesting dryness. And it stays sublime and complex. But the best is really the nose...
document_text:

태그: Dried Fruit,Leathery,Vanilla,Citric,Fresh Fruit,Hay-like,Husky,Leafy,Malt Extract,New Wood,Oily,Smokey,Solvent,Toasted

향(Nose) [점수: 97.0]: The colour is old gold and the texture about a few thick legs and very few late tears. And ...WOW... what a nose! This is complexity and harmony at its best, simply grab an aromas wheel and check all the pleasant boxes - peaty, earthy, floral, fruity and sweet aromas in a subtle (not very expressive) and elegant mix. I could sniff this for hours... and I have to push myself to proceed to the taste.

맛(Taste) [점수: 95.0]: The taste is rich and very complex too. It is remarkably dry (warm ashes) but of a really enjoyable dryness (never thought I would ever state such a thing). And it is layered - so you have the chance to identify the flavours and aromas one after the other. With water it offers even more aromas both in the nose and on the palate but it looses some power, of course. Nevertheless I like it with some drops of water better than neat.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: The arrival on the palate is creamy and instantly mouth-coating. Close to perfection, nothing to complain about (except it could be a little bolder). The finish is long and keeps this interesting dryness. And it stays sublime and complex. But the best is really the nose...

Nose Comment: Fresh! Medium peat, smoky obvious, slightly acidic, ethyl acetate acid gas, heavy syrup, heavy honeydew, heavy oil, milky, tea-scented. The other layer has medium-heavy meat, maltose, and a little green pepper. The aroma of the wine inevitably has a more obvious bottle effect (old tropical fruits, everyone knows anyway, the flavor will be very similar, so I won’t describe it) , The breath is gone after ten minutes. 92
Taste Comment: The implicit old bottle effect echoes the medium peat. The peat is comparable to the peat of the lagavulin 12yo bottled in the early 1980s. Compared with Lejia, it uses more Shirley-style sweet and medicinal flavor, and Laforge is more. Pay attention to the sweet and fruity paving with peat as the axis. The entrance is extremely sweet, with syrup, maple syrup, crisp green peppers, full of fat, and the fruity aroma is more subtle under the sweetness of the package. I would say it is candied orange juice. The flavor persists until it is collected by pickling sweet peppers, tea, ashes, and charcoal fire. Medium-weak wine, strong oiliness, full flavor, weak irritation, tingling, slightly ginger. p93-b91
Finish Comment: Ashes, mint, dry knots, long tail rhyme. 92

Nose Comment: Exuberant fruity sherry nose - very well balanced, exciting and fully present from the first second.\nSour raspberry porridge with crushed blackberries and blueberries, a touch of pleasant sulfur - between sulphurised raisins and matchheads, dry herbal aromas reminiscent of green walnut shells, juniper, and tree hives - the tannins dance - tell very clearly about age and European cask - but "over it " is not.\nGingerbread hearts with black chocolate and apricot jam.
Taste Comment: full-bodied dark extremely dense sherry freight - fine woody aromas, from cracked beech wood fireplace, over oiled furniture oak, dusty hardwood shelves in the cellar, bay leaves, rosemary needles, also slightly chewed pine needle - waxy, astringent, ethereal
Finish Comment: Red wine-flavored gravy - juniper, bay leaf, cinnamon, clove pepper, dry delicious woody effect, men's chocolate, berry puree, mulled wine, frankincense, beeswax - a Christmas market in the glass, longer than very long - the "Never ending story" for Maltheads

맛(Taste): full-bodied dark extremely dense sherry freight - fine woody aromas, from cracked beech wood fireplace, over oiled furniture oak, dusty hardwood shelves in the cellar, bay leaves, rosemary needles, also slightly chewed pine needle - waxy, astringent, ethereal

피니쉬(Finish): Red wine-flavored gravy - juniper, bay leaf, cinnamon, clove pepper, dry delicious woody effect, men's chocolate, berry puree, mulled wine, frankincense, beeswax - a Christmas market in the glass, longer than very long - the "Never ending story" for Maltheads

Nose Comment: Wow, heavy sherry, not much evidence of peat, maybe some OBE, you can smell the quality on show here. Forrest fruits, wet wood (in a good way), rum & raisin, redcurrant, blackcurrant it’s all there mixed in with wisps of smoke. but gets better with time in the glass
Taste Comment: Wow, the peat & spice just exploded on your tongue but the balance is perfect everything in harmony and the mouthfeel is rich. The peat is a little subdued at first but it grows being propelled along by the spice, what a great combo. This is like a symphony playing out on your tongue
Finish Comment: As long as you can imagine and then some, superb fruit notes all the way

Nose Comment:
A nose above all marked by spices, without being unbalanced either.
Cardamom, cinnamon, pepper, ginger in the first line.
We also have fruit with orange, fresh and in zest, and some other more melted citrus fruits.
Light copper pipe just polished and motor oil.
Fresh mint, light smoke
Slightly salty.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is incredibly soft and deep.
The fruit take the front, with orange, lemon, mango, papaya, passion fruit, pineapple juice, apricot, peach... a hell of a juice fruit.
Still that engine oil and that copper pipe.
The wood is present but soft, and slightly varnished with a touch of honey and fleur de sel.
Spices, further back, bring up the rear.
Finish Comment: Long and sweet finish, on multivitamin fruit juice, various and varied citrus zests, honey, and a slight peat

Pepper, leather.

Nose Comment: Dried fruits, I'm getting dates and raisins. Notes of soft spice with a touch of nuttiness. A little soy sauce appears with manuka honey.\nWith time plums appear with a slight orange citrus edge. Becoming berry rich, a bowl of red and black berries on a varnished table.
Taste Comment: Bite of spice, warm cinnamon with fruit cake soaked in treacle. Soft oak appears adding depth, its slightly woody but not bitter. Some hoisin sauce notes coming through, its slightly dry with some woodiness creeping in.
Finish Comment: Sweet dried fruits, soft varnished oak with a coating of leather.

Nose Comment: Very rich and complex: matured sherry, spicy oak and fruits: banana, mango, prune and cherry.\nCoffee, chocolate, Bagarol shoe polish, rubber, herbals, seaweed. But well come over the sea salty, peppery, peaty Talisker character as well.\nIf it's much contact with the air goes to Port Ellen  complexity.
Taste Comment: Extremely powerful, but the 62% is absolutely not exorbitant!\nHoney sweet sherry, peat, huge oak, citruses and leather  perfect wedding with the salty, peppery Talisker character, which richly presents itself! Ash, smoke, phosphorus and sulfur. The whole with very grotesque, but nearly perfect full range!
Finish Comment: Long, perfect woody flavors and ash remains in the end

Nose Comment: In the nose of the still hot smoke from the campfire on the beach in the foreground. Nice, strong cereal notes paired with fruits like ripe apples.\nMore subtle then the mint, surrounded by the fine salty sea breeze.\nWith water, it is a little sweeter with flavors of apple pie and blockade candies.
Taste Comment: On the palate you can recognize especially the fruity aromas again. At first he is a bit wild and strong, but soon the sweetness returns and he opens smoky aromas, as one wishes.\nOne would think that one sits on the beach, late at night and an apple over the hot fire roasting.\nUnfortunately, it loses its aroma and fruit with water, but gains sweetness and a touch of woodiness.
Finish Comment: A pretty long, fruity finish. No trace of alcoholic sharpness. In the end, it becomes a bit bitter / bitter and reminds of grapefruit. This remains for a very long time - covered in a beautiful smoke coat - received.

At first he is a bit wild and strong, but soon the sweetness returns and he opens smoky aromas, as one wishes.\nOne would think that one sits on the beach, late at night and an apple over the hot fire roasting.\nUnfortunately, it loses its aroma and fruit with water, but gains sweetness and a touch of woodiness.

피니쉬(Finish): A pretty long, fruity finish. No trace of alcoholic sharpness. In the end, it becomes a bit bitter / bitter and reminds of grapefruit. This remains for a very long time - covered in a beautiful smoke coat - received.

Nose Comment:
NS ! What a nose!
Fruit wrapped in wax. It explodes with intensity and precision.
Apricot, peach, orange peel. Plum.
Wood, fir resin. Mountain honey.
Very light, slightly dirty leather.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth it is slightly watery.
The fruit is always superb. Plum, grape, apricot, peach, quince, orange.
Always a lot of wax and honey.
Marmalade, jelly, fresh. Fruit in all its forms.

document_text:

Nose Comment: dense sweet-tart nose - you can smell the tannins already, oily syrupy sherry flavors - fresh cherries, orange, black currants, raspberry pulp, but also dried fruits such as dates and figs, cedar, fresh tree resin, heather, bay leaf, juniper bush, marzipan, roasted almond, Amaretto, fresh rose hips, slightly tender sulfur impact, oiled tropical wood, honey - very yummy and already very clear clean aromas straight from the bottle, but with a drop of water it goes much nicer
Taste Comment: intense aroma explosion - dry - old wood flour of oiled antique wood, wax, delicate smoke - almost completely decomposed and beautifully integrated - heather, palm wax shoe cream, tart leather notes, tobacco, cherry jam, a lot of mint, espresso, dark chocolate - rather spicy, noble, aromatic as very fruity - very productive
Finish Comment: long, balanced, lively, intense - consistent continuation of what he showed on the palate - but with an impressive endurance and liveliness

Nose Comment: Old Bottle Flavor, an unusually intense fruity aroma for a Springbank, somewhat leathery on the background, peel of green apples, salt marshes on the North Sea, subtle smoke, a bit woody .... yes, but not as intense as you would expect from many other old ones (superimposed) bottling knows - more like a very old beautiful piece of furniture, with the time something sour-fruity that comes forward, spontaneously I think of pomegranate, very mild and hardly alcoholic ... which is not surprising at just over 40%,
Taste Comment: Since the nose but I was raging hard, much less fruit than was expected, instead in the taste clearly "springbankischer" with tart spices, leather, salty maritime, a little peppery, also very nice the subtle cold smoke, roasted nuts, much more Oak aromas as in the nose and a bit dry - bitter, fortunately not yet "superimposed", towards the end somehow a bit strict .... without that it would really taste right now, I have to think a little of lamb - but is as I said no taste, just an association
Finish Comment: Medium to long finish which is dry, slightly spicy and slightly bitter

Nose Comment:
it rained
You work in the peat
Your skin is still wet
She smells sweet
and tastes salty from your sweat
the air is spicy and damp from the rain-soaked peat and the scent of the blossoming Erika
the smell of fresh lemon balm mingles between your fingers with the earthy wet peat
You're smiling
Tonight you will wrap the fresh goat's cheese with bacon
and caramelise in the pan with sugar
to an old Ardbeg, who will remind you of this beautiful day
Taste Comment:
You can already feel the fine caramel taste on your tongue
how he mixes with the salty ham
with the smoky glow of old Ardbeg in the throat
You put on your leather gloves and grab the damp wooden handle of the spade
You should bring some fresh lemon balm and a few herbs
It will go perfectly with the sweet goat cream cheese
Finish Comment:
long
fiery spicy caramels in the smoke
> sweetish tobacco
> Lemon & herbs
> Peat & caramel sweets
a touch of fish with lots of lemon
again sweet tobacco with soft smoke
soft old wood with sweet malt

Nose Comment: Classic Macallan sherry nose with of juicy plums, prunes dried sultanas. Stewed figs and dates as well. Hints of toffee and butterscotch. Chocolate covered raisins. Balsamic vinegar. Slightly dusty smokiness at the background.
Taste Comment: Quite some cinnamon and toffee now intermingled with woody notes of cedar oak. Followed with 'darker' hints of Christmas cake, mint praline and espresso coffee. Also crystallized oranges and roasted chestnuts.
Finish Comment: Medium long with toasty dryness. White pepper and a little nutmeg.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Macallan1968

향(Nose): Classic Macallan sherry nose with of juicy plums, prunes dried sultanas. Stewed figs and dates as well. Hints of toffee and butterscotch. Chocolate covered raisins. Balsamic vinegar. Slightly dusty smokiness at the background.

맛(Taste): Quite some cinnamon and toffee now intermingled with woody notes of cedar oak. Followed with 'darker' hints of Christmas cake, mint praline and espresso coffee. Also crystallized oranges and roasted chestnuts.

피니쉬(Finish): Medium long with toasty dryness. White pepper and a little nutmeg.

Taste Comment: Cherries & plums, Sherry, Cognac, lemon, clearly leather, dark chocolate, burnt sugar, cherry jam with seaweed and salt water!\nTartness & sweetness & soury tastes in harmony, forest floor, fresh & rudden wood, plum brandy, cough drops, sage tea, licorice, cocoa cake, and a hint of peat.
Finish Comment: Sherry cask with plum brandy, licorice, Cognac, citrus, cherry juice, pickled swwt cherries, brandy beans (cherry), some smoke, wood aromas, very pleasant bitterness, eucalyptus, vanilla, dark chocolate, apples, jam sweetness, currant jam, wonderful tartness.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Macallan1964
태그: Chocolate,Dried Fruit,Fresh Fruit,Honey,Sherried,Vanilla

향(Nose): A typical Macallan nose character at first;
then the old Sherry cask offers also a quite 'maritime' side.
Sweet pickled peaches, raisins, cherries, a lot of oranges arise,
lemon juice all the time, pickled apples from time to time, some vanilla;
then a few other spirits like Feuerzangenbowle, Kirschwasser -
and also Franzbranntwein;
some pepper and peat in the background.
Second nose adds:
chocolate with citrus and cherry jelly, raisins, some slt water, caramell, old cigar, fruit sweetness with a shot of vinegar, spiciness, play of chocolate with leather, sweetened black tea (East Frisians), bouillon cube, clear motor oil.

맛(Taste): Cherries & plums, Sherry, Cognac, lemon, clearly leather, dark chocolate, burnt sugar, cherry jam with seaweed and salt water!
Tartness & sweetness & soury tastes in harmony, forest floor, fresh & rudden wood, plum brandy, cough drops, sage tea, licorice, cocoa cake, and a hint of peat.

피니쉬(Finish): Sherry cask with plum brandy, licorice, Cognac, citrus, cherry juice, pickled swwt cherries, brandy beans (cherry), some smoke, wood aromas, very pleasant bitterness, eucalyptus, vanilla, dark chocolate, apples, jam sweetness, currant jam, wonderful tartness.

Nose Comment:
I would describe the nose as pleasantly fresh.
Fresh sawdust, actually more like the burnt edges of MDF when you cut it with an electric saw.
Hints of mango and honey mixed with sweet biscuit.
I am guessing the palate may be a little fragile after such a delicate nose.
Taste Comment: This is quite spicy at first with some honey and hints of orange and lemon but they are on the faint side.\nThe fruit is of the stewed compote variety, there is yellow plum and the mango is there with a few nectarine notes, anyway the fruit is nice for sure.
Finish Comment:
The finish for me is by far the best part, it glides down with some honey and the faintest mere hint of menthol on the tail.
With water:
The nose has gone AWOL but the palate is ok with even more fruit and lots of sweet spice.
The finish is also a little more expressive which surprised me, fades slowly, again the finish is the best part.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Highland Park1958
태그: Chocolate,Citric,Dried Fruit,Fresh Fruit,Honey,Malt Extract,New Wood,Sherried,Smokey,Solvent,Vanilla

향(Nose) [점수: 89.0]: I would describe the nose as pleasantly fresh.\nFresh sawdust, actually more like the burnt edges of MDF when you cut it with an electric saw.\nHints of mango and honey mixed with sweet biscuit.\nI am guessing the palate may be a little fragile after such a delicate nose.

맛(Taste) [점수: 90.0]: This is quite spicy at first with some honey and hints of orange and lemon but they are on the faint side.\nThe fruit is of the stewed compote variety, there is yellow plum and the mango is there with a few nectarine notes, anyway the fruit is nice for sure.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: The finish for me is by far the best part, it glides down with some honey and the faintest mere hint of menthol on the tail.\nWith water:\nThe nose has gone AWOL but the palate is ok with even more fruit and lots of sweet spice.\nThe finish is also a little more expressive which surprised me, fades slowly, again the finish is the best part.

Nose Comment: This is to die for. Dried orange peels, and stewing jams of all kinds (mostly black cherries and blackcurrants), precious woods (Thuya Box), and not that much precious woods as well (I can "smell" heavy tanins!). The kind of spices you find in Glögg (clove and cinnamon), and a pinch of aniseed for the freshness. Lots happening indeed, and quite mouth watering!
Taste Comment: This is serious malt! Huge and tasty, with a nice sweet and sour balance which makes it extremely enjoyable. Quite some woods and spices, along with nice liquor herbs, balanced by a huge freshness (tiger balm, spruce sap sweets), and a very pleasant dryness, not unlike the best overaged Agricole Rums from Martinique.
Finish Comment: Even drier now, with a spectacular but tamed herbal bitterness (Fernet-Branca, someone?), and the return of these lovely orange peels.
document_text:

Dried orange peels, and stewing jams of all kinds (mostly black cherries and blackcurrants), precious woods (Thuya Box), and not that much precious woods as well (I can "smell" heavy tanins!). The kind of spices you find in Glögg (clove and cinnamon), and a pinch of aniseed for the freshness. Lots happening indeed, and quite mouth watering!

맛(Taste) [점수: 91.0]: This is serious malt! Huge and tasty, with a nice sweet and sour balance which makes it extremely enjoyable. Quite some woods and spices, along with nice liquor herbs, balanced by a huge freshness (tiger balm, spruce sap sweets), and a very pleasant dryness, not unlike the best overaged Agricole Rums from Martinique.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Even drier now, with a spectacular but tamed herbal bitterness (Fernet-Branca, someone?), and the return of these lovely orange peels.

Nose Comment: wow it's dense, intense, red fruit through and through, wax, oak, spicy, raspberries, caramel, pepper, sweet, spicy forest honey, freshly melted candle wax and the candle is red in my mind's eye, also cherries, the port is good Influenced, the honey is totally intense, vanilla, creamy, an extraordinary aroma composition, it seems sublime and old, also slightly maritime, my mouth is already watering, great, after the first sip it gets another flavor boost, Now some fresh mint here too, wow, the nose is right at the top of my all-time best list
Taste Comment: wow, it continues seamlessly in the mouth, sweet, here too a lot of honey, floral, raspberries and cherries, port, a minimal hint of sulfur, intense, slightly oak, which then gets stronger at the end, creamy, smooth, beautiful, also the second sip is outstanding, red berries and fruit with a slight sweetness, a touch of wood and a touch of fizz that resonates with the fruit
Finish Comment: fresher, mint on the palate, cherry, nut, a hint of dirt, the overall impression is still red, if you had to name a color, slightly sweet, a touch of chili on the tip of the tongue, on the second sip the oak hits harder in the aftertaste, um then, after a while, giving way to the sweetly fruity ending

Nose Comment: Mild citrus flavors stand out first. A very delicate cloud of smoke hovers around somewhere in the background. Oranges. It's going in the direction of orange cake. Sweet herbs occasionally penetrate the nose. It almost goes in the direction of the Liebstöckl. The whisky changes quite quickly. It's getting sweeter. Forest honey. Gummy bear? Yes I think so. And again that delicate cloud of smoke that timidly passes by. Sweet tobacco.
Taste Comment: Spicy forest honey flows into the mouth. Tobacco is immediately on board. Amazingly sparkling, yellow apple. Rect mild pepper. The alcohol is also discreetly noticeable, not disturbing, but still noticeable. The mouthfeel becomes drier.
Finish Comment: Not really long. Rather dry, the oak is noticeably there. But the whisky aftertaste could be a bit more intense. A touch of spice remains.

Nose Comment: A most beguiling nose; thick, sticky, full of apricots, prunes, and some vanilla, mangos and honey dew... and with a few drops of water, an explosion of dark, preserved jams/fruits!
Taste Comment: Literally sparkles with sweet spice and brown sugar!! Some salt comes out but pretty much a continuation of the nose... lots of sweet, overripe dark fruits... a bit of dryness, but nothing can detract from its yumminess!
Finish Comment: Moderately long, a bit of five spice powder comes out; excellent, excellent!

Nose Comment: Intense aroma of dried fruit, balsamic. Marzipan, loads of freshly cracked black pepper. Fragrant, perfumed. Strawberry jam. Sweet cough drops. Licorice. A little orange zest. In the back I get hints of polished wood and dunnage.\nNothing individual sticks out, there is a clear sense of years of slow maturation.\nAfter some opening up, added notes of sooty chimney and leather appear.
Taste Comment: Pretty soft on arrival, maybe a little OBE already. Oily though, and with good length. Much less fruity on the palate. Carried by punchy spices. Pronounced black pepper again. Also heavy on almonds, cashew nuts.\nDark chocolate, cloves and mint. Touch of sweet blueberry and prune juice. Oloroso sherry.
Finish Comment: I do detect quite some peat on the medium finish, but of a very subtle and aged, earthy (mainland) style. Salted caramel, dark honey and a couple of small raisins.
