Nose Comment:
Simply superb nose.
First of all, a wave of fruit. Apricots, peaches, papayas, mandarins.
Then cloves, white chocolate, pepper, light leather and freshly cut wood.
The balance is perfect and the alcohol is not felt at all.
With aeration we enter a slightly fresher and more vegetal area. The wax is revealed, as well as fresh mint, but also aromatic herbs.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth the pleasure continues.
The glass is oily and soft. Alcohol is also imperceptible here.
Lots of fruit, a little more cooked and candied than on the nose. Peach, apple, tangerine, lemon candy.
Licorice is also very present and wrapped in camphor.
Finish Comment: Superb finish on fruits, mainly oranges and tangerines, camphor, and pepper.\nIt's very long and does a great job of honoring the glass as a whole. Very light caramel.\nFresh mint is also present.

Nose Comment: AHH. There is the lovely old and beefy nose that I fell in love With on the old Mortlach's. So Heavy. Then more minty. And of course the huge Orange zesty notes. Apricots. Jammy. Vanilla. Some soft spices. Eucalyptus. A Stellar nose, utter class.
Taste Comment: Beefy again, no Wonder. Really thick and creamy texture. Jammy and the waxy notes I never get tired of. Spearmint. Apricots, and sooooo Orange zesty!! Earthly notes coming through after a while. And in the end some lemon tonic, a touch of old bottle syndrome. Lovely.
Finish Comment: Medium long. Some oaky notes that I do not mind to be honest. Waxiness lingers all the way. Still thick and jammy. Big on the zesty notes through and through. A tiny hint of tobacco in the very end. A finish that delivered indeed, in spite of the really old release and 40%.
document_text:

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: Beefy again, no Wonder. Really thick and creamy texture. Jammy and the waxy notes I never get tired of. Spearmint. Apricots, and sooooo Orange zesty!! Earthly notes coming through after a while. And in the end some lemon tonic, a touch of old bottle syndrome. Lovely.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: Medium long. Some oaky notes that I do not mind to be honest. Waxiness lingers all the way. Still thick and jammy. Big on the zesty notes through and through. A tiny hint of tobacco in the very end. A finish that delivered indeed, in spite of the really old release and 40%.

Nose Comment:
Smells a little like bourbon on the nose, cedarwood at first but then something sweeter like Turkish Delight.
Pecan pie, bubble gum and treacle.
Yes, this is very rich if the nose is anything to go by?
With water the nose is even better
Taste Comment:
Various dark fruits and as the nose suggested it still reminds me of some bourbons I have had but this is from sherry casks, strange?
Cherry tart, followed by bags of various spices
If you add water it gets sweeter and it also gets better, this is like a very rich fruit loaf, and then some nice orange notes.
Balance is very good here,
Finish Comment: Long, sweet & spicy

Nose Comment: Fantastic burst of tropical yellow fruit, rarely had this concentration of overripe pineapple, juicy mango and green banana. Enormously appealing, without any hint of off-notes, not a trace of oak. With a lot of air, darker fruits and some chocolate are added. From the cask selection, I would go for mostly ex-bourbon with some refill sherry casks. Luckily no smoke! Perfectly composed. A little water makes it a little drier, the fruit now appears less ripe overall. Better without.
Taste Comment: Disappointingly flat at first, you really have to suck it, then it becomes velvety, nice tart oak, creme brulee, cherry cake, tobacco, blood orange. Here the oak dominates, the nose is much better. With a little water it opens up a bit and becomes fruitier, but remains tart.
Finish Comment: Very long, grips the palate, creamy dark chocolate with 85% cocoa.

From the cask selection, I would go for mostly ex-bourbon with some refill sherry casks. Luckily no smoke! Perfectly composed. A little water makes it a little drier, the fruit now appears less ripe overall. Better without.

Nose Comment: Extremely smoky for a 35 years old, that Talisker peppery compliment the Island smokiness perfectly. Lots of fresh tropical fruits, accompanied with some energizing sea breeze. Old attic, with wooden flooring. The briny notes becomes more apparent after a few minutes. Some oily scents, salted and roasted almond. The nose becomes more fruity after a sip.
Taste Comment: Oily and dense, sea water, nutty, salted butter, salted cheese, white pepper, and nicely compliment by the soft peat smoke.
Finish Comment: Smoky and nutty, slight bitterness, and a surprising coconut notes.

피니쉬(Finish): Dark roasted malt, pumpernickel, nutmeg, fennel, tobacco, long

Nose Comment: I am not sure about the nose there seems to be a few off notes that remind me of lemon & lime. The peat is there and it is quite an elegant peat, plum skins, apple and some nice grapefruit now maybe that was what I was thinking was an off note?\nFurther nosing there is now a few coffee notes and I do not think there are any off notes, just not what I was expecting.
Taste Comment: Wow that is fruity, yes like the nose suggested there is definitely some lime in there with grapefruit, mango and kiwi fruit mixed with custard and cream.\nThe kiwi fruit grows as does the cream and more line comes in, this is a fruit salad and yes the peat is there and its quite strong but the fruit is so massive it keeps it inn the background\nBrilliant, the peat, fruit and sherry are wonderfully balanced here.
Finish Comment: Long, fruity and creamy

Nose Comment: A lot of young, fearless, fresh lemony peat here, very different from sister cask 1146, much brighter here. Classic lemony peat reminds me of Caol Ila's from similar vintages. Very mineral, there are metal and water scales.
Taste Comment: Mellow and sweet, still a lot of fresh crushed lemon and peat juice. Very sour and balanced, a little bit watery but fine, some tar and fresh herbs, again, a lot of lemons!
Finish Comment: Long, dark chocolates, residue from the factory, a lot of tar.

Nose Comment: Powerful due to the high alcohol content - if it is too strong than you are too weak. Wonderful tasty mild peat, which is perfectly incorporated into a combination of citric and farmy notes. Lemon freshness versus cowhouse and fresh tarred road.
Taste Comment: Fasten seatbells! ... three, two one, lift-off the taste rocket. Powerful realisitation of what the nose has promised. In addition to the flavors mentioned above there is pepper and liquorice, creating a lovely spicyness.
Finish Comment: Very looooooooooong, peeeeeaaaaty and harmonic rocket flight to Mars. Begins, when the finish of most standard whiskies ends.

Nose Comment: The first thing to say is that this has a nice nose, rich and multi layered.\nPlenty of fruit on show, mainly orange & mango but then some ripe plum arrives that is mixed with a little ginger, black pepper and burnt treacle with the faintest hint of peat/smoke.\nWith water there is more of everything.
Taste Comment:
It is quite bitter at first with the wood pushing the sweet fruit out the way and it is a little drying.
The fruit is juicy and lip smacking but also a little overripe, slightly sour if you will.
The spice note increases along with the peat that there was only a hint of at first.
i will add water to see if this sweetens up a little, fingers crossed.
With water :-
Good, it is a little sweeter but the oak is overpowering the fruit and spice as you go on.
The fruit is orange, mango plum and maybe a hint of fresh pineapple.
Finish Comment: The finish is pleasant with water added and finally the fruit bursts through in equal measure to the spice, the oak is still there but has been overcome, at last

Nose Comment: A strong sweet fruit peel comes to meet me. Filled with blackberries, cherries and prunes. Very dark aromas but also over and over again strong red fruits play in the glass. Mandrins and wild strawberries mix with a red baked apple. A warm raisin / cinnamon sauce is still flowing over the hot baked apple. The fructose is a little caramelized. The malt swirls syrupy in the glass gently in my hand. Hot plum cake, always juicier, wildflower honey, as I like to buy it in the Turkish village, runs slowly over huge dried dates. A handful of dried figs are somewhere in between. Among all this heavy sweet oak with a large piece of Sacher cake. I do not want this dram to end, so I could breathe forever.
Taste Comment: Sweet and fruity, he glides in the mouth and back, while he puts everything dry, what he encounters. Strong barrel wort comes from the malt. It tingles at the tip of the tongue, while the oak tastes old, woody, almost dusty. Tobacco as sweet as I have not experienced mingles with the wood tones. Grapfruits lightly dusted with sugar join. A strong piece of chocolate with 85% cocoa content.
Finish Comment: Tannins and the dark chocolate are literally in the mouth. The grapefruits and strong espresso peel on the tobacco. Slowly the malt releases some leather. The oak gives way to dry and after a long while, it gives back the sweet aromas of sherry.

Mandrins and wild strawberries mix with a red baked apple. A warm raisin / cinnamon sauce is still flowing over the hot baked apple. The fructose is a little caramelized. The malt swirls syrupy in the glass gently in my hand. Hot plum cake, always juicier, wildflower honey, as I like to buy it in the Turkish village, runs slowly over huge dried dates. A handful of dried figs are somewhere in between. Among all this heavy sweet oak with a large piece of Sacher cake. I do not want this dram to end, so I could breathe forever.

It tingles at the tip of the tongue, while the oak tastes old, woody, almost dusty. Tobacco as sweet as I have not experienced mingles with the wood tones. Grapfruits lightly dusted with sugar join. A strong piece of chocolate with 85% cocoa content.

피니쉬(Finish): Tannins and the dark chocolate are literally in the mouth. The grapefruits and strong espresso peel on the tobacco. Slowly the malt releases some leather. The oak gives way to dry and after a long while, it gives back the sweet aromas of sherry.

Nose Comment: First impression is excellent similar to the 72 Brora but more refined, less aggressive.\nBrine, seaweed, lemon, lime uncooked root vegetables, damp earth and peppery peat.\nFaint hints of breakfast marmalade, pumice stone, pebbles.
Taste Comment: More power than expected, the peat is in your face from the start, pepper and some nice lime skin notes mixed with a little salt but also something slightly drying, almost cardboardy.\nThe fruit is coming through but checked by wave after wave of peat and it gets a little sweeter, white fruits here of apple, hints of apricot and lemon.\nThe peat angle seams to subside and lets the fruit breakout, this is well balanced.
Finish Comment: Long, peppery, lip smacking, no peat monster as such just quality.

맛(Taste): More power than expected, the peat is in your face from the start, pepper and some nice lime skin notes mixed with a little salt but also something slightly drying, almost cardboardy.\nThe fruit is coming through but checked by wave after wave of peat and it gets a little sweeter, white fruits here of apple, hints of apricot and lemon.\nThe peat angle seams to subside and lets the fruit breakout, this is well balanced.

피니쉬(Finish): Long, peppery, lip smacking, no peat monster as such just quality.

Nose Comment: Wow, you can nose an operating mine, sea air from the isle of Mull, raw power, very peaty, very similar to an Ardbeg and other islay gems! However, everything is rather elegant here (believe me or not), raw but elegant, concentrated. Nutty, austere, cigar smokes more Nutella after open up.
Taste Comment: Rich and peaty, so sensational!\nYou can feel the raw peaty power is attacking you. It reminds me of the mountains and sea of the isle of Mull.\nHuge seawater, concentrated lime juice, cigar leaves, celery salts.
Finish Comment: Long, rich and peaty, leathery and minty, austere.
document_text:

향(Nose): Wow, you can nose an operating mine, sea air from the isle of Mull, raw power, very peaty, very similar to an Ardbeg and other islay gems! However, everything is rather elegant here (believe me or not), raw but elegant, concentrated. Nutty, austere, cigar smokes more Nutella after open up.

맛(Taste): Rich and peaty, so sensational!\nYou can feel the raw peaty power is attacking you. It reminds me of the mountains and sea of the isle of Mull.\nHuge seawater, concentrated lime juice, cigar leaves, celery salts.

피니쉬(Finish): Long, rich and peaty, leathery and minty, austere.

Nose Comment: A fruit compote with a subtle smoky note - red apple, ripe pears, crushed banana, a splash of lemon. Ashen, dry. The smoke then becomes more intense and clearer over time, bringing with it salt, phenol, warm tar paper and wattiness. Slightly herbaceous with thyme, rosemary, and juniper berries. Nutmeg. Now next to the fruits from the beginning also smoked orange slices. Grapefruit. Very appealing nose with a great fruit-smoke-mix.
Taste Comment: Mild, but very spicy and smoky on the tongue. Fascinating, at the age. Tart wood, salmiac pastilles. Warm tar, sea salt, warm sand on a summer's day by the sea, Hansaplast. If you take a nose again after a sip, the smoky note will only be stronger. A touch of lavender. Banana sauce, pineapple juice. Nougat chocolate and espresso beans, mild herbs, sugar beet syrup and honey. Malt. Sweet, salty and tangy at the same time.
Finish Comment: Long and slightly dry. Smoky with light fruits, herbs, some licorice, malt and cafe au lait.

Nose Comment: Wow ... What's that? First of all, I have smoke. Greasy smoke, not very strong, but noticeable. In addition, heavy sherry with its dark fruits. Plums wrapped in bacon. Grilled bananas with cinnamon. Forest soil with porcini mushrooms. Traditional balsamic vinegar, old and viscous. Some pot roast, served in a dusty library. Porrödes leather. It is fascinating that with the old, set and heavy impression, even a blood orange finds its way into the nose. Occasionally she comes through, but quickly loses behind leather, plum and bacon again.  Time weakens the smoke a bit. To the plums come over-ripe dates and figs. Some sweetness prevails. Chocolate, about 70% cocoa content. Gradually the wood gets stronger too. The oak is seasoned with nutmeg and pepper. Cherry is now added.
Taste Comment: Plum juice, warm and full. Sweet cherry, chocolate, this time rather milk chocolate. Thick and heavy, the whisky is in the mouth. The smoke is hard to hold. Leather, again I imagine a library. But cherry juice is there too. And of course, the oak is not to be misjudged. Spicy prickles the mouth and leathery, musty tobacco forms and can be swallowed after swallowing. Through the throat to the nose comes again smoke, musty and slightly greasy. Dark chocolate.
Finish Comment: Medium to long. Modrig, leathery. Rather dry. Slowly (and after every sip more), a bitterness forms in the mouth that lasts a long time.
document_text:

Nose Comment: Strawberries, jam, heather, honey, some fresh mint leaves, vanilla cream, so so lovely. Definitely one to nose for hours. Oranges. White chocolate. Its hard to say, but I thought this was one of the best noses i've ever smelled, thus the 98. Might need to readjust as I try more whisky, but will keep for now!
Taste Comment: creamy, spicy, nice teak oil, some of the minty-ness comes in. Unfortunately there is OBE but it's not the worse i've experienced and doesn't detract from the overall experience. The berries come in, some strawberry. Palate moves into some peat notes, very mild.\nAfter a week open, OBE notes have faded significantly and more bitter espresso dark chocolate notes. A lot more medicinal and woody, which is fantastic
Finish Comment: Woody, cinnamon, brine. Vanilla and honey on finish. Gets bitter, but then some sweet sherry undertones pop in. Pretty long finish, vanilla, mint

Nose Comment: First impression after pouring: Wow - very direct, very open, very intense exotic and at the same time pleasantly spicy.\nSweet-sourish fruitiness, lime, perfectly ripe pineapple and yellow kiwi, overripe but not yet fermenting mango, buttery papaya, a hint of greasy avocado, vanilla coconut cream, lokum (Turkish delight), maple syrup, white inner grapefruit skin, very noticeable Cinnamon and a delicate hint of clove, beeswax, birch sap, orange blossom, orange oil
Taste Comment: fine tingling on the tongue, fine oak, ginger, mint, cinnamon, pepper, citrus oil, the tannins are there - but they are very tame by age, tobacco, vanilla, the fruit from the nose and overripe banana, Juicy Fruit chewing gum, - It is fruity, slightly peppery without sprit and pleasantly spicy - very mouthwash - with the second tiny sip he is even more intense - he is on the palate similar dynamic as in the nose - much to discover and very intense
Finish Comment: Remnants of fruitiness sound, chilli, pepper, ginger, tobacco, mint and a complex citrus freshness are tied to a wax film very long on the tongue - even after minutes still easily noticeable

향(Nose): First impression after pouring: Wow - very direct, very open, very intense exotic and at the same time pleasantly spicy.\nSweet-sourish fruitiness, lime, perfectly ripe pineapple and yellow kiwi, overripe but not yet fermenting mango, buttery papaya, a hint of greasy avocado, vanilla coconut cream, lokum (Turkish delight), maple syrup, white inner grapefruit skin, very noticeable Cinnamon and a delicate hint of clove, beeswax, birch sap, orange blossom, orange oil

맛(Taste): fine tingling on the tongue, fine oak, ginger, mint, cinnamon, pepper, citrus oil, the tannins are there - but they are very tame by age, tobacco, vanilla, the fruit from the nose and overripe banana, Juicy Fruit chewing gum, - It is fruity, slightly peppery without sprit and pleasantly spicy - very mouthwash - with the second tiny sip he is even more intense - he is on the palate similar dynamic as in the nose - much to discover and very intense

피니쉬(Finish): Remnants of fruitiness sound, chilli, pepper, ginger, tobacco, mint and a complex citrus freshness are tied to a wax film very long on the tongue - even after minutes still easily noticeable

Nose Comment: Sherry cask influence - rich fruit
Taste Comment: intense and expressive, fragrant tobacco, chocolate
Finish Comment: infinitely long, gentle tar with a delicate honey taste, black tea and chocolate almonds as an aftertaste.
document_text:

태그: Coal-gas

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 99.0]: infinitely long, gentle tar with a delicate honey taste, black tea and chocolate almonds as an aftertaste.

Nose Comment: The whole room smells of pine resin, pineapple and ripe, freshly cut pears, a touch of Earl Gray bergamot and oolong tea with orange blossom. Balanced yet strongly aromatic.
Taste Comment: A veritable fruit supernova with clear light wood juice initially, but immediately it becomes supple and sweet. Quince and ripe grapefruit are added to the fruit basket and a few drops of high-quality vegetable oil.
Finish Comment: The age of this Bourbon Cask-Kings shows in gracefully long finish, thunder weather, which lingers long with its mouth-watering fruit flavors.

Nose Comment: Thick and sticky, heavily sherries Christmas pudding enjoyed by a log fire in the study of an old Scottish country house. Soft smokiness with tobacco leaves and unrolled fine Cuban cigars. With time the fruity character of Glendronach strolls in with figs, dates and even a helping of creme brulee
Taste Comment: Very powerful on arrival, lots of energy and vigor, not what you usually get from an older sherry cask. Seville orange marmalade with a little Terry's chocolate orange dark. Notes of old oak coming through but its restrained and not bitter.\nWith water cloves are there on the tip, notes of sour dough and an increase in woodiness becoming increasingly bitter.
Finish Comment: Oaky, drying with braised beef, beef stew, steak and ale pie. Water emphasises the oak and brings out bitter notes.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glendronach1992
태그: Chocolate,Citric,Honey,Husky

향(Nose): Thick and sticky, heavily sherries Christmas pudding enjoyed by a log fire in the study of an old Scottish country house. Soft smokiness with tobacco leaves and unrolled fine Cuban cigars. With time the fruity character of Glendronach strolls in with figs, dates and even a helping of creme brulee

맛(Taste): Very powerful on arrival, lots of energy and vigor, not what you usually get from an older sherry cask. Seville orange marmalade with a little Terry's chocolate orange dark. Notes of old oak coming through but its restrained and not bitter.\nWith water cloves are there on the tip, notes of sour dough and an increase in woodiness becoming increasingly bitter.

피니쉬(Finish): Oaky, drying with braised beef, beef stew, steak and ale pie. Water emphasises the oak and brings out bitter notes.

Nose Comment: I imagine dark silk developing in a warm room of an Italian Palazzo. Velvet pillows. A distinct sherry profile. Candied plum jam, dried tea rose, walnut jam, dark and warm raisins. Oak, the inside of the leather upholstery of an old chair that has just been roughly torn. Lacquer. With a drop of water, it became sharper, the sweet tones dropped lower.
Taste Comment: From sweet prune jam, the taste goes to aggressive, bright varnish, oak, pepper, and a fireball-as if hot cotton candy was shoved into your mouth. The taste feels all the same tones as in the aroma. With a drop of water, the taste became sweeter, the high degree and the accompanying aggression receded.
Finish Comment: A beautiful, velvety and noble aftertaste with notes of leather, the dryness of a tobacco leaf and the sweetness of prune jam. Amazing balance!
document_text:

향(Nose): I imagine dark silk developing in a warm room of an Italian Palazzo. Velvet pillows. A distinct sherry profile. Candied plum jam, dried tea rose, walnut jam, dark and warm raisins. Oak, the inside of the leather upholstery of an old chair that has just been roughly torn. Lacquer. With a drop of water, it became sharper, the sweet tones dropped lower.

맛(Taste): From sweet prune jam, the taste goes to aggressive, bright varnish, oak, pepper, and a fireball-as if hot cotton candy was shoved into your mouth. The taste feels all the same tones as in the aroma. With a drop of water, the taste became sweeter, the high degree and the accompanying aggression receded.

피니쉬(Finish): A beautiful, velvety and noble aftertaste with notes of leather, the dryness of a tobacco leaf and the sweetness of prune jam. Amazing balance!

Nose Comment: For the Duty Free version.\nMalty center surrounded by an old cellar, orange peel and juice, scouring powder, rum raisins, resin coming out of the wood, some butter, marzipan soaked with old rum, Demarara sugar, coffee, wood bark, impressions of a glasshouse, hints of forest floor, oily workbench, motor oil, old cloth, phenolic hints, leather, some reed, gentlemen's room (leather armchair, cigars, humidor, ...), pralines, caramel
Taste Comment: A little salt, hints of butter again, malty sweetness, resin, the old cellar is present, leathery wood with scouring powder, hints of rum, old Sherry casks without much Sherry, raisins, alcohol-nut cake, Demarara sugar in the background is playing with some subtle vanilla pod, fine cigar, workbench, polished wood, rustic impressions without being very massive, sparkling lemon juice, orange juice, grapefruit, dark chocolate, old burlap sacks, motors and motor oil, some honey, faint hints of French Brandy, some spicy herbs, very classy!
Finish Comment: Old Sherry casks with slightly burnt wood (spices), later some salted vegetables, marzipan, wood, some resin, Demarara sugar, leather, honey, strong rum raisins, some fruit liquors, 'Nusswasser', aftertaste of cake with motoroil in a musty cellar, smoked leather (cigar), some butter again, getting dry.

Nose Comment: Means an old Springbank. The basket of dried fruit, the exotic sweetness, the wax, the veil of smoke, the old wood, everything is there. Added notes of nuts, candied bitter orange peel, honey orange blossom, tiger balm ... It's simply superb greediness and complexity. Water subtly enhances peat.
Taste Comment: Powerful, the attack is expressed on surprising notes of oregano, then the wood is expressed on spices (nutmeg), and menthol, eucalyptus, as often these old malts. Fruit too, with lots of candied orange, mandarin. The smoke, although discreet, is still there and, like the nose, is reinforced by the addition of a drop of water.
Finish Comment: Medium in length, tannic, smoky and fruity, on orange, with a slightly sulphurous finish on black mushrooms.

Nose Comment: At the very beginning I have a slight peat in my nose, which later evaporates. Subtle fruit notes, rather reserved. He goes more in the "dirty", earthy direction, herbs like lovage, a little umami. The smell of a freshly opened sugar candy bowl. Sourdough bread, freshly baked and the sweetness of caramel.\nNo extreme nose, rather a bit shy ... but my experience tells me that these bottlings deliver even more in the mouth ...
Taste Comment: Hallelujah !!\nStart! Power! Everything that was previously hidden behind a curtain is now fully there.\nTogether with MARACUJA. Seldom had this special fruit on the palate. Paired with a herbal note, rather dried.
Finish Comment: In the finish, the passion fruit comes again, very long, very intense, the oak comes without any bitterness, green walnut and is dry at the end.

Nose Comment: Absolutely fantastic nose, by far the best quality of the whisky. Dried fruits and oak dominate; the lack of peat isn't terribly surprising given its age but still a little disappointing.
Taste Comment: Fruits again (cherries?), some sweetness from the Oloroso casks. This is where the total lack of peat is the most unfortunate. I know peat diminishes with age but even the 30 year still has a decent amount left. Taste has virtually none of the characteristics of a typical HP you'd expect. If you're thinking this is a more refined 30 or 25 year, it's not. As you can tell, I struggled quite a bit with this; it has wonderful complexity and depth but the difference from what I expected to what I got was tough to overcome. As I said above, it's basically an old GlenDronach.
Finish Comment: Very dry, which is surprising considering it's Oloroso; you'd think just from the finish that it was matured in PX. Definitely the least impressive part of the whisky. The finish lingers, but it's not exactly pleasant. The finish is the only time I even got some smoke, but still no peat.
document_text:

맛(Taste) [점수: 85.0]: Fruits again (cherries?), some sweetness from the Oloroso casks. This is where the total lack of peat is the most unfortunate. I know peat diminishes with age but even the 30 year still has a decent amount left. Taste has virtually none of the characteristics of a typical HP you'd expect. If you're thinking this is a more refined 30 or 25 year, it's not. As you can tell, I struggled quite a bit with this; it has wonderful complexity and depth but the difference from what I expected to what I got was tough to overcome. As I said above, it's basically an old GlenDronach.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 83.0]: Very dry, which is surprising considering it's Oloroso; you'd think just from the finish that it was matured in PX. Definitely the least impressive part of the whisky. The finish lingers, but it's not exactly pleasant. The finish is the only time I even got some smoke, but still no peat.

Taste Comment: Pomegranate, raisins, dates, apple syrup, tangerine, saffron, nutmeg, truffle butter, cream, marzipan, sweet tobacco, papaya, mango, milk chocolate, chestnut, sweet liquorice and beautiful malt, grapefruit, figs, chest wrapped in leather
Finish Comment: A touch of eucalyptus comes in nicely, a lot more oak, maybe a touch too much for me. My colleague loves it and thinks it's just right, chestnut, liquorice, malt, apple peel, long

Nose Comment: A lovely gentle peat layer. And also very fruity! Red apples, a sweet pink grapefruit. Raisins and some vanilla sweetness. Somewhat smoky. Menthol. And a herbal note. Beautiful nose! Full of flavours. It varies very much between the fruit and the peat. What makes it quite interesting.
Taste Comment: Very nice! This is quite thick. And what a lovely taste. The peat is here but in an elegant way. A briny note. Then red berries, apples and oranges. A faint hint of grapefruit. And there’s smoke in the background. Somewhat woody, but just a little bit. Some honey and menthol.
Finish Comment: A nice long finish with peat and menthol. A pinch of salt.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Caol Ila1968 GM
태그: Fresh Fruit

향(Nose): A lovely gentle peat layer. And also very fruity! Red apples, a sweet pink grapefruit. Raisins and some vanilla sweetness. Somewhat smoky. Menthol. And a herbal note. Beautiful nose! Full of flavours. It varies very much between the fruit and the peat. What makes it quite interesting.

맛(Taste): Very nice! This is quite thick. And what a lovely taste. The peat is here but in an elegant way. A briny note. Then red berries, apples and oranges. A faint hint of grapefruit. And there’s smoke in the background. Somewhat woody, but just a little bit. Some honey and menthol.

피니쉬(Finish): A nice long finish with peat and menthol. A pinch of salt.

Nose Comment:
Greatness of age, mastery of the blend and perfect balance that emerges. A slap.
Fruits, sherry, wood, floral, medicinal, everything is jostling. This dram wants to express itself and makes it known.
Quince, grape skin, strawberry, papaya, pineapple, mango, melon. A beautiful tropical variation delicate.
Good old and precious wood, rustic, lightly waxed is there to remind the age of the liquid. One feels in an old office frozen by time. Old dusty newspaper.
A little camphor is there without exceeding, to add a precious side.
A very light rose is there, with its almond paste.
Each puff is different. The flavors are turning, but each one is superb and balanced. Should we really drink it? The fear of falling back on earth is there.
Taste Comment:
Sirupeux, and once again only one word comes: Balance.
Precious wood is always there and is softer than ever in its wax and dust.
A more tertiary side, under wood and tobacco, makes its appearance.
The fruits are always of the part not worry but a little more cooked than at the nose.
A little black pepper and liquorice.
A hair less complex than the nose but still a work of goldsmith.
Finish Comment: The finish is sweet, long, camphorated, on cognac and chocolate truffle, black pepper, mint. Slightly astringent but fresh.\nThe empty glass smells of mandarin peel.
document_text:

Good old and precious wood, rustic, lightly waxed is there to remind the age of the liquid. One feels in an old office frozen by time. Old dusty newspaper.
A little camphor is there without exceeding, to add a precious side.
A very light rose is there, with its almond paste.
Each puff is different. The flavors are turning, but each one is superb and balanced. Should we really drink it? The fear of falling back on earth is there.

맛(Taste): Sirupeux, and once again only one word comes: Balance.
Precious wood is always there and is softer than ever in its wax and dust.
A more tertiary side, under wood and tobacco, makes its appearance.
The fruits are always of the part not worry but a little more cooked than at the nose.
A little black pepper and liquorice.
A hair less complex than the nose but still a work of goldsmith.

피니쉬(Finish): The finish is sweet, long, camphorated, on cognac and chocolate truffle, black pepper, mint. Slightly astringent but fresh.
The empty glass smells of mandarin peel.

Nose Comment:
Honey and fruit, mainly yellow plumb, mango and a little melon.
Furniture polish, possibly a little salt and then a nice treacle note.
After a few minutes some there is some honeycomb and faint hints of orange and finally hot buttered toast.
If the palate lives up to the nose this will be good, here's hoping.
Taste Comment: Not sure what to think to be honest , there is some lovely fruit but it is a little tame.\nThere is a creamy mouthfeel and also a little spice which lifts it, hints of pineapple and mango and sweet yellow plums.\nThere is a little honey but nowhere near what the nose hinted at.
Finish Comment: Decent length considering only 43%, remains creamy until the end with a little spice on the tail.

Nose Comment: Ahhh.... delicious stuff... how do I know this would be so chuggable without even nosing it haha. Everything right with the world, despite omicron being a little bitch.
Taste Comment: Not super sherried, so must be mostly refill sherry or a mix with ex-bourbon. This is a wonderful bottling imported to the USA close to the time of the more famous 57.4% from 1974. While this 43% is definitely not as exciting, it stands proud with its fruits, minerality, and herbaceousness. It is definitely chuggable, but oh... I wish I have enough money to chug this all night long.... On another note, I am drinking this sample from riekio during a NYC wintry night, and so, scores are usually less a point due to the temperature.
Finish Comment: Probably shouldn't have diluted to 43%... the finish is not long.

Finish Comment: Longer than I was expecting and the dryness seems to disappear replaced by a really nice fruity sherry.

Nose Comment: Just superb, nothing out of place, apple, mango, peach and a little lemon zest but truck loads of syrup and toffee also.
Taste Comment: So rich, so fruity, the mango and peach notes dance on your tongue but heavier syrup notes peg that back with hints of peat.\nThe fruit aspect increases, as does the peat and various spices and if you leave it in your mouth long enough it is just like an alcoholic fruit cocktail.\nStunning, fruit and syrup, it is like the best desert in the world.
Finish Comment: Endless, remaining fruity till the end with the distant peat and peach refusing to go away.\nFruit cocktail in a glass.

Nose Comment:
A superb nose on camphor sherry.
Plum, fig, pecan nut, toasted almond.
Demerara rum, rancio, brown sugar, old cognac. Truly a perfect mix.
A nice camphor freshness.
Fairly dry woodiness, with pepper, cardamom, raw leather.
We smell the alcohol, but without excess.
Taste Comment: On the palate, the fruit is more vibrant, with plum, cherry, strawberry. Always dates.\nWe have more wood than on the nose, more astringent, with varnish, leather, pepper, cinnamon, cocoa powder.\nLight ginger.
Finish Comment: Very woody finish, with pepper, cinnamon, slight potpourri, coconut.\nStill a nice fruitiness, a little crushed however.\ndrying.

Nose Comment: Dusty dunnage warehouse. Surprisingly tropical.m Blood orange. Deep, delicate, but heavy in weight.
Taste Comment: Slightly oily wood with a ton of wall polish dust. Spices have not completely faded away. Subtle nutty fruits peaking behind the layer of oak. Mango, dried pineapple chunks, red apples. A subtle touch of burning tobacco smoke. Worn leather. Flavourful but thinner in weight.
Finish Comment: Medium, dry finish. Oak has almost completely taken over by this stage, although the distillate is well wrapped within. Cinnamon sticks. A touch of menthol comes back up from the throat. The subtlest hint of smoke in the glass even after 20 minutes. Gorgeous.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Mortlach1936 GM
태그: Cooked Fruit,Leafy

향(Nose): Dusty dunnage warehouse. Surprisingly tropical.m Blood orange. Deep, delicate, but heavy in weight.

맛(Taste): Slightly oily wood with a ton of wall polish dust. Spices have not completely faded away. Subtle nutty fruits peaking behind the layer of oak. Mango, dried pineapple chunks, red apples. A subtle touch of burning tobacco smoke. Worn leather. Flavourful but thinner in weight.

피니쉬(Finish): Medium, dry finish. Oak has almost completely taken over by this stage, although the distillate is well wrapped within. Cinnamon sticks. A touch of menthol comes back up from the throat. The subtlest hint of smoke in the glass even after 20 minutes. Gorgeous.

Nose Comment: The distillery character is recognizable from the beginning very well. Old furniture meets wet moss, cider, cinnamon and vanilla. Then leather, green tea and cedar wood emerge. The smoke is much more discreet than today's Ardbegs, of course, the long maturation time plays a role.\nAfter a while, the cider and leather become stronger and stronger.
Taste Comment: The texture is wonderfully oily. The first flavors are salt and dark chocolate. Mint and liquorice lurk behind it. The ash-like smoke is almost gone, it tastes very tender.
Finish Comment: Despite the low alcohol, the finish is relatively long. Licorice and some soot dominate.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Ardbeg1963 GM
태그: Chocolate,Fresh Fruit,Leathery,Mossy,Vanilla,Vegetative

향(Nose): The distillery character is recognizable from the beginning very well. Old furniture meets wet moss, cider, cinnamon and vanilla. Then leather, green tea and cedar wood emerge. The smoke is much more discreet than today's Ardbegs, of course, the long maturation time plays a role.\nAfter a while, the cider and leather become stronger and stronger.

맛(Taste): The texture is wonderfully oily. The first flavors are salt and dark chocolate. Mint and liquorice lurk behind it. The ash-like smoke is almost gone, it tastes very tender.

피니쉬(Finish): Despite the low alcohol, the finish is relatively long. Licorice and some soot dominate.

Nose Comment: Wow, this one is not shy - full and intense - honey comb, cooked and dried fruits galore, apricots, blood oranges, mango, passion fruit, spices, cloves, hints of nutmeg and cinnamon - very complex and superb!
Taste Comment: Punchy, oily, sirupy, good sweetness, huge fruitiness, cooked and dried fruits rather than fresh fruits, jam, finest sherry wood, all kinds of spices, good acidity, probably also some citrus fruits - fantastic!
Finish Comment: Long and warm, more fruity, more fine sherry wood, more, more, more... - just excellent!

맛(Taste) [점수: 99.0]: Punchy, oily, sirupy, good sweetness, huge fruitiness, cooked and dried fruits rather than fresh fruits, jam, finest sherry wood, all kinds of spices, good acidity, probably also some citrus fruits - fantastic!

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 97.0]: Long and warm, more fruity, more fine sherry wood, more, more, more... - just excellent!

Nose Comment: Tianya Lu, springbon! This explosive sweetness is definitely not a high-year bourbon? Popcorn, cantaloupe, jackfruit and other tropical fruits, melon seed crisp, white magnolia, condensed milk, coconut milk, very slight latex paint. The scent of aging oil is strong, showing the characteristics of Yunding, peat and kerosene, licorice, meat, chalk gray, and the sea and white shells can be distinguished faintly.\nThere is no doubt that the barrel nature overwhelms the winery genes, but this Shirley barrel is also strange. It does not introduce any dark fruit/jam, but it is like a toasted virgin oak, with a loss of complexity.
Taste Comment: The body of the wine can no longer bear such a high age, the flash of astringency, honey, melon, lime, tar, fennel, black pepper, peat, ginger, tobacco. Except for the peat, the rest was eaten by Angel.\nGenerally, the fat is fair, sweet, no acid, no tannins, no astringency, a little bitterness, no spicy feeling.
Finish Comment: Shorter, toffee, vanilla.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Springbank1968 IM

향(Nose): Tianya Lu, springbon! This explosive sweetness is definitely not a high-year bourbon? Popcorn, cantaloupe, jackfruit and other tropical fruits, melon seed crisp, white magnolia, condensed milk, coconut milk, very slight latex paint. The scent of aging oil is strong, showing the characteristics of Yunding, peat and kerosene, licorice, meat, chalk gray, and the sea and white shells can be distinguished faintly.\nThere is no doubt that the barrel nature overwhelms the winery genes, but this Shirley barrel is also strange. It does not introduce any dark fruit/jam, but it is like a toasted virgin oak, with a loss of complexity.

맛(Taste): The body of the wine can no longer bear such a high age, the flash of astringency, honey, melon, lime, tar, fennel, black pepper, peat, ginger, tobacco. Except for the peat, the rest was eaten by Angel.\nGenerally, the fat is fair, sweet, no acid, no tannins, no astringency, a little bitterness, no spicy feeling.

피니쉬(Finish): Shorter, toffee, vanilla.

Nose Comment: Ink pots, dried medicinal herbs, old house floors, furniture museums, rice paper inkstones, Huoxiangzhengqi syrup, street dry goods with a firework flavor, puff pastry, cut cakes, and old-fashioned gas stoves. 95
Taste Comment: Sweet, woody and chewy, yet layered, the old-fashioned sherry's sweetness is intense and full. Medicinal syrup, rotten bananas, heavy caramel bitter brown sugar, Moxiang, Huoxiang Zhengqi little sweet water, extremely heavy sherry sweetness with nutty bitterness, ending with extremely strong peat, rancio at first glance. The wine is dry and woody, full of flavours, but not scratchy, but rather bouncy like a cognac. p93b96
Finish Comment: Sweet and full of ashes, with just a touch of bitterness, perfect for a narrow-minded drinker like me. 96

Nose Comment:
Indispensable to leave this Bowmore at least 30 minutes so that it begins to show all its complexity.
A bomb of lemon, citrus, papaya, passion fruit. Pineapple crystallized.
Wood, currants. Sureau. Engine oil.
Very fresh, young. A little bit of dust, but much less than in the 10yo Prestonfield bottled in the same years.
With aeration a little smoke and peat appear but are very integrated with the fruit.
Taste Comment: On the palate it's oily, milky.\nPeat is more present but still integrated.\nWe have honey, always lemon, grapefruit, zest. Passion fruit, mango (danao). White flower. It's sweet.
Finish Comment: Sweet finish on the camphorated fruit, a slight smoke and pepper.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Bowmore1972
태그: Dried Fruit,Sherried

향(Nose) [점수: 92.0]: Indispensable to leave this Bowmore at least 30 minutes so that it begins to show all its complexity.\nA bomb of lemon, citrus, papaya, passion fruit. Pineapple crystallized.\nWood, currants. Sureau. Engine oil.\nVery fresh, young. A little bit of dust, but much less than in the 10yo Prestonfield bottled in the same years.\nWith aeration a little smoke and peat appear but are very integrated with the fruit.

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: On the palate it's oily, milky.\nPeat is more present but still integrated.\nWe have honey, always lemon, grapefruit, zest. Passion fruit, mango (danao). White flower. It's sweet.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: Sweet finish on the camphorated fruit, a slight smoke and pepper.

Nose Comment: The colour is burnished and the nose offers an excellent old-style sherry maturation without any flaw. This is complexity and harmony at its best, both all the fine 'farclas malt's and fino sherry's aromas are present and all combine to an impressive nose I could sniff for hours. There some tasty OBF's too, oh - how I adore these! The wood is perfect and neither too strong nor too weak. After some breathing this nose grows even more spectacular so take your time with this dram. And use a big spherical blender's glass for nosing, if available.
Taste Comment: The taste is multi-layered on dozens of different flavours in a superb mix. They can be perfectly explored while chewing the dram for some time, and they march across my taste buds in a victory parade. All starts with fruits and honeys but the bitter-spicy flavours join in quickly and ensure the balance of the profile. Again I do not find any flaw, all is close to perfection. Even the wood is okay for such a long maturation (strong but not over-powering).
Finish Comment: The initial mouthfeel is warming and coating (but not I expected more in this respect, to be honest) without distracting moments. The finish is medium to long and adds more spicy wooden notes without turning bitter or astringent until the very end. The chocolatey impressions get even more tasty after the dram went down my throat, I like that. Water unlocks additional waxy-chalky aromas in the nose and the taste turns more to the bitter side of the profile, I prefer this dram neat.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenfarclas1966 Fino Casks
태그: Chocolate,Citric,Cooked Fruit,Dried Fruit,Honey,Leathery,Malt Extract,New Wood,Nutty,Oily,Sherried,Solvent,Tobacco

Nose Comment: A proper amount of sandalwood with a touch of menthol, as well as warming spices such as cinnamon. There’s a whiff of beeswax and furniture polish, accompanied by triple sec and pickled lemon peel. Finally a faint note of stewed pears, and caramel glazed red apple. A drop of water brings out a hint of pralines.
Taste Comment: Nice creamy, oily mouthfeel. Very rich and mouth-watering. A sugary sweet arrival, with a good amount of old wood. Maybe a little too much? Cloves and nutmeg surface, as does a touch of aniseed, and orange marmalade as well. Water brings out cinnamon as well.
Finish Comment: A whiff of smoke, lingering oak and orchard fruits. Medium in length.

Finish Comment: Bottled at 43% and probably lower now. Finish is short.

Nose Comment: Not what I was expecting to be honest, I can  smell the wine from the finish, this is like a light sherried whisky in smell but much darker in colour.\nThere is the usual dark fruit combo but also apple crumble mixed with biscuit, honey, there are also some nice toffee notes and hints of ginger and other spices.\nA nice nose but I am not one for wine finishes generally and wine notes detract in my view from the overall nosing experience but I am being a bit harsh because it is still a good nosing whisky.
Taste Comment:
Good mouthfeel but like the nose the wine finish does not gel with everything else that is going on and there is some oak/tannins on show but at 42 years old that is hardly surprising?
It seems to get lighter on the palate for a few seconds then there is a wave of spices which really liven things up in a good way.
A little cream, honey, caramel, hints of apple, yellow plum and very faint hints of apricot.
Finally the oak returns but it is manageable, luckily.
Finish Comment: Long, spicy and a little drying but it remains sweet.\nWith Water:-\nOn the nose there is a little more fruit and some wood varnish notes now, but the few drops of water have released much more fruit yet it has become a little unbalanced so only a few drops of water at most.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glenglassaugh1972
태그: Citric,Cooked Vegetable

향(Nose): Not what I was expecting to be honest, I can  smell the wine from the finish, this is like a light sherried whisky in smell but much darker in colour.\nThere is the usual dark fruit combo but also apple crumble mixed with biscuit, honey, there are also some nice toffee notes and hints of ginger and other spices.\nA nice nose but I am not one for wine finishes generally and wine notes detract in my view from the overall nosing experience but I am being a bit harsh because it is still a good nosing whisky.

맛(Taste): Good mouthfeel but like the nose the wine finish does not gel with everything else that is going on and there is some oak/tannins on show but at 42 years old that is hardly surprising?\nIt seems to get lighter on the palate for a few seconds then there is a wave of spices which really liven things up in a good way.\nA little cream, honey, caramel, hints of apple, yellow plum and very faint hints of apricot.\nFinally the oak returns but it is manageable, luckily.

피니쉬(Finish): Long, spicy and a little drying but it remains sweet.\nWith Water:-\nOn the nose there is a little more fruit and some wood varnish notes now, but the few drops of water have released much more fruit yet it has become a little unbalanced so only a few drops of water at most.

Nose Comment:
A rather woody nose for a Springbank from this decade in simple "oak". Probably a nice percentage of sherry goes into the blend.
We also have a superb fruitiness, with a light mango, papaya, passion fruit, muscat grapes.
Light grape seed, liquorice, anise and cloves, mixed with the wood, which gives a slight bitterness.
A little engine oil, from an old, slightly metallic oil lamp.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth, everything collapses at the first sip.
Dust, metallic, wet cardboard. It's kinda killed by OBE and reduction.
The fruit is nevertheless there, very light, in the background, exotic at will.
We guess a superb milk chocolate, beautiful Christmas spices.
The melt is divine, and it's slightly creamy.
You really have to take a big sip to enjoy it.
Finish Comment: The finish is long in the mouth, with a very nice papaya, mango, passion fruit, milk chocolate, and mint cream.\nHere too, we smell the OBE a lot, but luckily, the aromas pierce and stay in the mouth.

Nose Comment: Malt-covered old wooden boards, cherry-infused sherry, old earthy warehouse, nutty malt (not too heavy), toffee, citrus, orange, prunes, powerful honey develops after a while, fruity liquorice, wonderful wood spices, heavy wood after some time so heavy you want to chew it (in a pleasant way), chocolate, some high quality cognac, grapefruit covered with syrup, unburnt peat, really nice tannins, apple cake.
Taste Comment: Nutty sherry, old oak, sweet grapefruity tannins, cream, tobacco, tropical fruits interchanging over time, really mouthcoating, boiled candy.
Finish Comment: Long. Nutty sherry, sweet grapefruity tannins, tobacco,herbs and sherry spices, honey in the background, malty throughout.

Nose Comment: sweet, delicate, but promising beautiful things. Here we are clearly in a fruity register: cherry clafoutis, plum jam, apricot crumble, candied oranges. These notes of fruit are dense and marry wonderfully with a more pastry side including dark chocolate, cinnamon, a touch of crème fraiche, almond cream, nuts and coffee. This Strathisla 1967 also offers fresh notes of mint, eucalyptus, lemon, anise or even thyme. Enchanting.
Taste Comment: the texture is surprisingly light. The aromas are melted in the most beautiful of ways. Here we have an ultra coherent dram where everything is in its place. The flavors are growing. We find here notes of plums, apricots and candied oranges, notes of dark chocolate, almond cream, walnut cake, a hint of coffee, custard, cinnamon . The notes of mint, anise and lemon prevent this cake from being disgusting. It is gourmet and delicate like a fine pastry.
Finish Comment: a beautiful freshness. The wood did its job for 48 years and yet it would be almost forgotten here. The aromas are melted and intense but it lacks a little length in the mouth. I wish that this Strathisla 1967 had a few more horses under the hood. Anyway, it remains beautiful with aromas of coffee, chocolate and fruit compote of a beautiful intensity.

The notes of mint, anise and lemon prevent this cake from being disgusting. It is gourmet and delicate like a fine pastry.

Nose Comment: Alcohol perfectly mastered, no varnish, no solvent, no sulfur, it starts well :)  The nose begins with coffee, chocolate and then evolves towards figs and overripe bananas.  A light, very light smoked in the background and nice leathery notes.  On the 2nd nose this Karuizawa is almost minty and more spicy.  The addition of water brings out the smoke and the hints of old leather.
Taste Comment: Alcohol is also controlled in the mouth.  A woody present but not excessive despite its age, brings a nice structure in the mouth.  Sherry is more present than the nose with oranges, chocolate and vinous notes.  The mouth is less sexy and complex than the nose, too bad.  The addition of water is good, the fruity notes are more present with the black fruit jam.
Finish Comment: Long finish, on the fruit, sherry and smoky notes
document_text:

향(Nose): Alcohol perfectly mastered, no varnish, no solvent, no sulfur, it starts well :)  The nose begins with coffee, chocolate and then evolves towards figs and overripe bananas.  A light, very light smoked in the background and nice leathery notes.  On the 2nd nose this Karuizawa is almost minty and more spicy.  The addition of water brings out the smoke and the hints of old leather.

맛(Taste): Alcohol is also controlled in the mouth.  A woody present but not excessive despite its age, brings a nice structure in the mouth.  Sherry is more present than the nose with oranges, chocolate and vinous notes.  The mouth is less sexy and complex than the nose, too bad.  The addition of water is good, the fruity notes are more present with the black fruit jam.

피니쉬(Finish): Long finish, on the fruit, sherry and smoky notes

Nose Comment: Very intense and rich nose. A subtle whiff of peat, earthy, salty, sea breeze, fruity. Organic, 'green'. Tobacco. Quite some alcohol, ripe apples. Later on more smoke. Furniture polish. Some hay.
Taste Comment: Sal ammoniac initially, pepper. Smoke, subtle peat, fruits, ripe fruits, citrus, orange. Ashy. Salty, maritime. Very full body. Thick, creamy, smooth with a sparkling feeling on the tongue, great experience.
Finish Comment: Still powerful, tobacco, ripe fruits, salty, that subtle peat again. A whiff of smoke, long finish. Fruity, ripe fruits. Still sparkling. Some tobacco lingers for a long time.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Port Ellen1976 SV

향(Nose) [점수: 92.0]: Very intense and rich nose. A subtle whiff of peat, earthy, salty, sea breeze, fruity. Organic, 'green'. Tobacco. Quite some alcohol, ripe apples. Later on more smoke. Furniture polish. Some hay.

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: Sal ammoniac initially, pepper. Smoke, subtle peat, fruits, ripe fruits, citrus, orange. Ashy. Salty, maritime. Very full body. Thick, creamy, smooth with a sparkling feeling on the tongue, great experience.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: Still powerful, tobacco, ripe fruits, salty, that subtle peat again. A whiff of smoke, long finish. Fruity, ripe fruits. Still sparkling. Some tobacco lingers for a long time.

Nose Comment: Elegance personified. Waxy with soft notes of fresh tobacco, dunnage warehouses, sandalwood and forest floor. But there’s a healthy dose of fruits too, led by oranges, pomelo and tangerines, but also some stone fruits. There’s even a touch of strawberry syrup, yet it’s not a fruit bomb either. There are whiffs of moss and heather, as well as kelp and just a few peaty phenols sprinkled on top.
Taste Comment: Old Talisker is just… Let me try and describe this experience. The mouthfeel is moderately waxy. It arrives on gentle medicinal peat, menthol and a pinch of white pepper, but there are also notes of liquorice root, driftwood and fennel. To balance things, there’s a toffee sweetness, a decent salinity and a citrus-y freshness.
Finish Comment: Long. The pepper builds and lingers for a long time. It’s brine-y, somewhat coastal.
document_text:

향(Nose): Elegance personified. Waxy with soft notes of fresh tobacco, dunnage warehouses, sandalwood and forest floor. But there’s a healthy dose of fruits too, led by oranges, pomelo and tangerines, but also some stone fruits. There’s even a touch of strawberry syrup, yet it’s not a fruit bomb either. There are whiffs of moss and heather, as well as kelp and just a few peaty phenols sprinkled on top.

맛(Taste): Old Talisker is just… Let me try and describe this experience. The mouthfeel is moderately waxy. It arrives on gentle medicinal peat, menthol and a pinch of white pepper, but there are also notes of liquorice root, driftwood and fennel. To balance things, there’s a toffee sweetness, a decent salinity and a citrus-y freshness.

피니쉬(Finish): Long. The pepper builds and lingers for a long time. It’s brine-y, somewhat coastal.

Nose Comment: Superb nose. We have a very pretty fine and silky peat, which surrounds a very beautiful exoticism. Passion fruit, papaya, cranberry, lemon, orange zest.\nCamphor, eucalyptus, a beautiful freshness.\nOld warehouse, motor oil.
Taste Comment: We continue with a nice dose of fruit. The peat becomes more discreet, even if it is present and oily.\nBlood orange, pomegranate, persimmon, lemon. Papaya.\nCold ash, black pepper, camphor.
Finish Comment: Soft and tender finish on cold peat, ash, tobacco, dried herbs. Citrus and pepper.

맛(Taste) [점수: 92.0]: We continue with a nice dose of fruit. The peat becomes more discreet, even if it is present and oily.\nBlood orange, pomegranate, persimmon, lemon. Papaya.\nCold ash, black pepper, camphor.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Soft and tender finish on cold peat, ash, tobacco, dried herbs. Citrus and pepper.

Nose Comment: Sherry and matured oak in excellent proportions. Sweet and sour citruses. Pleasant.
Taste Comment: Strong, creamy. The sherry is in the background now, the oak is well matured, not too sour or tannic. Mixed fruit palinka and marzipan. Cinnamon, star anise, vanilla.
Finish Comment: Long, soft. Oak and fruits.

Nose Comment: Mineral and maritime with a note of sherry and sweet lemon.
Taste Comment: Again, subtle, sweet salty, mineral, chiselled freshness, with just a bit more grilled caramel ‘oomph’ than the similarly luscious Berry Bros 21YO (Whiskybase ID: WB90386).
Finish Comment: Medium and warm with a dash of coffee cream.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Talisker1972 BR

향(Nose): Mineral and maritime with a note of sherry and sweet lemon.

맛(Taste): Again, subtle, sweet salty, mineral, chiselled freshness, with just a bit more grilled caramel ‘oomph’ than the similarly luscious Berry Bros 21YO (Whiskybase ID: WB90386).

피니쉬(Finish): Medium and warm with a dash of coffee cream.

Nose Comment: Tobacco leafs, cherries and some honey. Earl grey tea, almond milk, chocolate. Then we go towards floral tones and blueberries. Everything covered with a perfect thin honey layer.
Taste Comment: Wood notes are speaking here, then towards fruit syrup. Developing into very sweet tinned pineapple and honey melon. Then we head over to coffee and dark chocolate. Followed by some spices and cloves. There is a bitter aspect to this whisky, which I have not tasted before.
Finish Comment: Tobacco and some smoke which is a pleasant surprise. There is a slight metallic edge, but I can’t really define where this is coming from. Then sweet fruits ending into a somewhat dry finish.
document_text:

향(Nose): Tobacco leafs, cherries and some honey. Earl grey tea, almond milk, chocolate. Then we go towards floral tones and blueberries. Everything covered with a perfect thin honey layer.

맛(Taste): Wood notes are speaking here, then towards fruit syrup. Developing into very sweet tinned pineapple and honey melon. Then we head over to coffee and dark chocolate. Followed by some spices and cloves. There is a bitter aspect to this whisky, which I have not tasted before.

피니쉬(Finish): Tobacco and some smoke which is a pleasant surprise. There is a slight metallic edge, but I can’t really define where this is coming from. Then sweet fruits ending into a somewhat dry finish.

Nose Comment: Very round and ironed smoothly for a Mortlach (also others still older), light too, a lot of toffee and honey, a lot of very smooth and noble, glazed oak, peach jam, marzipan, honeydew melon, a hint of clove, mushy pears, some raspberries, nougat, cardamom
Taste Comment: Raspberry, peach, chalk like another Mortlach that day, but the fleshy one is from Mortlach, cranberries, roasted malt, butter, pear, heather grass, cardamom, red apple, clove, cinnamon, marzipan
Finish Comment: Net melon, red apple, nutmeg, medium to long

Nose Comment: Dust, subtle oily, honey, honeydew melon, fruity and strong, pineapple as the center, with a little turpentine, lemon, green apple, lime, guava, guava, and the wood is much more active than the American version , while the distinctiveness of wine characteristics is slightly weaker.
Taste Comment: The oil is weaker, but the fruity taste is condensed and the concentration is higher. Refined lime, pineapple juice, sugar cane, mint, with acidity as the main axis, the flavor is smooth, due to the lack of oil, the end of the tea is exposed, and the bitter wood is exposed. p92b90
Finish Comment: Bitter wood, Western medicine tablets, slightly regrettable, more bitter.

Nose Comment:
well that smells awesome. I call that a wonderful experience.
Has something of a very old brandy in the very first moment, which then quickly disappears again and reveals a completely new profile. intense dark dried fruits, raisins, dates. Then the fresh fruits come through that would be there, peaches, cherries. This is followed by tropical fruits such as mango and bananas.
And again he changes the profile.
Now I have notes of grandma's old oak kitchen furniture, aged leather, furniture polish, dark honey, caramel and dark chocolate. I don't want to stop smelling it, but I have to try how it tastes.
Taste Comment: Wonderful start, grandma's old kitchen furniture again, furniture polish, leather, chocolate, dried fruit, raisins, peaches, cherries, honey, wax, creamy, very complex and voluminous.
Finish Comment: Here, leather and light clove notes dominate at first, before the notes of old oak penetrate. The fruity notes are still present here, but they stay more in the background and let the barrel take precedence.
document_text:

I call that a wonderful experience.\nHas something of a very old brandy in the very first moment, which then quickly disappears again and reveals a completely new profile. intense dark dried fruits, raisins, dates. Then the fresh fruits come through that would be there, peaches, cherries. This is followed by tropical fruits such as mango and bananas.\nAnd again he changes the profile.\nNow I have notes of grandma's old oak kitchen furniture, aged leather, furniture polish, dark honey, caramel and dark chocolate. I don't want to stop smelling it, but I have to try how it tastes.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: Here, leather and light clove notes dominate at first, before the notes of old oak penetrate. The fruity notes are still present here, but they stay more in the background and let the barrel take precedence.

Nose Comment: An unexpectedly fragile but elegant nose is my first impression.\nA fruity, meaty sherry, with some peat and garage workshop notes of oil and petrol, not much but it is there.\nI wonder if this is one of those dusty old sherries?
Taste Comment: A potent creamy sherry with some peat and yes it is rather mineral and just a little dirty, i like it.\nit gets sweeter as you go on and lots of juicy berry notes, sweet pastries.\nGreat balance, top drawer stuff
Finish Comment: Lovely sweet finish, hints of peat, so juicy.

Nose Comment: A soft, charming, balanced, subdued and sweet whisky with notes of earthy peat, soft smoke, oak, leather, salt, charcoal, moss, citrus (lemon peel), seaweed, soft medicinal, floral notes (heather?), Wet hay, grains, barley malt, soft mineral notes (flint and lime), honey, hint to toffee, bay leaves and a hint to liquorice.
Taste Comment: An elegant, subdued, well-balanced and soft whisky with notes of flint, citrus, soft smoke, peat, hint of seaweed, straw, leather, oak, tannin, salt, subtle medicinal, dried grass, brown sugar, toffee, botanical, nuts , dried lemon, candied lemon zest and floral notes.
Finish Comment: A long and rich aftertaste with notes of soft smoke, leather, peat, earthy notes, firs, hint of star anise, vanilla, nuts, tannin and bitter caramel.

피니쉬(Finish): A long and rich aftertaste with notes of soft smoke, leather, peat, earthy notes, firs, hint of star anise, vanilla, nuts, tannin and bitter caramel.

Nose Comment:
Delicate nose, far from the exotic aggressiveness of some 1976s.
Very scalable, let it air out.
Very fresh at first, with a nice here of mint and pepper.
Then a magical whiff of pomegranate. Black Grappe.
Zest of lemon, orange. Then the flesh of the orange.
Then we evolve on the exotic, the passion fruit, the mango.
What an evolution!
We follow with pineapple, wood, heather honey.
Taste Comment: In the mouth it is more classic, even if very very good.\nExoticism, passion fruit, guava, pineapple.\nHoney, spices, wood. Salt and spray. It is very oily.
Finish Comment: Exuberant finish on exotic fruits.\nPassion fruit above all, then mango.\nBlack pepper. A real fruit salad.

Nose Comment: A slightly austere nose, with light peat, hay and smoke.\nCamphor, eye drops, a little polish.\nCooked apple skin, papaya, granulated sugar.
Taste Comment: In the mouth, we start with a delicate smoke, then we increase in power in the farm register.\nHay, undergrowth, salt water, peat, dry wood.\nWe always have a bit of apple, with camphor.
Finish Comment: Final on very good pepper, farmhouse peat, smoke, lemon zest, granulated sugar and camphor.\nEndless, especially for 46%.

Nose Comment: Very complex and rich; big sherry, big age, big character but ever so elegant. Oak polish, leather, cedar wood cigar boxes show the age of this in a beautiful way. Then the sweet sherry takes hold and we get a complex and rich combination of chocolate orange, blackcurrant marmalade, butterscotch, prunes, raisin, roasted coffee and molasses. Then it’s on to the spices, with pepper and some tobacco.
Taste Comment: Rich and intense and typical Glenfarclas. Dried fruits, chocolate raisins, dates, figs, orange peel, all the big sherry flavours are present. Then spices and thick espresso coffee as well as some of the marmelade again.
Finish Comment: Finish is long and rich, with oak of course, but also some chocolate, walnut and almond. Drying, but never gets to dry or tannic. Magnificent stuff. I could just smell this all day without even drinking it.

피니쉬(Finish): Finish is long and rich, with oak of course, but also some chocolate, walnut and almond. Drying, but never gets to dry or tannic. Magnificent stuff. I could just smell this all day without even drinking it.

Musk.

Nose Comment:
We are on a farm on the Wadden Sea, rain has just made the hay wet, the stable is being scrubbed and spicy bread is being baked in the clay oven...
So the smoke is reminiscent of the best that old Longrow + Laphroaig could do, but surpasses it.
Here everything is constantly in flux, underlying fruit aromas of flat peaches and apricots with beeswax always come through from the bitter salt air. I've been sniffing for half an hour and new delicacies keep coming, after the lushly scented yellow summer flowers there's now also Springerle (Christmas pastries with anise) and limoncello. Dried heather is thrown into the fire to round things off.
Overall, a superb, autumnal (in 2020 also summery) nose.
Taste Comment: Immediately immensely oily, with a slightly peppery accent, which reflects the 'farm notes' very well and continues towards ripe lemon slices from the grill, sugared grapefruit and sweet clay (is there such a thing? Now!)\nSour without being sour, tart without being bitter, and that with the other iridescent flavor nuances is great.
Finish Comment: It's fantastic how long the spicy oil film glides down the throat and how consistent the flavors remain. I continue to enjoy it for a while, and the empty glass gives as much pleasure to sniff as other malts don't in a full one!

I've been sniffing for half an hour and new delicacies keep coming, after the lushly scented yellow summer flowers there's now also Springerle (Christmas pastries with anise) and limoncello. Dried heather is thrown into the fire to round things off.\nOverall, a superb, autumnal (in 2020 also summery) nose.

Now!)\nSour without being sour, tart without being bitter, and that with the other iridescent flavor nuances is great.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: It's fantastic how long the spicy oil film glides down the throat and how consistent the flavors remain. I continue to enjoy it for a while, and the empty glass gives as much pleasure to sniff as other malts don't in a full one!

Nose Comment: Immediately I have to think of glowing coals, it is barely noticeable alcohol. Juicy fruits that are slowly boiled in a pot. Something burned is there. Then come spicy herbs, which I can not specify, along with earthy notes. Salty sea air and dune grass. All this is very complex and interwoven.
Taste Comment: Mighty alcohol presses on the tongue. After an initial sharpness, however, the whisky immediately becomes wonderfully sweet. Then comes smoke and fruit, juicy peaches or apricots, slightly overripe. The second sip of alcohol is more restrained, but the entire mouth glows pleasantly, wood smoke. Mild oak and milk chocolate. With each sip, the whisky becomes sweeter and the fruits darker. The sherry keg is not hiding, but it does not dominate either.
Finish Comment: The throat tingles and glowing, the whisky slides down his throat. From the milk chocolate is slowly bittersweet with sea salt. A hint of oranges (or are that again the apricots) sounds like. How long can a finish be? He stays longer than I can wait until the next sip

Nose Comment: Creamy caramel and intense amber shine in the Premium Snifter, a multitude of syrup-like "legs" are released from the streaks adhering to the glass wall. Creamy hazelnuts and almonds dominate the first impression with minimal toasted aromas, raisins and other dried fruits combine with toffee and sugar candy, mandarins fall into creamy honey, grated soft milk chocolate falls on pieces of apricot and whole coffee beans. Hints of dried tobacco leaves, opened humidor and cedar wood seduce the nose. Minimal smoky notes are released from finely spicy wood tones, the peeling of orange peel ends in old mint and hints of eucalyptus. The nose is wonderfully balanced, multi-layered and beguiling with its old and solid style. Do I smell a hint of wet leather? I could spend hours on this wonderful nose!
Taste Comment: The first sip flows mildly and spicy on the tongue, raisins combine with a hint of tobacco and rubbing off oranges, creamy toffee and chocolate drip from the tongue, increasing sharpness stimulates the saliva, oranges and mandarins are added. A hint of sour grapefruit dissolves from creamy wood tones, a handful of hazelnuts roll into liquid toffee, minimally sweet raisins show up. A wonderfully gentle hint of sweetish tobacco, hints of smoky wood and old leather exude their old and solid aroma, gently melted toffee and caramel on the tongue, milk chocolate melts in the mouth. The mouthfeel is incredibly soft and creamy, the stimulated saliva sloshes through the jaw, minimally there is mint and menthol freshness. In the background there is an old and spicy wood note ...
Finish Comment: Creamy hazelnut and toffee stick on the palate, zests of oranges play with grapefruit and tobacco. Hints of smoke and steamed oak, hazelnuts end in wet leaves and tart citrus fruits. The sometimes bitter flavors rest for a long time, from time to time oranges and grapefruit, as well as toffee and tobacco, appear.

Taste Comment: Quite salty, with whispers of peat smoke and seaweed. Wet rocks too. Some chargrilled lemons and grapefruit, as well as black pepper, ginger and chalk. A good amount of leather. Fairly different from the nose, I'd say.
Finish Comment: Lingering spiciness, some menthol. A tad dry.

향(Nose): Dark orange marmalade, apricots and mixed peel. Cocoa, coffee grounds and a hint of suntan oil. Creosote, TCP and incense, then a blast of salt and lapsang suchong tea.

맛(Taste): Rich marmalade covered in ash. Seville oranges and gentle spices that birst softly on the palate. Lovely.

Nose Comment: The nose exceeds my expectation. Great. What barrels !? Baked apple now, but so elegant, unbelievable. After an intense, creamy experience of dark fruits, add a wonderful red peach. Ohh man ... that nose should never end.
Taste Comment: The barrels register themselves on the tongue and tingle. Wow effect. Then the palate keeps what the nose promises. Dark fruits, wonderful oak, followed by the best leather. Everything together also results in fantastic espresso notes.\nHello, Effect ...., my first at the age of 40. Wacky.\nThank you Glenfarclas for making these minis out there!
Finish Comment: I saddle the elegant horse with the sinfully expensive leather saddle. The panniers are filled with wonderful fruits and lead it slowly and proudly out of the precious wood substructure. This experience deserves recognition every second.\nFor this price € 41.90, a masterpiece!

Nose Comment: Beautiful nose. Exoticism galore. Pineapple, mango, tangerine. Peach, passion fruit. Light caramel. Toffee. Light grapes.\nWood, milk chocolate.\nWith aeration a bit more wood.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth we continue in the same line.
Exoticism thoroughly. Papaya passion mango pineapple.
A lot of wood. A little cocoa powder.
Black pepper. A slight bitterness.
Finish Comment: Finale on rancio and fruits at bottom. A bit of bitter cocoa. Light flowers. Sublime and endless.

Nose Comment: Wow, the nose is very powerful and promising - fresh, intense, fruity, cooked fruits galore, oranges, apricots, mango, honey comb, spices, nutmeg, cinnamon, woody notes, a bit meaty, also some hints of green and dried fruits - one of the best and my favorite profile - superb!
Taste Comment: Very oily, waxy, creamy, sirupy, liquorice, (you know what I mean), but also punchy, powerful, more fruity, cooked and dried, jam, ham, subtle sweetness, very good notes of oak wood - excellent
Finish Comment: Long, warm, more powerful, the oak wood is getting a bit louder but still not drying, probably a bit more zesty, some tobacco and teaish notes - a few drops of water make it even better - very good

Nose Comment: An old Laphroaig. Not the fruity tropical kind, but the old, balanced, sweet, herbaceous, earthy type, and with gorgeous peat tempered by time. Love!
Taste Comment: Yup, so beautiful. I like this one a lot. Thick, oily mouthfeel. Honey, ripe orchard fruits, including sweet oranges and lemons, dried fruits, sea salt,and those old, herbal, peaty notes. Very maritime. Tastes like an old Laphroaig. Nothing wrong with that!
Finish Comment: Great stuff from start to finish. Likely an ex-bourbon cask, and not sherry.\nI read whiskyfun comments on this bottling (95 points from Angus) after writing my review, and unlike him, I didn't detect much tropical fruits at all, fwiw.

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: An old Laphroaig. Not the fruity tropical kind, but the old, balanced, sweet, herbaceous, earthy type, and with gorgeous peat tempered by time. Love!

맛(Taste) [점수: 94.0]: Yup, so beautiful. I like this one a lot. Thick, oily mouthfeel. Honey, ripe orchard fruits, including sweet oranges and lemons, dried fruits, sea salt,and those old, herbal, peaty notes. Very maritime. Tastes like an old Laphroaig. Nothing wrong with that!

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 93.0]: Great stuff from start to finish. Likely an ex-bourbon cask, and not sherry.\nI read whiskyfun comments on this bottling (95 points from Angus) after writing my review, and unlike him, I didn't detect much tropical fruits at all, fwiw.

Nose Comment: Gravel, wet stones, old oil-stained cloth, dusty tin box full of very old baseball cards, old gasoline engines, bitter herbs, mixed in with an absolutely deeply pungent, dirty fruitiness that you can only find in old sherry. I am very excited. Yes, I am. Why? Because this is at 57%, so I know this is gonna be quite an experience either way.
Taste Comment: Wow, power! A nice pungency. Oily, metallic, OBE, citrus fruit liqueur, with perhaps something sourish. Conspicuous pepperiness, and then I remembered... this is a Talisker. Haha. Only fault so far is that despite its oiliness, it has a slightly thin mouthfeel. It's not bad, but to garner a huge score, I would like it to be thicker and more mouthcoating. Also a bit on the dry side. I know I sound like a broken record, yes, but you can't find this kind of profile in a modern whisky anymore.
Finish Comment: Sweetness mixed in with some bitterness. Moderate length. There is a lingering pepperiness.
document_text:
위스키 이름: TaliskerPure Highland Malt GM

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: Gravel, wet stones, old oil-stained cloth, dusty tin box full of very old baseball cards, old gasoline engines, bitter herbs, mixed in with an absolutely deeply pungent, dirty fruitiness that you can only find in old sherry. I am very excited. Yes, I am. Why? Because this is at 57%, so I know this is gonna be quite an experience either way.

맛(Taste) [점수: 93.0]: Wow, power! A nice pungency. Oily, metallic, OBE, citrus fruit liqueur, with perhaps something sourish. Conspicuous pepperiness, and then I remembered... this is a Talisker. Haha. Only fault so far is that despite its oiliness, it has a slightly thin mouthfeel. It's not bad, but to garner a huge score, I would like it to be thicker and more mouthcoating. Also a bit on the dry side. I know I sound like a broken record, yes, but you can't find this kind of profile in a modern whisky anymore.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 91.0]: Sweetness mixed in with some bitterness. Moderate length. There is a lingering pepperiness.

Whisky Name: Glen Grant1972 TWA Spirits in the sky
Nose Comment: Big big notes of cherries (dark cherries as well as Portuguese Ginjinha liqueur made from Morello cherries). Lots of dried fruits like figs. Bramble and plums. Dark honey. Precious woods and hints of leather and eucalyptus. Heaps of oriental spices as well (which blend into a kind of incense profile). A drop of water brings out beehive notes and makes the fruits a little more tropical. Just great.
Taste Comment: More oak in the attack, but quickly the fruits take over. Still plenty of cherry notes, plums and mixed red fruit jam, this time combining nicely with a chocolate coating. Fruit cake.
Finish Comment: Long and elegant, fading on Mon Cherie and soft spices.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glen Grant1972 TWA Spirits in the sky

향(Nose): Big big notes of cherries (dark cherries as well as Portuguese Ginjinha liqueur made from Morello cherries). Lots of dried fruits like figs. Bramble and plums. Dark honey. Precious woods and hints of leather and eucalyptus. Heaps of oriental spices as well (which blend into a kind of incense profile). A drop of water brings out beehive notes and makes the fruits a little more tropical. Just great.

맛(Taste): More oak in the attack, but quickly the fruits take over. Still plenty of cherry notes, plums and mixed red fruit jam, this time combining nicely with a chocolate coating. Fruit cake.

피니쉬(Finish): Long and elegant, fading on Mon Cherie and soft spices.

Nose Comment: elegant, for a port Ellen almost discreet, bitter orange, some oyster, camphor, carnation, dry soil, an association of southern France
Taste Comment: Here you have the Provence and the lagoons of the Cote D'azur with their oysters and their herbs, pickled citrus (especially the bitter orange), a touch of salty olive, fresh fruit mingle with the salty sea taste of oysters, camphor, mint, oelig, Fish and herbs on the wood grill, fresh lemons, when swallowing the whisky runs like warm fiery gold in the throat, a longing for warm summer days in the south of France remains and ....
Finish Comment: a long memory of sea and salt, fire and smoke, full-bodied, full life, salt, malt and sweetness and my salt liquorice
