Nose Comment:
Explosive nose. It's quite funny to say that you can feel the "complexity" of a whisky.
Milk chocolate, small almond cracker. Wax, a little solvent, very light smoke. Camphor.
Yellow fruits and a touch of exoticism. Peach, pineapple, lemon, orange and candied orange. Almond milk.
Very nice tension.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth there is a superb balance. It's oily.
Citrus stands out above all. Lemon cut with a knife, juicy and sweet orange, tangerine. Zest.
We have vanilla, chocolate.
Light undergrowth, a little dirtier than on the nose.
In the background, smoke is present. Light tobacco, leather, shoe polish, hay. It's just there to balance and it works perfectly.
Finish Comment: Superb finish on peat, smoke, citrus (mainly lemon), leather and barn. Magnificent.

Nose Comment: Very obvious Sherry at first, mostly on strong plum marmalade. There is something rotten in the most amazing way. Farmy notes (manure), earth, mould. The peat shines through, despite the heavy Sherry maturation. Very present note of Eucalyptus.
Taste Comment: Oily, slightly vegetal arrival. Some damp wood. But it only lasts for a very short time until the oak kicks in, and it's here to stay. You'd have to fight your way through it, to get past it. Astringent and very present alcohol. Water destroys it completely, so that is not an option. There is some depth beyond that, but it is hard to reach. It certainly is mouth coating and there are some redeeming factors.
Finish Comment: Medium to long and briefly oaky. Then some herbs and coffee kick in.

맛(Taste): Oily, slightly vegetal arrival. Some damp wood. But it only lasts for a very short time until the oak kicks in, and it's here to stay. You'd have to fight your way through it, to get past it. Astringent and very present alcohol. Water destroys it completely, so that is not an option. There is some depth beyond that, but it is hard to reach. It certainly is mouth coating and there are some redeeming factors.

Nose Comment: Ah fantastic!  Sultanas, raisins, a whole basket of dried fruit,\nmarinated in a very fine Cognac.  A hint of linseed before the chocolate\nand fresh coffee grounds kick in.  Beautiful.
Taste Comment:
The class carries on here.  More chocolate and coffee supported by
sandalwood and cedar.  Thank god for the extra 3% abv G&M are
leaving in the bottle these days.  I suspect that this dram could stand a
bit more water, but who would risk it?  The mouthfeel is georgeous and
impressive for a whisky at about 39 years old.
Finish Comment: Esspresso and wood spice.  The intensity is huge and enduring.

Nose Comment: Smells like a quintessential Port Ellen, but incredibly balanced. There's the typical tar and charcoal smoke of the distillery, but it's balanced by all these orchard fruits and sour fruits. Ripe apples, kiwis, ripe and crystallized lemons, stewed orange peels, dragon fruit, and prickly pears. Evolves into damp earth, sweet grass, toffee-infused peat
Taste Comment: Oily and ashy at first, then goes more into the fruits. Apple cider, sour kiwi juice, lemon-lime, intensely citric. Gets more salty towards the back of the tongue, with fisherman's nets and smoked kippers. Simple but brilliant, almost more-ish despite the powerful ABV
Finish Comment: Herbal liqueurs, orange and lemon zests, lemon cough drops, menthol, camphor, sour apples, smoky and salty meat sensations, beeswax and other waxy and oily sensations. Extremely long as well, stays with you for a good minute or two

Nose Comment: Bags of mango, passion fruit, and white peaches. Rich Manuka honey and wild beeswax, emphasis on the “wax”. Rum-raisin cake. Mint and old cigar humidor. Some light sea salt, limestone-ish, and dusty parchment sitting in an old, dusty warehouse, with some funky industrial smoke
Taste Comment: Punchy for 46%, but chewy and a great oily texture to it. Upfront it’s the same tropical fruit sweetness, grapefruit and unripe lemons, then becomes more earthy and peaty, like peaty-malty-wild honey
Finish Comment: Fairly long for 46% and drying like a good Oloroso sherry can be. Black pepper, Cuban cigars, salted ham, smoky peaches and cream, funky honey-mustard

Finish Comment: Long herbal gorse flowers, bitter chocolate and hints of the sea.

Nose Comment: Herbal tea, some black tea, tobacco, some cigarette-like smoke (but decreased over time), a lot of earthy notes, musty cellar, forest floor, old wood, including a few "classic" nutty sherry notes and also salty, maritime hints (the ones with increase over time), caramel, something that reminds me of tree sap and also honey
Taste Comment: In the mouth it is initially less heavy and old than the nose suggested, but sweet with a few red fruits, which are rather shy in the face of the ever more present spice. Also a bit sour and I have the association of dark chocolate
Finish Comment: long! slightly salty, honey and wood again, essential oils and some green tea

Nose Comment:
Absolutely evil nose.
Big wood, big fruits, big pepper.
Red fruit (cherry and currant).
A hint of camphor.
It's powerful and intoxicating.
Pretty soon the leather takes a disproportionate place. Without balancing, which is a feat.
Taste Comment: In the mouth it is on the continuity of the nose.\nA little rounder, almost a rubber tip.\nBut clearly it's the fruits and the leather that come out first.
Finish Comment: Long finish on leather and camphorated fruits.

Big wood, big fruits, big pepper.
Red fruit (cherry and currant).
A hint of camphor.
It's powerful and intoxicating.
Pretty soon the leather takes a disproportionate place. Without balancing, which is a feat.

맛(Taste): In the mouth it is on the continuity of the nose.
A little rounder, almost a rubber tip.
But clearly it's the fruits and the leather that come out first.

피니쉬(Finish): Long finish on leather and camphorated fruits.

Nose Comment: Stewed fruits begin on the nose, raisin, juicy apples, prunes, succulent plums bursting with character. The underlying oak presence makes an appearance but for me it reminds me of a old sherry cask where the wood is still drenched with sherry. As I move it more around in the glass a sweeter note comes to the surface and reminds me of melting demerara sugar followed on the end with a mid worn leathery note.
Taste Comment: Next up the palate and we begin things here with an oily mouth coating texture leading into an explosion of mild spices, cinnamon, star anise and all spice. It then follows through with a more richer dark fruitier presence as I'm now finding Blackcurrants, black berries, and a touch of liquorice before the palate begins to dry on a more woody and nutty ending.
Finish Comment: To finally come to the end on this Longmorn, the aromatics of the oak really become further present and almost a walnut note shines through, Tobacco, Dark Chocolate and even a mince pie come to mind on the end. Leaving a nice long finish.

Nose Comment: Bright and clear, the Speyside shines in the glass. While I watch the oily and tough streaks and thick droplets on the glass wall is an extremely fruity bouquet in the air. Powerful and majestic, tropical fruits and overripe apricots emerge from the premium snifter. Velvety and creamy vineyard peach beguiles the nose, the wonderfully fruity nose releases more and more aromas over time. Slightly sour pineapple and a splash of lemon mingle with exotic fruits like mango and papaya. The alcohol appears again and again, but is harmoniously integrated and gives the malt a strong touch. The peach will blend creamy and sweet, thick forest honey and caramel while a very subtle roast flavors in the background. A hint of freshly grated peppermint in the fingers is in the air, from time to time spicy wood tones come into their own. My saliva is now massively stimulated, I could smell for hours on this complex and complex nose ... Just a quick look at the thick drops that still pull their tracks back into the glass in slow motion, gorgeous!
Taste Comment: Respectfully and timidly I take the first small sip. Creamy and fruity, the malt flows over the tongue, intense and old fruit flavors rise. Powerful, the spicy wood elements unfold their intense aroma, a pinch of white pepper spreads on the tongue and between the lips. Dark, dried berries and peaches exude their opulent aroma and zealous with the pleasant sharpness to the bet. While the pleasant sharpness is on the decline, spicy wood tones and a hint of walnut aroma come to light more and more intensively. Lightly burnt caramel mixes with a touch Espresso, tart and spicy pieces of wood rest creamy on the tongue. At the moment, the old and venerable woody aromas dominate the aroma, here and there a touch of sweet vanilla comes into its own. The fruity elements slowly reappear, old and dried peach slices are covered with sticky and dark honey. The whole time is a subtle peppermint aroma in the background and represents a wonderful contrast to the fruity sweetness.
Finish Comment: With this now surprisingly dominant mint in the background, the taste goes into the reverberation. The old and partly bitter oak flavors still rest on the tongue and exude their creamy mouthfeel, the subtle sharpness in the form of now black pepper is now also more prevalent. Old and dried grated coconut also appear all of a sudden and mingle with peach and pineapple. Again and again, new flavors and nuances, the mint and the creamy oak never seem to want to end. The coconut flavor is picking up speed and wants to replace the mint and the creamy wood tones, this succeeds only partially. Slowly, really only very slowly, the Speyside finally sounds and leaves a contented grin on my face.
document_text:

Nose Comment: The nose starts floral with hints of cut grass and apple-mint. Mineral notes of wet stones and chalk. Barley sugar as well. After a while the classic Ardbeg citrussy notes of lemon and lime intermingled with soft smoke come through Complex but very fragile at the same time.
Taste Comment: Now more on the peaty side of the spectrum. So plenty of phenols, kippery notes of dried shellfish and smoked mussels. Anchovies and salmon on a barbecue. Brimstone. Later on oaky notes of sandalwood. Sultanas and toasted almonds as well. It's all quite 'naked' and clean.
Finish Comment: Medium long and drying. Iodine and kelp. A little Ginger. Roasted coffee. Vicks and old leather at the end.
document_text:

태그: Oily,Chocolate,Citric,Fresh Fruit,Hay-like,Leafy,Mossy,New Wood,Smokey,Tobacco

향(Nose): The nose starts floral with hints of cut grass and apple-mint. Mineral notes of wet stones and chalk. Barley sugar as well. After a while the classic Ardbeg citrussy notes of lemon and lime intermingled with soft smoke come through Complex but very fragile at the same time.

맛(Taste): Now more on the peaty side of the spectrum. So plenty of phenols, kippery notes of dried shellfish and smoked mussels. Anchovies and salmon on a barbecue. Brimstone. Later on oaky notes of sandalwood. Sultanas and toasted almonds as well. It's all quite 'naked' and clean.

피니쉬(Finish): Medium long and drying. Iodine and kelp. A little Ginger. Roasted coffee. Vicks and old leather at the end.

Nose Comment: So old and so fresh on the nose, no trace of the 58%, burnt Catalan cream with strong Madagascar Vanilla, butter biscuit, mint, white chocolate, light caramel, apricot, wax, fresh oak, light orange and grapefruit, incense.\nWhat an incredible nose, perfectly balanced, delicate and generous.
Taste Comment: Bold and deep, totally exquisite, in the continuity of the delicious nose, with more cake of grandma, tropical fruits, no doubt for this, but also a superb smoke, added to a kind of smoked herbs with a certain acidity,
Finish Comment: No more word, just a dream for a long time, mixing all what we get to the nose and the mouth.

Nose Comment: Intense, tropical fruits galore, mango, pineapple, passion fruit, some ripe orchard fruits too, apricot, apple, cooked oranges, spices, cinnamon, cloves, honeycomb, hints of pepper, wooden cabinet and furniture polish, toffee, little nuts, hints of menthol and eucalyptus, touch of finest leather, whiffs of tobacco and vanilla - superb!
Taste Comment: Oily, creamy, fruity, little punchy, spicy, hints of liquorice, multiple layers of honey, good sweetness, more tropical fruits and ripe orchard fruits, more cooked oranges and orange peel, jam, citrusy, spices, cinnamon, pepper, hints of ginger, little camphor, fine oak wood, oak spice, toffee, some herbs - delicious!
Finish Comment: Long, warm, very fruity, spicy, little zesty, peppery, some woody notes but not drying, herbs, more orange peel, more ginger, cinnamon, more pipe tobacco, toffee, some caramel, some leafy hints and probably a bit herbacious - excellent!

위스키 이름: A Secret Speyside Distillery1968 BR
태그: Citric,Cooked Fruit,Fresh Fruit,Honey,New Wood,Tobacco,Vanilla

향(Nose) [점수: 97.0]: Intense, tropical fruits galore, mango, pineapple, passion fruit, some ripe orchard fruits too, apricot, apple, cooked oranges, spices, cinnamon, cloves, honeycomb, hints of pepper, wooden cabinet and furniture polish, toffee, little nuts, hints of menthol and eucalyptus, touch of finest leather, whiffs of tobacco and vanilla - superb!

맛(Taste) [점수: 96.0]: Oily, creamy, fruity, little punchy, spicy, hints of liquorice, multiple layers of honey, good sweetness, more tropical fruits and ripe orchard fruits, more cooked oranges and orange peel, jam, citrusy, spices, cinnamon, pepper, hints of ginger, little camphor, fine oak wood, oak spice, toffee, some herbs - delicious!

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: Long, warm, very fruity, spicy, little zesty, peppery, some woody notes but not drying, herbs, more orange peel, more ginger, cinnamon, more pipe tobacco, toffee, some caramel, some leafy hints and probably a bit herbacious - excellent!

Nose Comment: It takes a short time until it settles in the glass and you can really start to nose it. Then it starts immediately with a large quantity of different chocolates, marzipan and cherries. In addition, a clear but positive wood note. With velvet polish. Other fruits will be added over time. More towards citrus. Orange and grapefruit come to mind. In addition, a certain spice with tobacco, liquorice and aniseed. I don't think it can be surpassed in terms of complexity and depth.
Taste Comment: It transports the "seasoning" directly to the tongue. Together with pepper and a slight ginger spiciness. Then comes a whole swing of salt and with it bitter fruit juices. Over time, this is then turned into black tea that has been washed down with lemon. There are also a lot of bitter notes. Now less of cocoa, more of fruit peel and a little coffee.
Finish Comment: The intensity is simply overwhelming. A cracked liqueur praline made from the finest dark chocolate, filled with the best fruit brandy imaginable. Then someone turns the sensory regulator to 11. When that has subsided at some point – and that takes 1-2 minutes – then comes a whole basket of overripe fruit that has already become schnapps.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Glen Grant1972 DT

Nose Comment: The fruit brandy distilled with the 72-year-old big cat's production equipment is only meaningful in the fat and oily body of the most whisky. Peach, green apple fudge, blueberry, star fruit, banana boat, myrtle, sweet potato strips, pineapple filling, lemon pie crust, passion fruit dessert, plum, high sweetness, moderate acidity, and very little salt. Nectar, amber walnut, wheat fragrance, syrup, chocolate powder, ginkgo, aromatic grass, pot ash at the end.
Taste Comment: Fruit platter, jasmine tea, Longjing, white peach, slightly green plantain, parsley, magnolia, gorgon lily porridge. More coffee grounds, wood chips, grass seeds, salt and pepper ginkgo. If the wine body is not 50%, it will collapse. It is estimated that it will collapse after another year.\nNormal, normal fat, sweet, little sour, no tannins, no astringency, a little bitterness, no pungency, no alcohol.
Finish Comment: Longer, fruit tea, a little oak and pepper, salt, matcha ice cream.
document_text:

향(Nose) [점수: 92.0]: mmmmmmmmmm

맛(Taste) [점수: 90.0]: The taste of an older Bowmore with a hint of cinnamon

Nose Comment: Loads of dried herbs... all kinds. Black tea. Blackcurrant juice. Blueberries. Earthy forest, full of mist, cool air, and a hint of mint. Mushrooms! The good kind! Seriously, this is a very nice beginning to a tasting!
Taste Comment: Certainly high strength, but actually rather balanced, to be honest, for something that is 61% in ABV. Oh, this is so typical Karuizawa.. with an elegant sherried profile combined with a certain dirtiness, less so dirty here than some others. Again, lots of mushrooms.
Finish Comment: Terrific stuff. It's not mindblowingly great, but it's unique (ie.. it's a Karuizawa).

Nose Comment: Intense, generous, harmonious, balanced !\nGrapefruit, passion fruits, lime zest, sweet light brown tobacco, super fine and thin smoke could be perceived, old leather, old book.
Taste Comment: Medium body but still dense, composed and intense, super multilayered and complex. Really old material here, impressive, old dust of old book, old dark vanilla, all kind of ripe exotic fruits, super lemony and superb nice smoke.
Finish Comment: Medium long, in the same vein as the mouth, the smoke is stronger here, which is super enjoyable, but a bit too short for me, to enjoy this beauty.\nFor sure a profil we can't find now !\nMany thanks for the sample :))

Nose Comment:
velvety light brown raisins
lilac
vanilla
delicate sourish note in the background
Resin from fresh wood
some coconut
nutmeg
a touch of cardamom
crumbly dry chocolate with fresh apricot
The apricot with its juicy firm flesh is increasingly coming to the fore
the spiciness remains behind
velvety skin, firm sweet meat
spicy exotic
Your mouth is getting wet
you would like to bite
Taste Comment:
soft and supple on your lips
fruity spicy in your mouth
Wood is painted on deck
You think it is too fresh for it, it will break soon
the girl comes out of the galley
it smells of freshly ground coffee
the roasted aromas lure you
Nutmeg and chocolate sprinkle over your coffee
and smiles
it smells wonderful
Your mouth is dry
She takes one of the apricots
Your lips are getting wet from the juice
You feel how well it fits
Toasted aromas with tart chocolate, nutmeg and apricot meat
Wow
Finish Comment:
long and perfect
You go through it again and again
and it is always something different
the nutmeg sticks to the old wood
the end:
"now it's the porous old wood fibers of the barrel ..
They are soft and still release last old aromas from the long barrel and whisky marriage
the cachous shimmer again and again ...
Baked apple juice ..... "

Nose Comment: A big dose of menthol and cough candy hits you first, followed by some honey, hints of orange, brine and peat.\nAfter a few minutes in the glass some gooseberry and cream is evident, strange but true, finally warm pastry,
Taste Comment: The peat is evident here mixed in with slightly bitter plum, touch of grapefruit and various fruit skins with just a little prune juice in the mix.\nThe peat and fruit mix well here and the peat grows on the palate all the time mixed with smokiness.
Finish Comment: Considering this is only 40% there is some power there, more abv would have really brought the flavours out

Nose Comment: Sangria sherry fruity nose. You can sense the infused fruits from this fruit cocktail. Classic deep rich sherry first fill oak; a totally vintage nose. Some leather, honey, vanilla, cardamom, celery salt, the nose feel of citrus zest. Brings just enough ethanol.
Taste Comment: oak citrus mild sour, honey, slight coffee, licorice twig, cedar. A sort of wood homage, Not as much sweet as I'd expect from the nose, but more nuanced oak spice. I expected more sherry sweet on this given the nose.
Finish Comment: The sherry sour, old oak, more licorice twig, slight drying with warming. more spice, but dry warming, not as bright. Like a sherry finished single malt tongue depressor without the dram, none of the choke, and all of the fanfare tucked only 3/4s of the palate. Can be slightly off, unsure if slightly soapy, but the finish encourages me tongue to reach for the roof of my mouth to extract more.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Aberlour1958
태그: Leathery,Old Wood

향(Nose) [점수: 95.0]: Sangria sherry fruity nose. You can sense the infused fruits from this fruit cocktail. Classic deep rich sherry first fill oak; a totally vintage nose. Some leather, honey, vanilla, cardamom, celery salt, the nose feel of citrus zest. Brings just enough ethanol.

맛(Taste) [점수: 91.0]: oak citrus mild sour, honey, slight coffee, licorice twig, cedar. A sort of wood homage, Not as much sweet as I'd expect from the nose, but more nuanced oak spice. I expected more sherry sweet on this given the nose.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: The sherry sour, old oak, more licorice twig, slight drying with warming. more spice, but dry warming, not as bright. Like a sherry finished single malt tongue depressor without the dram, none of the choke, and all of the fanfare tucked only 3/4s of the palate. Can be slightly off, unsure if slightly soapy, but the finish encourages me tongue to reach for the roof of my mouth to extract more.

Nose Comment: A huge basket of stewed fruits, Christmas fruits the crystallised type fruit jellies, various fruit peels, orange, lemon, lime, shoe polish, furniture polish and something a little medicinal and then a few grassy notes, smelling more like a rich liqueur as you go on.\nThe orange spice note mixed with iron-brew/Lucozade is a real treat.
Taste Comment: Rich, viscous and it has a clynelish waxiness like the highly acclaimed 17 year manager's dram but there is more, a superb fruit gum mix on top of that.\nThere is some peat mixing with the fruit and there is a slight walnut taste in the mix with an almost Cointreau like edge but the few drops of water have not tamed this enough so I will add a few more.\nYes much better , less sherbet fizz that allows the succulent fruit to shine
Finish Comment: Rich, layers of fruit and something medicinal but I cannot put my finger on it.\nIt gets really syrupy and the fruit zest washes over your tongue
document_text:

향(Nose) [점수: 94.0]: A huge basket of stewed fruits, Christmas fruits the crystallised type fruit jellies, various fruit peels, orange, lemon, lime, shoe polish, furniture polish and something a little medicinal and then a few grassy notes, smelling more like a rich liqueur as you go on.\nThe orange spice note mixed with iron-brew/Lucozade is a real treat.

맛(Taste) [점수: 93.0]: Rich, viscous and it has a clynelish waxiness like the highly acclaimed 17 year manager's dram but there is more, a superb fruit gum mix on top of that.\nThere is some peat mixing with the fruit and there is a slight walnut taste in the mix with an almost Cointreau like edge but the few drops of water have not tamed this enough so I will add a few more.\nYes much better , less sherbet fizz that allows the succulent fruit to shine

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: Rich, layers of fruit and something medicinal but I cannot put my finger on it.\nIt gets really syrupy and the fruit zest washes over your tongue

Nose Comment: A nice, light fruity note at the beginning. Ripe bananas, tangerines, and unripe mangoes and guavas. Plus everything from the bee. From honey to propolis to beeswax. Maybe a little lamp oil and polish too. That works then. A light vanilla scent is mixed in somewhere underneath. The alcohol strength is very present, but not unpleasant. After a long time, a fine smoke appears. Like a very faint glimmer of wood chips.
Taste Comment: He attacks directly. With spices and sweetness in perfect balance. Ginger and pepper, doused with honey and sugar syrup. After a short time that subsides and the sweetness dominates. This is where the old wood comes into play. With bitter substances and polish. The whole thing is surrounded or rather accompanied by the fruit note, peppered with menthol and mint. Bananas are back, and especially guava.
Finish Comment: A little different from sip to sip. Sometimes the fruits can prevail, sometimes the cask makes a statement. Between fruity and dry. Between white wine and spicy tea. The spices can also play along again. It's just a dream. It then also becomes dry and bitter. I would say what was predictable. In any case, this is not a problem.
document_text:

Maybe a little lamp oil and polish too. That works then. A light vanilla scent is mixed in somewhere underneath. The alcohol strength is very present, but not unpleasant. After a long time, a fine smoke appears. Like a very faint glimmer of wood chips.

맛(Taste) [점수: 91.0]: He attacks directly. With spices and sweetness in perfect balance. Ginger and pepper, doused with honey and sugar syrup. After a short time that subsides and the sweetness dominates. This is where the old wood comes into play. With bitter substances and polish. The whole thing is surrounded or rather accompanied by the fruit note, peppered with menthol and mint. Bananas are back, and especially guava.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: A little different from sip to sip. Sometimes the fruits can prevail, sometimes the cask makes a statement. Between fruity and dry. Between white wine and spicy tea. The spices can also play along again. It's just a dream. It then also becomes dry and bitter. I would say what was predictable. In any case, this is not a problem.

Nose Comment: After three quarters of an hour in the Premium Snifter, the Glenfarclas develops an enormous honey sweetness with a juicy-firm pear with beautiful clarity. Add to that this very special age note, which leads into a deep, dry wine cellar. From the background, the elegant oak finally emerges and primers the pear and honey flavors.
Taste Comment: The first appearance is determined by honey, pear, pleasant waxiness. Then follow delicate oak notes, everything wonderfully clear and finely graduated. The honey and fruit notes are less prominent in the first appearance than in the nose on the palate, the oak notes, the old wine cellar, the waxiness in combination with the forest herbs play the lead role. Pleasant tingling with a surprisingly pleasant oak and herbal spice.
Finish Comment: The finish continues the palate impression: The oak is now a little more intense, the forest floor moist, pear and honey recede into the background. However, you are back in the Ausklangsverlauf, because the departure is indeed very, very long and varied. Since the 38 years beat in full splendor.

The honey and fruit notes are less prominent in the first appearance than in the nose on the palate, the oak notes, the old wine cellar, the waxiness in combination with the forest herbs play the lead role. Pleasant tingling with a surprisingly pleasant oak and herbal spice.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 96.0]: The finish continues the palate impression: The oak is now a little more intense, the forest floor moist, pear and honey recede into the background. However, you are back in the Ausklangsverlauf, because the departure is indeed very, very long and varied. Since the 38 years beat in full splendor.

Nose Comment: Beautiful old sherry nose with lots of prunes, cherries and raspberries. Christmas cake all the way. Balsamico vinegar and Kirsch liqueur at the same time. Raisins. Pipe Tobacco and cigar boxes. Hints of old leather at the background.
Taste Comment: Rich and round with an attractive oiliness. Truck loads of tannins, but who cares! Orange marmalade, coffee beans and dark chocolate. It's kind of 'obvious', in a classic way. Later on more on Lapsang souchong tea. Cinnamon and a little ginger. After eight pralines and some earthy notes.
Finish Comment: Long and warming. Quite dry. Clove and nutmeg. Pine at the end.

Nose Comment: Heavy sherry. Sweet and sticky. Oak is also with me. Leather resonates. Chocolate - both dark and milk chocolate. Herb candies (Ricola) are here. A freshly baked plum and cinnamon pastry is lying around somewhere, it's still quite warm. Someone poured a lot of sweet syrup over it. Or was it the maggi bottle? Probably both! Once the palate is involved, the chocolate becomes more intense and rosemary is added very slightly.
Taste Comment: Full and sparkling. Quite sweet with cherries and plums. The oak is immediately everywhere and captivates the mouth with a tingling sensation. She lets some tobacco through. Then she lets through dried fruit, fermented fruit, dusty cupboard wall that sucks up all the sweetness for a moment. The aftertaste is initially sweet and sticky, then becomes increasingly dry.
Finish Comment: Forever long and dry with dark fruits.
document_text:

맛(Taste): Full and sparkling. Quite sweet with cherries and plums. The oak is immediately everywhere and captivates the mouth with a tingling sensation. She lets some tobacco through. Then she lets through dried fruit, fermented fruit, dusty cupboard wall that sucks up all the sweetness for a moment. The aftertaste is initially sweet and sticky, then becomes increasingly dry.

피니쉬(Finish): Forever long and dry with dark fruits.

Nose Comment:
A powerful nose, but can we be almost 65% surprised?
Lemon peat, sesame oil, spray.
We also have a nice minerality, with limestone and chalk.
Light acacia honey, quickly overtaken by pepper and ginger.
The peat is clean, chiseled, almost "brora-esque", with a very slight dirty-clean feel.
With aeration, the dirty-clean turns into dirty-dirty with a little stable.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth, despite the degree, it is not too aggressive.
The peat is much more forward than the nose, heavy, herbaceous.
We have a lot of camphor, medicinal.
It's earthy, with mud, from the stable.
Then pepper, wood, a little barbecue embers.
Lemon, orange. As fresh as with zest.
Finish Comment: Long, lemony finish, again very salty.\nChopped peat, smoke, camphor, eucalyptus.\nEarth, spices.

Nose Comment: Polished wood, furniture polish, ground leather, old spine with a little warmth show sweet floral aromas that remind me of lilac and freshly blooming roses, then sourly fruity sherry aroma rises - red groats, raspberry pulp, you can already smell the tannins, and there is delicate chocolate , more leather, sweet tobacco
Taste Comment: Dried plums, sawdust from old wood, subtle mint freshness mixes with dried figs and dates, bramble, blueberries, always present venerable notes of old polished wood - always subtle, always a backdrop - very tasty and never obligatory - balance and understatement with perfect texture - works he is a bit reluctant with the first sip, so he builds up more volume with each further sip - chewing brings me a delicate, tasty, subtle note of sulfur - more old rather musty wood, forest floor, walnut, hazelnut chocolate,
Finish Comment: he suffers a little from chewing him so long because he is just so good - nevertheless he is the weakest in the finish compared to the nose and palate and does not bring me anything new here - flawless - medium length

Nose Comment: Massive nose it almost surprises you. It’s not the alcohol that hits you but the woods. All the woods. Polished woods, antique wood, resinous woods, fresh stained woods. That’s not to say it’s over-oaked, but definitely trending towards Armagnac/Cognac. Rancio, raisins, then into the coffee grounds, balsamic definitely. It’s all about the wood and the sherry. Dark cherries but also lots of herbs. Tinctures, herb oil. Ink. It’s a big boy.
Taste Comment: Comes in hot, not over-oaked, it’s all harmonious but make no mistake the wood is there. Cherry jam, raisins, more balsamic and now some drying leather. Definitely more towards Armagnac. You could save a few bucks by going that route; that’s for sure.
Finish Comment: Flashes of tropical fruit. Mango and melon. Still lots of the aforementioned woods, herbs, leather(dry) bitter espresso. Love that flash of tropical fruit but it’s really all about the sherry and wood here.

Dark cherries but also lots of herbs. Tinctures, herb oil. Ink. It’s a big boy.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Flashes of tropical fruit. Mango and melon. Still lots of the aforementioned woods, herbs, leather(dry) bitter espresso. Love that flash of tropical fruit but it’s really all about the sherry and wood here.

Nose Comment: Nice strength, got some kick to this, very jammy, with lively old sherry, menthol, raisins, and prunes. A bit of oak to this also. The balance, despite the high ABV, is impressive.
Taste Comment: The color is not very dark, but it tastes like dark, dark old sherry. Wow, this is absolutely spectacular! Concentrated prune juice, elderberry syrup, blackberry jam. Has a salty edge. The strength is perfect. The oak is present, but not egregious. Juice like this is why old Springbank sherry casks command such premiums in today's market.
Finish Comment: Good balance, lasting thick, luscious, well-integrated old sherry notes.

Has a salty edge. The strength is perfect. The oak is present, but not egregious. Juice like this is why old Springbank sherry casks command such premiums in today's market.

Nose Comment: Extremely rich and flavorful, big and loud sour plum integrated with the old school fresh sherry notes. Smell of concentrated soy sauce, reminds me of my field day at Bidor Kwong Heng factory (one of the major soy sauce factory in Malaysia) many years ago. Waves and waves of multi-layered dried fruits (figs, prunes, plums, dates). Behind the heavy sherry notes, there are hints of leather with slight tad of rubbery, and faint saltiness. After some time, the fruitiness is more expressive and intriguing, coupled with some lovely waxiness and sourness. The Glencairn brings out more of the leathery, cocoa and funky notes. The mustiness adds another dimension to the nose which is very well integrated with the other aromas.
Taste Comment: Full and rich and vibrant. Umami! The soy sauce note is quite loud in the arrival, with all the dried fruits described in the nose follow behind. Dark chocolate, various nuts, licorice. Lots of spices as well. Some sweet tropical fruits appears after a few sips.
Finish Comment: Never ending dried fruits and nuttiness, rather waxy as well. Dark chocolate, some leather and rubber. Fruity and tannins. Very long finish.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Longmorn1965 GM

향(Nose) [점수: 95.0]: Extremely rich and flavorful, big and loud sour plum integrated with the old school fresh sherry notes. Smell of concentrated soy sauce, reminds me of my field day at Bidor Kwong Heng factory (one of the major soy sauce factory in Malaysia) many years ago. Waves and waves of multi-layered dried fruits (figs, prunes, plums, dates). Behind the heavy sherry notes, there are hints of leather with slight tad of rubbery, and faint saltiness. After some time, the fruitiness is more expressive and intriguing, coupled with some lovely waxiness and sourness. The Glencairn brings out more of the leathery, cocoa and funky notes. The mustiness adds another dimension to the nose which is very well integrated with the other aromas.

맛(Taste) [점수: 91.0]: Full and rich and vibrant. Umami! The soy sauce note is quite loud in the arrival, with all the dried fruits described in the nose follow behind. Dark chocolate, various nuts, licorice. Lots of spices as well. Some sweet tropical fruits appears after a few sips.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 90.0]: Never ending dried fruits and nuttiness, rather waxy as well. Dark chocolate, some leather and rubber. Fruity and tannins. Very long finish.

Nose Comment: It needs some time in the glass. But then it has the best sherry aroma I've ever had in a whisky. Incredibly deep, incredibly dark. You practically don't notice the alcohol at all.\nIt is also extremely complex. Notes range from leather, jam, plums, blackcurrant, a little cellar mustiness and overripe peach. With plenty of time you will certainly find more notes.
Taste Comment: The taste confirms what the nose suggested, but with an incomparable intensity. You can now tell that this is a cask strength.\nSlightly less sweet than on the nose, slightly tart, dark fruits with a distinct leather note dominate.
Finish Comment: It lasts a really long time and even gets a bit fruitier towards the end. The inside of the cheeks in particular retains the aroma forever and rounds off the outstanding experience in a fitting way.
document_text:

향(Nose) [점수: 95.0]: It needs some time in the glass. But then it has the best sherry aroma I've ever had in a whisky. Incredibly deep, incredibly dark. You practically don't notice the alcohol at all.\nIt is also extremely complex. Notes range from leather, jam, plums, blackcurrant, a little cellar mustiness and overripe peach. With plenty of time you will certainly find more notes.

맛(Taste) [점수: 95.0]: The taste confirms what the nose suggested, but with an incomparable intensity. You can now tell that this is a cask strength.\nSlightly less sweet than on the nose, slightly tart, dark fruits with a distinct leather note dominate.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 94.0]: It lasts a really long time and even gets a bit fruitier towards the end. The inside of the cheeks in particular retains the aroma forever and rounds off the outstanding experience in a fitting way.

Nose Comment:
Gorgeous. A magnificent roundness.
The fruit is rolled up, camphorated, waxed. Blood orange, citrus, plum, raspberry.
Slight rancio.
Precious wood, shoe polish cream.
Camphor, bandage, mercurochrome.
Airing adds exoticism.
Taste Comment: In the mouth it is long, camphorated, oily.\nExotic fruits, pineapple, passion, mango, papaya. Gorgeous. It's waxed, honeyed, camphorated.\nLavender, white pepper.
Finish Comment: Long finish on exoticism, pepper, precious wood, a filigree of peat and cold ash.
document_text:
위스키 이름: Lagavulin25-year-old
태그: Smokey,Old Wood,Rubbery,Sherried,Citric,Coal-gas,Hay-like,Mossy

향(Nose) [점수: 93.0]: Gorgeous. A magnificent roundness.\nThe fruit is rolled up, camphorated, waxed. Blood orange, citrus, plum, raspberry.\nSlight rancio.\nPrecious wood, shoe polish cream.\nCamphor, bandage, mercurochrome.\nAiring adds exoticism.

맛(Taste) [점수: 93.0]: In the mouth it is long, camphorated, oily.\nExotic fruits, pineapple, passion, mango, papaya. Gorgeous. It's waxed, honeyed, camphorated.\nLavender, white pepper.

피니쉬(Finish) [점수: 92.0]: Long finish on exoticism, pepper, precious wood, a filigree of peat and cold ash.

Nose Comment:
A fabulous nose.
Fresh, fruity, exotic. A winning combo.
What a pleasure to start with these exotic fruits, papaya, guava, passion fruit, pomegranate and a little blood orange. It is precise and delicate at the same time.
These fruits are wrapped in a veil of camphor, mint and almost a light coriander.
The wood is there, old and dry, more discreet than in many old Glendronachs. It is still accompanied by a nice dark chocolate coulis.
Taste Comment:
In the mouth, the sweetness takes the front.
It almost has the texture of a cough syrup.
Molasses, melted dark chocolate, cinnamon, cloves, wood and its varnish.
The fruit is darker, jammy. Blackberry, blackcurrant, fig. We always have a little exoticism, but it is more discreet.
Licorice, camphor, pepper.
Finish Comment: Long, spicy finish, on molasses, pepper, cloves. Slightly dusty precious wood.

The wood is there, old and dry, more discreet than in many old Glendronachs. It is still accompanied by a nice dark chocolate coulis.
